Cervar talked about the rivalry with Veselin Vujovic, HC PPD Zagreb's coach: "In my career, I have always had respect for the other coaches. We are happy that we have a coach like Lino Cervar and I know that a lot of players would like to be in our place. The Democratic Governance Division is responsible for overseeing the work of the intergovernmental European Committee on Democracy and Governance and the assistance and cooperation activities implemented by the Centre of Expertise for Good Governance aimed at improving legislation in the area of decentralisation and public administration and at strengthening the institutional capacity of local, regional and central authorities.

There, under the plane trees, they started their honeymoon, and Europa later gave birth to three sons – Minos, Sarpedon and Rhadamanthus. Then, the princess, without being afraid of the handsome creature, approached it and began to caress it, to pat it; then holding her bouquet of flowers she hopped its back; and immediately caught its gilded horns. Zeus conveyed Europa on the island of Crete; in the famous Dikteon Cave. In order to perpetuate this love with the Princess Europa Zeus ordered the Cretan maple trees never to lose their leaves. This God fell in love with the Princess Europa passionately In order to get close to her, he decided to disguise as a bull with white, bright and dazzling beauty, scented with a pink and saffron cologne. The bull immediately as a lightning came down with an unseen and unheard of speed in the water; with the prey on its back and parted away from the coast of Phoenicia. Today, one of the continents of the world, where Crete itself is positioned; is named after his favorite and beloved princess Europe. That is the reason that today, the largest satellite on the planet Jupiter bears the name of Europe. While collecting flowers and weaving a wreath she caught the attention of the almighty Zeus, known in mythology as father of the Gods. In this action he was accompanied by his brother Poseidon, Amphitrite, the goddess of the seas and Aphrodite, the goddess of beauty and love. The Romans borrowed this myth too, where the supreme god is Jupiter.

The temperature of the water in the surface levels during July and August varies between 13 and 17°C, and in winter time the lake freezes over. Golemo ezero (Big Lake), situated on altitude of 2218metres, is one of the highest located glacial lakes in Macedonia. The time needed for going along this 17 km long trek is about 5 hours. Gradually, form the open part of the mountain you cross into the forest overgrown with oak and beech trees and move alongside the flow of the Brajchinska river. Going through many curves in a zigzag line, following the old trenches and bunkers from World War I, you can reach the area called Panorama from where you can enter the area of the Brajchino village. Its length is 230metres, its width is 162metres and it is up to 17metres deep. The trek also leads to the forest belt and alongside a small fountain as well as a deserted sheepfold under the Marushica peak. Due to their enormous beauty, Golemo Ezero (Big Lake),along with Malo Ezero (Small Lake), which is located nearby, are also known as Pelister's eyes . Three day weekend – Golemo Ezero, Antenna, v. At about 2 km in front of the village the trek crosses the river over a bridge nearby the St. Ilija church and goes along the forest road by the old sawmill entering the Brajchino village from the east side. The transparency of the water with its turquoise colour goes up to 12metres. The trail starting point is the mountain hut at Big Lake and from there on it goes along the so called French trek, which dates from World War I, and reaches the mountain col in front of Orlovi Bari after which you can continue through a pass to the Prespa's part of Baba mountain.

Compliance Program In accordance with Article 73 of the Law on Energy ("Official Gazette of the RM" No.96/18) the Transmission System Operator, regardless its organizational structure, is obliged to adopt Compliance Program, which shall define the measures that have to contribute to prevent discrimination against the users of the transmission system, to determine the duties of the employees concerning the implementation of the Program, and to determine the manner of monitoring the implementation of the same. In accordance with Article 73 of the Law on Energy ("Official Gazette of the RM" No.96/18) the Transmission System Operator, regardless its organizational structure, is obliged to adopt Compliance Program, which shall define the measures that have to contribute to prevent discrimination against the users of the transmission system, to determine the duties of the employees concerning the implementation of the Program, and to determine the manner of monitoring the implementation of the same. The Compliance Program in English language - downloaded here. The Program is aimed at transparent and objective treatment by AD MEPSO – Skopje in favor of the users of the power system. This Compliance Program determines the measures that exclude the possibility of the Transmission System Operator of the Republic of North Macedonia, Joint Stock Company for Transmission of Electricity and Power System Management in State Ownership, AD MEPSO – Skopje to discriminate users of the power system on any grounds; it defines the obligations of the employees concerning the implementation of the Program; and it determines the manner of monitoring the activity of AD MEPSO – Skopje in terms of the ownership separation and other obligations laid down by the Law on Energy and this Program.

The Free SOS line for children and youth 0800 12222 offers services that are of great importance to help children and protect their rights. We give thanks to Macedonian Telecom in 2005 which provides a free line to call for all our Children's and young people. Simultaneously, the First Children's Embassy in the World, with the intervention of these cases, cooperate with the Ombudsman, and for certain cases when its necessary to guide its intervention to the police, courts, social welfare centers, schools and other relevant institutions. From the year 1993-2010 18 023 cases were registered. The SOS telephone for children and young 0800 12222 within the First Children's Embassy in the World Megjashi has continuously been working for 17 years. The function of the SOS telephones is of knowledge and importance because they represent an important mechanism linking hundreds of children allowing the voices of every girl and boy to be heard. This service enables many young people, students and professionals - psychologists, social workers, lawyers and so on. The National Network to End Violence against Women and Domestic Violence expresses its concern in these times as the home is not a safe place for many women victims of domestic and intimate-partner violence. All calls for reporting domestic violence must be treated as the highest priority and all measures for protection must be undertaken. We are encouraging all women who are suffering any form of domestic or intimate-partner violence to report the same to the institution/organization in the place where they live. Below is a list of existing services by towns. Due to the current developments with the COVID-19 virus, on 11 March our Government adopted additional measures and recommendations for all citizens in the country and announce a state of emergency for a period of 30 days. The National Network to End Violence against Women and Domestic Violence expresses its concern in these times as the home is not a safe place for many women victims of domestic and intimate-partner violence. Due to the current developments with the COVID-19 virus, on 11 March our Government adopted additional measures and recommendations for all citizens in the country and announce a state of emergency for a period of 30 days. One of the main recommendations for preventing the spread of the virus is that all citizens stay home. In a country under a state of emergency, children stay at home for the entire day. All cafes, restaurants, bars and betting shops are closed, leaving people with limited options for socializing. Friends are at home with their families, and all places where people could channel their aggression are closed. It is a well-known fact that one of the main triggers of domestic violence is the need to exert power and control over others. The state of emergency may not necessarily lead to an increase in the number of domestic violence cases (although it is not unlikely), but it will certainly lead to an increase in the intensity of the violence in the marriages and partnerships where it is already present. All calls for reporting domestic violence must be treated as the highest priority and all measures for protection must be undertaken. All calls for reporting domestic violence must be treated as the highest priority and all measures for protection must be undertaken. The victim has nowhere to go, cannot escape the perpetrator by going to work or at friends', and she is exposed to violence throughout the day. Medical institutions are fighting to respond to the Coronavirus challenge, the health system has limited capacities, the centers for social work operate via telephone calls, which taken together makes victims' access to protection more difficult. It is a well-known fact that one of the main triggers of domestic violence is the need to exert power and control over others. Medical institutions are fighting to respond to the Coronavirus challenge, the health system has limited capacities, the centers for social work operate via telephone calls, which taken together makes victims' access to protection more difficult. We are calling upon all competent institutions – the Ministry of Labor and Social Policy, the Ministry of Interior and the Ministry of Health, regardless of the current situation, to act professionally with regard to all reports of domestic violence and to undertake all measures at their disposal in order to protect victims and their children (if they have any). Since 2000, the proportion of the population practicing open defecation has been halved, from 21 per cent to 9 per cent, and 23 countries have achieved near elimination, meaning less than 1 per cent of the population is practicing open defecation. “If countries fail to step up efforts on sanitation, safe water and hygiene, we will continue to live with diseases that should have been long ago consigned to the history books: diseases like diarrhoea, cholera, typhoid, hepatitis A and neglected tropical diseases including trachoma, intestinal worms and schistosomiasis. New report on inequalities in access to water, sanitation and hygiene also reveals more than half of the world does not have access to safe sanitation services. **Basic services: Having a protected drinking water source that takes less than thirty minutes to collect water from, using an improved toilet or latrine that does not have to be shared with other households, and having handwashing facilities with soap and water in the home. 1 in 3 people globally do not have access to safe drinking water – UNICEF, WHO The report reveals that 1.8 billion people have gained access to basic drinking water services since 2000, but there are vast inequalities in the accessibility, availability and quality of these services. It is estimated that 1 in 10 people (785 million) still lack basic services, including the 144 million who drink untreated surface water.

A sustainable story" Fashion Weekend Skopje in cooperation with the Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Macedonia, the Ministry of Culture of the Republic of Macedonia (Within the project "New Cultural Wave 2018") and the British Council in Macedonia made an open call for all young designers with maximum working experience up to 3 years. FASHION AS A PART OF THE ECOSYSTEM.	Старт на Модата како дел од екосистемот. Selected participants will take part in a series of workshops for sustainable design under the mentorship of fashion designer Irina Tosheva, who besides her many years of experience as a designer, also works with costume design; "Ajde Makedonija", "Pakomak", and will participate in the final performance and exhibition during the eighteenth edition of Fashion Weekend Skopje. Sustainable Story" is a collaboration among students, new talented designers, the textile industry in Macedonia and invited fashion practitioners from the UK in order to find the most appropriate way to re-use textiles. KEY DATES October 14, 2018 – Fashion presentation of the first part of the project in the center of textile Stip WHY WE ARE DEDICATED ON THIS STORY We have united in this especially important initiative because the fashion industry is the second economic branch in the world and is one of the main culprits for the endangering of the environment. Certified organic cotton, slow production, sustainable fabrics, zero waste production, vegan materials and ethical production conditions are just the beginning. Curated performance, exhibition, photo&video a sustainable story about the collections made during the Fashion Weekend Skopje. November 2 – Fashion installation within the Fashion Weekend Skopje, Skopje Marriott Hotel. The participants will also mentor guests from the UK, because sustainable fashion is possible and mastered by many British fashion labels.

For the purposes of closing of the "SCHOOL OF DEFENSE, SECURITY AND NATO INTEGRATIONS", a final briefing/closing ceremony was organized. The participants were greeted by the President of ATA Macedonia, Mr. Ismet Ramadani, who also held a brief lecture about the Macedonian path to NATO, the benefits of joining NATO and the political role of ATA Macedonia in paving the way for Euro-Atlantic integrations of Macedonia. The participants hade opportunity to attend lectures on NATO, security, defense, to participate in debates, to be part of several study visits, to talk with members of NATO and the Army, and to get familiar with the basic tasks and responsibilities and to learn what the service in the ARM means. He also explicated upon the Euro-Atlantic processes of Macedonia, the next phases and challenges for Macedonia. You are here: Home|Media Centre |News|Closing of the "SCHOOL OF DEFENSE, SECURITY AND NATO INTEGRATIONS" Those participants that were more active, present and fulfilled the criteria received a certificates for the participation. Mr. Ilija Djugumanov, Member of the Presidency of ATA Macedonia and Project Director, briefed the participants about the next activities of ATA Macedonia and future projects, the opportunities for the young people, how can they be involved in YATA activities, and how can they contribute by becoming members of the organization. You are here: Home|Media Centre |News|Closing of the "SCHOOL OF DEFENSE, SECURITY AND NATO INTEGRATIONS" Main goal of the school was to provide basic knowledge about NATO, including its structure, policies, operations, etc. current issues related to the Alliance, but also to contribute to the information and increase of the young staff in the ARM, relying on educational and informational tools. The last event was held in the premises of ATA Macedonia in a unofficial manner with small cocktail prepared for the participants. The closing ceremony had a form of informal info briefing and final lecture. In addition, Mr Djugumanov, informed the school participants about the 70th anniversary of NATO, which will be marked in 2019 as a celebration of the signing of the Washington Treaty, and the planned activities of ATA Macedonia in the anticipation of the official celebration. The participants filled out evaluation questionnaire in order to assess the school lectures, the school agenda and overall logistics and organization.

Abdulov: Election promises made to the socially... These promises cannot be and must not be populistic, and we are aware, or have witnessed so far in campaigns, and in the period following elections, that governments composed of various political parties, use these moments of solving poverty, or the problems of the marginalized groups of citizens. This means sitting at a joint table, setting priorities, setting goals that are realistic, and setting a time frame. Also, it is a serious problem for the political parties. CIVIL Media: What can and what should the institutions, political parties, unions and civil society do in order to prevent the abuse of socially disadvantaged categories, and overall the topics in the area of social justice in the political and electoral context? These promises must not be in the form of – one solution for all. The promises that are largely described by political parties during the pre-election period, can lead to a situation in which the citizens themselves, or the those voting for the political parties, start to lose trust in those political parties, and end up staying home at the next election cycle. Some of the problems will not be solved in the first four years of the formation of a given government. That is, if we assume that the next parliamentary elections, or local elections would take place once in every four years. Therefore, promises need to be more comprehensive, that is, for all. Not everything is about the promises, not everything is about the housing issue, about the issue of addressing poverty... ZIVKOVIC: What I am about to say may sound a little strange, but it is good to use the marginalized and disadvantaged groups of citizens in election campaigns and in pre-election activities. Therefore, if such a strategy is established, then there will absolutely be no problem in terms of the abuse of these groups of citizens in pre-election periods. For these reasons, if we look at social justice of the all the citizens in Republic of Macedonia, then we need to create a concrete strategy. We have a saying - 'every wonder lasts three days'.	Имаме една поговорка којашто гласи 'секое чудо за три дена'. Zivkovic: The abuse of disadvantaged and marginalized citizens is a serious problem! Political parties promise wonders and, unfortunately, that is how many days those wonders last. This entire period should include all the above-mentioned groups. The fact that in many cases political parties do not refer to the solutions offered by experts, or civil society organizations, does really present a problem. We cannot separate certain groups of citizens as more important ones or of higher priority", says expert on workers' rights, Milan Zivkovic, from the Friedrich Ebert Foundation Office in Skopje, in an interview for CIVIL Media. The consequences in terms of the social measures in this category of citizens are definitely, not setting priorities in solving the problems. Also, these cannot be promises, which in the shortest period following the elections, will solve all the issues and problems of the disadvantaged and marginalized groups of citizens. This means that this is a serious problem for the citizens, a serious problem for the voters. And I will say once more, social justice for all. Nevertheless, if we assume that we do have elections every four years, then the process of creating these policies, or finding solutions, should last four years. They do this in such a bombastic way that we get this perception, through the media, that we no longer have problems with poverty, with the homeless, we have no problem with respecting diversity... It is not only the state institutions that need to solve certain issues and problems of certain groups of citizens, but rather, all actors need to be involved. They are issues that need to start being considered from the very first day after the elections, and until the next elections. We have to say that so far, we have not seen a single campaign that has been fulfilled from word to word, in the period following the elections. But still, we cannot blame them if they have lost their trust in the political parties giving these promises. There is nothing worse than for the voters to stay home and not use their voting right, the constitutional right to vote for any party. We need to see things as a complete solution, that is, create a strategy which would fulfill that social justice. Imagine just how positive it would be if we had campaigns focusing on social justice. Perhaps some issues and problems will not be able to be solved even in the next eight years, but, that is why a strategy should be developed for the implementation of social justice for all, in which everyone will give equal contribution. Though, the fact is that we do have a problem with all that. ZIVKOVIC: We have a saying – "every wonder lasts three days". Also, civil society organizations, experts, unions, state institutions and all external experts who can give their contribution to solving the problems of the marginalized groups of citizens. How often does this happen? The fact that most of the requests, more specifically, promises of the political parties in the pre-election period, remain unanswered and unfulfilled, points out that it everything comes down to an abuse. These solutions are not always the optimum ones, which these disadvantaged or marginalized groups need. The parties go with their own analysis that have been developed in one way or another, and at the end, they come to a solution that they believe is good to use, or to solve the problems of these groups of citizens. The non-fulfillment of pre-election promises indicates that it is in fact an abuse. Social justice as a base for a political campaign, of any political party in Macedonia, focusing on all these issues concerning the disadvantaged and marginalized groups of citizens.

A major service upgrade for the EOS 5D Mark IV sees Canon Log being added to the DSLR, providing enhanced dynamic range and easier colour grading. Canon Log also reduces noise, particularly in shadow areas that can appear during colour grading. Canon Log is a staple feature in Canon's Cinema EOS range and is designed to deliver an 800 percent increase in dynamic range, minimising the loss of detail in the darkest and brightest parts of the image. Ensuring maximum freedom in post-production, Canon Log alters the image processing data after the image has been captured. The footage from any camera can be combined and colour matched in a single colour grading process, which provides a final global colour and seamless feel, regardless of whether the film is shot on different cameras.

Long before Sgt. Lefty and the Camp Waterlogg gang took over, The Comedy-O-Rama Hour residents were parody versions of Mysteries (Sherlock Holmes), Old-time Radio (The Shadow, The Lone Ranger, etc.), SCI-FI (Willoughby and the Professor), Superheroes (Teaman and Polfroon), and more. “Those were the XM years,” explains Joe Bevilacqua (Joe Bev), who not only produced Comedy-O-Rama, but also wrote and voiced 80% of the productions, which aired four years on XM Satellite Radio. Lefty and the Camp Waterlogg gang took over, The Comedy-O-Rama Hour residents were parody versions of Mysteries (Sherlock Holmes), Old-time Radio (The Shadow, The Lone Ranger, etc. Long before Sgt. During the show’s hiatus, Joe Bev created a number of other successful radio shows, including The Jazz-O-Rama Hour, The Joe Bev Experience, Cartoon Carnival, and The Joe Bev Audio Theater, all still produced and running today on many radio stations, as well as podcasts. In the driver's trouser pocket, the customs officers found 5.900 Euros, - 4 parts for laparoscopic medical equipment (LCD monitor, generator and instruments) detected at the Skopje Alexander the Great Airport, during control of suitcase of a Turkish citizen who arrived from Istanbul. The undeclared products were temporarily seized and offence procedure was launched against the passenger. Spare parts for mobile phones and other goods The undeclared slippers were found in several bags, in the boot and among the seats of the vehicle. They were seized and offence procedure was launched against the driver. Foreign currencies - 8.900 Euros, detected in two separate cases, during personal search of three Macedonian citizens, at the Tabanovce Motorway BCP – exit section. In the second case, in the pockets of a driver of Bulgarian automobile, the customs officers found 5.000 Euros without necessary documents for their origin. The camera that was placed in the driver's cabin, covered by blanket was seized and appropriate procedure will be initiated against the its owner-Macedonian citizen travelling by bus. SEIZED FOREIGN CURRENCIES, SILVER JEWELLERY, TECHNICAL GOODS, MEDICAL EQUIPEMENT, MOBILE PHONE SPARE PARTS AND OTHER GOODS - 1 SONY video camera found during control of a Macedonian bus that arrived at the Medzitlija BCP – entrance section. The undeclared goods were seized and offence procedure will be initiated against the passenger. Some of the jewellery was placed in a bag, wrapped in tracksuits and then in passenger bag of a Turkish citizen, passenger on the bus. The remaining jewellery was found in a handbag on a person and in his inner jacket pockets. The undeclared tools that were found on the back seat and in the boot of the vehicle were seized and cooresponding procedure was initiated against the driver. 2000 Euros were returned to the owner (the same amount was returned in the first case also) and the remaining 3.000 Euros were seized. SEIZED FOREIGN CURRENCIES, SILVER JEWELLERY, TECHNICAL GOODS, MEDICAL EQUIPEMENT, MOBILE PHONE SPARE PARTS AND OTHER GOODS The goods were seized and a request for initiation of offence procedure against the passenger- owner of the goods was submitted. Footwear - 154 external batteries for mobile phones detected at the Skopje Alexander the Great Airport, during inspection of suitcase of a Macedonian citizen who arrived from Gothenburg. - 30 pieces of used electronic devices (engines for cutting wood and concrete, grinding machines, welding devices, hilts, drills etc.), detected during control of a German automobile, driven by a Serbian citizen, at the Tabanovce Motorway BCP – entrance section. - 45 cases for mobile phones, stands and 17 bags of beads in different forms, detected during inspection of a Macedonian automobile that arrived at the Deve bair BCP – entrance section, with two Macedonian citizens. Offence procedures were initiated against the three passengers Silver jewellery The jewellery with estimated value of about 73 thousand Denars was seized and corresponding procedure was initiated against the passenger. Last week, the customs officers prevented several attempts for smuggling different goods, seizing foreign currencies, silver jewellery, technical goods, medical equipment, spare parts for mobile phones and footwear. - 496 pieces of silver jewellery (bracelets, rings, earrings and pendants) with a total weight of 2.170 grams, detected during control of a Turkish bus that arrived at the Bogorodica BCP – entrance section. and in a handbag of his companion 4.000 Euros. - 34 pairs of lady slippers, detecetd during inspection of a Macedonian automobile, driven by a Macedonian citizen, at the Blace BCP – entrance section Technical goods and medical equipment In the first case, during personal search of a driver of a Macedonian automobile and his companion, 5.900 Euros were temporarily seized.

According to the Law on Primary and Lower Secondary Education (Official Gazette of the Republic of Macedonia No. Coverage All types of primary and lower secondary schools (regular, special, adult schools and primary and lower secondary schools for adults) and all types of upper secondary schools (regular, special and upper secondary religious schools) at the beginning of the school year are covered. Definitions: A school is an organization or pedagogical-educational unit that is carrying out education of a definite type, according to a defined educational plan or programme, with one or more teachers, irrespective of whether it is independent or under the management of other administration. 51/2007), the primary and lower secondary education in the Republic of Macedonia lasts 9 years and it is compulsory and free of charge. The main aim of the primary and lower secondary education in the Republic of Macedonia is providing general education and preparing the students for further general or vocational education at the next level. The upper secondary education is carried out in the upper secondary schools that are organized as public or private schools. Coverage All types of primary and lower secondary schools (regular, special, adult schools and primary and lower secondary schools for adults) and all types of upper secondary schools (regular, special and upper secondary religious schools) at the beginning of the school year are covered. Primary and lower secondary schools are: the regular primary and lower secondary schools, which can be independent or local; special primary and lower secondary schools - for the students with intellectual and physical disabilities; adult schools which allow the students older than 15 years of age to complete their general education. Definitions: A school is an organization or pedagogical-educational unit that is carrying out education of a definite type, according to a defined educational plan or programme, with one or more teachers, irrespective of whether it is independent or under the management of other administration. The gymnasium and art upper secondary education last 4 years, and the vocational upper secondary education lasts 3 or 4 years where the students can decide on one of the offered professions. Data on enrolled students in the academic year 2016/2017 for the first time include data on private primary schools in the Republic of Macedonia. The upper secondary education allows obtaining knowledge and developing the skills for the labour market, and it also prepares students for further education at the next level. Primary and lower secondary schools are: the regular primary and lower secondary schools, which can be independent or local; special primary and lower secondary schools - for the students with intellectual and physical disabilities; adult schools which allow the students older than 15 years of age to complete their general education. The typical age of the students is from 6 to 14 or 15. The upper secondary education allows obtaining knowledge and developing the skills for the labour market, and it also prepares students for further education at the next level. According to the Law, the upper secondary education is carried out through educational plans and programmes as: general - gymnasium education, vocational upper secondary education, art upper secondary education and special upper secondary education. Each geographically dislocated unit is considered to be an observation unit, too. 51/2007), the primary and lower secondary education in the Republic of Macedonia lasts 9 years and it is compulsory and free of charge. Reporting unit Reporting unit is each primary and lower secondary or upper secondary school verified by the Ministry of Education and Science that is carrying out education while the statistical survey is in progress. Besides these types of education, there is also religious upper secondary education in our country that lasts 4 or 5 years. Data on enrolled students in the academic year 2016/2017 for the first time include data on private primary schools in the Republic of Macedonia. The typical age of the students in the upper secondary education is from 14 or 15 to 18 or 19.

In the period of December 2011 and January 2012, National Team Leader together with the two experts from the Nature Conservation Programme in Macedonia held meetings with the main stakeholders of this Programme. On this meeting, Ms. Marjana Shushlevska, National Team Leader informed the representatives of the Municipalities, Ministries and institutions with the main goal and objectives of the Programme, method for Programme implementation and coordination, what are the main benefits from this Programme especially for Bregalnica Region, respectively East Planning Region and how different stakeholders will be included in Programme. There were several meetings with representatives of the Municipalities: Berovo, Pehcevo, Karbinci, Cheshinovo – Obleshevo, Kochani, Zrnovci, Vinica, Makedonska Kamenica, Delchevo, Shtip and Probishtip. Also, meetings were held with representatives of: Centre for Development of East Planning Region, Agency of Spatial Planning, Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy, Ministry of Environment and Physical Planning, civil society "OXO", Macedonian Ecology Society, Faculty of Forestry in Skopje and with the representative from German Technical Cooperation (GIZ) – local office in Shtip. There were several meetings with representatives of the Municipalities: Berovo, Pehcevo, Karbinci, Cheshinovo – Obleshevo, Kochani, Zrnovci, Vinica, Makedonska Kamenica, Delchevo, Shtip and Probishtip. On the other side representatives from the different stakeholders showed their gratitude for realization of such Programme in Macedonia whose main goal is protection of biodiversity and nature ecosystems in Macedonia through sustainable management and usage. In the period of December 2011 and January 2012, National Team Leader together with the two experts from the Nature Conservation Programme in Macedonia held meetings with the main stakeholders of this Programme.

The Lord praised the unrighteous steward because, at the end of his management, it occurred to him that he was not dealing with his own wealth, but someone else’s, and therefore he could have more easily trade with the debtors; because, when you run someone else’s wealth, it comes to you as a bonus. Our very existence and our whole life is a gift of God, let alone the graceful opportunity that we receive in the Church for graceful existence (good being) now as well as for the eternal graceful existence. Thus, all of this is related to all of us (especially to those who are placed in high positions in any area of the life of the society), if we forgive and if we show mercy, with concrete help, to those who suffer mentally and physically, only from our surplus – from everything spiritually and materially, which God Has granted us, we will be praised by the Lord of our lives, that is, after we become extremely impoverished by life, we will be accepted into eternal dwellings. This entry was posted by Macedon on Friday, December 4th, 2020 at 12:00 and is filed under Бeceди. The unrighteous servant usually remembers at the end of his life that everything is vanity and nothingness before the inevitable and unspeakable meeting with the Living God, on the other hand little Mary at the beginning of Her life burned Herself out in the Holy of Holies, longing for a personal encounter with the One Who IS – the Ever-Essential One, so She may ever glow to us all forever, as a Lighthouse of the uncreated light, which leads and saves us through the stormy sea of this life, to the safe harbour of the Father’s embrace, through Christ in the Holy Spirit. Well, now, if we invest (spend) ourselves with all our heart, with all our mind, with all our soul and with all our strength in the work of God, and if we burn out (spend) ourselves in that giving, for the salvation of man and the world, then our Heavenly Father will be looking at us differently and He will address us with different words, that is, not as stewards, but as legal heirs and owners. We freely arrange and manage all these natural and gracious gifts. Children, you have heard today’s gospel reading: “And I say unto you, make friends for yourselves by unrighteous riches (mammon), that when you are poor, they may receive you into everlasting home” (see Luke 16: 1-10). Unrighteous riches is everything that God Has given us outside the Church, and even more unrighteous riches is everything given to us within the Church. Each one of us is an unrighteous steward. Who is this unjust steward; what sort of unrighteous riches he manages and arranges; and why did the Lord praise him? What and how then can a man say something about Bogorodica (Birth-Giver-of-God) and Ever-Virgin Mary?

A representative of the Directorate for Security of Classified information attended the 10th CSDP Training Programme for SAP Partners 2016, organized under the auspices of the TAIEX instrument of the European Commission. The three-modular training programme, supported by the European Security and Defence College, had an overall objective to provide training to representatives from the Western Balkans' state institutions in the area of the European Security and Defence Policy. By nominating experienced representatives for this specific comprehensive training programme, the Directorate continues to build its institutional human resources capacities and remains fully committed to creating professional state servants with high level of knowledge of CFSP/CSDP issues.

The cooperation between the Project Coordination Team and the project partners has increased to a higher level, and as a result thereof, activities are implemented at a higher dynamics. On 16 and 17 December, Manastir Hotel in Berovo hosted the 4th workshop with partners of the Nature Conservation Programme in Macedonia with the aim of sharing the experiences from the third year of implementation of the Programme and providing guidelines on actions to be taken next year. The Project Coordination Team, as well as the partners of the Programme, presented the results achieved in the third year of implementation of the Programme and analysed the process of implementation and coordination of the Programme, as well as the activities planned for 2016. We repeat our call to the European Commission to improve the recently reformed EU enlargement policy, by paying more attention to assisting these countries in moving towards full implementation of the European Pillar of Social Rights and the UN Agenda 2030 SDGs, and by ensuring the full involvement of trade unions through social dialogue.	Го повторуваме нашиот повик до Европската комисија да ја подобри неодамна реформираната политика за проширување на ЕУ, со тоа што ќе обрнеме поголемо внимание да им помогнеме на овие земји да се придвижат кон целосна имплементација на Европскиот столб за социјални права и развојните цели на ООН 2030, со целосно вклучување на синдикатите преку социјален дијалог. The European Trade Union Confederation (ETUC) and the Pan European Regional Council of the International Trade Union Confederation (PERC) strongly urge the European Council, meeting tomorrow, to approve the opening of accession negotiations with Albania and North Macedonia - righting the wrong decision that was made in October 2019. We call on the leaders of North Macedonia and Albania to respect fundamental human and workers' rights in line with their international obligations, to ensure the rule of law and to promote the European Social Model, and in particular to respect the undeniable role of trade unions and employers in building sustainable, inclusive, and democratic societies. We call on the leaders of North Macedonia and Albania to respect fundamental human and workers' rights in line with their international obligations, to ensure the rule of law and to promote the European Social Model, and in particular to respect the undeniable role of trade unions and employers in building sustainable, inclusive, and democratic societies. Haiti: Ariel Henry assumes post as prime minister Ariel Henry was formally inaugurated as Haiti's prime minister on Tuesday, almost two weeks after the assassination of late President Jovenel Moise. Many of the demonstrators openly called for Moise's resignation, but the Haitian president refused to step down. News Haiti: Ariel Henry assumes post as prime minister Ariel Henry was formally inaugurated as Haiti's prime minister on Tuesday, almost two weeks after the assassination of late President Jovenel Moise. Henry has appealed for national unity as he takes office nearly two weeks after the assassination of late President Jovenel Moise. Moise took office in February 2017 and was a controversial figure in Haiti. Moise was shot multiple times during an attack at his residence in the upscale Port-au-Prince neighborhood of Petion-Ville on July 7. First Lady Martine Moise was also injured in the attack and airlifted to the US for emergency care. Henry, a 71-year-old neurosurgeon and former Cabinet minister, has called for unity in the Caribbean country. One of my priority tasks will be to reassure the people that we will do everything to restore order and security, he said. The new prime minister said the "Haitian people" are the solution to the country's political crisis after Moise's death. It's time for unity and for stability, Henry said after he was sworn in. We welcome the ongoing discussion in this regard, but at the same time we recommend keeping the positive aspects of the current Law and to use the revision process to strengthen social dialogue, to improve the coverage of collective bargaining and to fill the gaps that still exists in the Labor Code in line with the European Directives and ILO Conventions. In the preparation of the legal solution we also included the academia dealing specifically with labor law issues. The cooperation with the ETUC and ITUC is of a great importance for us, and your support support for our Confederation is an indication that we are on the right path. Only together can we achieve our common goal and protect human dignity and workers' values. At the same time, we point out that all economic and social problems and challenges in the country cannot and should not be resolved solely through the backs of the workers. The Conference was attended by the Presidents of the branch trade unions affiliated in CCM, representatives of the social partners, high level officials of the European Trade Union Confederation (ETUC), Mr. Luca Visentini, ETUC General Secretary, International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC), ITUC Special Adviser, Mr Jaap Wienen, the Prime Minister of North Macedonia, Mr. Zoran Zaev, the Minister of Labor and Social Policy, Ms. Mila Carovska, ILO Country Representative, Mr. Emil Krstanovski, the President of UNASM, Mr. Slobodan Antovski, the President of BCM, Mile Boskov, Labor Law proffessors, PhD, Todor Kalamatiev and PHD Lazar Jovevski as well as other important stakeholders in society. Participants on the Conference The Minister of Labor and Social Policy, Mila Carovska emphasized that the new Labor Law is being prepared in line with the international standards and promotes European labor rights and social dialogue. Of great importance is our responsibility to defend, respect and promote democratic values, workers' and human rights. Following the Conference, a Press Conference was held Links to the statements: Caption 6. President of CCM, Darko Dimovski and the ETUC General Secretary, Luca Visentini The Republic of North Macedonia is a candidate country for EU membership, and despite the challenges that have been present lately, for us, this option is the only acceptable for our European position in terms of our position, but also in our need to accept European values for democracy and development. The new Labor Law has been discussing for two years, and we even call it the "Workers' Small Constitution" because of its importance, and through a careful, dedicated and patient way we have reached a successful stage for all parties. These issues are always a challenge for us, and therefore in this period, together with the social partners, through the social dialogue we work on the adoption of a new Labor Law, new Law on Occupational Safety and Health at Work, and it is worth noting that in the last period we have achieved a continuous increase in minimum wage through the social dialogue and cooperation with the government and employers. I expect the dialogue to continue in the coming period and to adopt a law that will be in the interest of all. The Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia today organized a High Level Conference on "New Labor Law, Harmonization of National with European Labor Legislation". Minister of Labor and Social Policy, Mila Carovska, Prime Minister, Zoran Zaev, ETUC General Secretary, Mr. Luca Visentini, ITUC Special Adviser, Jaap Wienen, President of CCM, Darko Dimovski. The European Confederation of Trade Unions will stay at your disposal for any support and help in future if needed. We are facing with many trade union challenges both on national and European level. Presidents of branch unions affiliated in CCM and representatives of social partners Prime Minister Zoran Zaev stressed that social dialogue delivers results, but it should not stop here. There is a need to create more quality job opportunities for young people not to leave the country, but there is an also need to adjust wages and keep them at an adequate level as the living wage and it is also necessary to strengthen collective bargaining especially in the private sector. HIGH LEVEL CONFERENCE - NEW LABOR LAW, HARMONIZATION OF NATIONAL WITH EUROPEAN LABOR LEGISLATION At the conference, the President of the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia, Darko Dimovski emphasized that the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia is the oldest and most numerous trade union confederation in the country. Certain versions of the Law have been discussed by all social partners. I look forward to finding solutions to seasonal work, home and domestic work, fixed-term work, teleworking, equal treatment for men and women, and the need to abandon positive discrimination for women, as well as for full regulation of night work, and employment contracts for young people. In this regard we demand: the strength of trade unions lies in their numbers, training, competence, but also in their solidarity, support and joint action with you and all relevant Social Partners. As ETUC we have made very clear our position towards the European institutions for the process to be reopened, and at the same time we encourage the Government, trade unions and social partners in the country to improve mainly in two areas. The second concerns the reform of the Labor Law. There is a need for greater investment, creation of more jobs, and it is also necessary to set certain conditions when it comes to foreign investors coming into the country to exploit cheap labor and they need to respect the rules just as they do in the countries where they come from. We regret the European Council's decision not to open accession negotiations with the Republic of North Macedonia and we express our solidarity with workers and their unions. Finally I want to than to the President of CCM, Darko Dimovski and the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia for the invitation and the opportunity to participate in the Conference. We are aware that decent and equal living and working conditions for all without discrimination are achieved through creation and provision of real and sustainable jobs, social security, healthy and safe working conditions, poverty alleviation, protection of the environment and improved quality of life. - respect of the ILO conventions on freedom of association and organization - Promoting collective bargaining and social dialogue at all levels. The ETUC General Secretary, Luca Visentini said that the European Trade Union Confederation is very happy about the opportunity to be in Skopje today and to show solidarity to the trade unions in the country. The first concerns the economy, levels of employment and unemployment in the country, despite the very relevant efforts to increase GDP and raise the minimum wage, but this is not the needed level. President of CCM, Darko Dimovski

A defender of God’s truth, this wonderful saint was courageous defender of justice among the people. Since he was their only son given to them by God, the parents returned the gift to God by dedicating their son to Him. This glorious saint, celebrated even today throughout the entire world, was the only son of his eminent and wealthy parents: Theophanes and Nona, residents of the city of Patara in Lycia. Following the death of his parents, Nicholas distributed all his inherited goods to the poor, not keeping anything for himself. On two occasions, he saved three men from an undeserved death sentence. He was present at the First Ecumenical Council of Nicaea [325] and, out of great zeal for the truth, slapped the heretic Arius. For this act he was removed from the Council and from his archiepiscopal duties, until the Lord Christ Himself and the Most-Holy Bogorodica (Birth-Giver-of-God) appeared to several of the chief hierarchs and revealed Their approval of Nicholas. When he gave himself over to solitude and silence, thinking to live that way until his death, a voice from above came to him: “Nicholas, for ascetic work go and labour among the people, if you desire to be crowned by Me.” The meaning of the spiritual life St. Nicholas learned from his uncle Nicholas, Bishop of Patara, and was tonsured a monk in the Monastery of New Zion founded by his uncle. Being merciful, truthful, and righteous, he walked among the people as an angel of God. During the persecution of Christians under Diocletian and Maximian, he was cast into prison, but even there he instructed people in the Law of God. For this act he was removed from the Council and from his archiepiscopal duties, until the Lord Christ Himself and the Most-Holy Bogorodica (Birth-Giver-of-God) appeared to several of the chief hierarchs and revealed Their approval of Nicholas. A light shone from his face as it did from the face of Moses, and he, by his presence alone, brought comfort, peace and good will among people. Merciful, wise and fearless, Nicholas was a true pastor to his flock. In old age he became ill for a short time and entered into the rest of the Lord, after a life full of labour and very fruitful toil, in order to rejoice eternally in the Kingdom of Heaven, continuing to help the faithful on earth by his miracles and to glorify his God. As a priest in Patara, he was known for his charity, even though he carefully concealed his charitable works, fulfilling the words of the Lord: Let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth (Matthew 6:3). Even during his lifetime, the people considered him a saint and invoked his aid in difficulties and in distress. He appeared both in dreams and in person to those who called upon him, and he helped them equally easy, whether they would have been close at hand or far away.

The exhibition will feature 12 artists in different media: Iskra Dimitrova, Nehat Beqiri, Verica Kovachevska, Nada, Prlja, Velimir Zhernovski, Matej Bogdanovski, Hristina Ivanoska, Yane Chalovski, Gjorgje Jovanovikj, Filip Jovanovski, Nikola Uzunovski and the collective OPA (Denis Saraginovski, Slobodanka Stevchevska). Curated by: Ljiljana Nedelkovska External activities | Jane Calovski and Hristina Ivanoska | group exhibition "Panic Room or Leap into Thinking" | October 2, 2020, Museum of Contemporary Art - Skopje Actually, it's all about different approaches of connecting and solidarity between people and their surrounding (as opposed to the usual way in which living conditions are taken for granted, as something given to us and belonging to us). External activities | Jane Calovski and Hristina Ivanoska | group exhibition "Panic Room or Leap into Thinking" | October 2, 2020, Museum of Contemporary Art - Skopje Panic room does not mean any safe place to hide (as in David Fincher's movie from which the title is borrowed), but refers to the intimate, inner space as a place of decision for a decisive turn of thought: instead to accept that it is much easier to imagine the end of the world than the end of capitalism, to leap, leap into thinking and to imagine the end of capitalism, calling for "a new country, a new people"(Deleuze&Guattari) Instead of an ecology of fear, an ecology of thought. Panic room does not mean any safe place to hide (as in David Fincher's movie from which the title is borrowed), but refers to the intimate, inner space as a place of decision for a decisive turn of thought: instead to accept that it is much easier to imagine the end of the world than the end of capitalism, to leap, leap into thinking and to imagine the end of capitalism, calling for "a new country, a new people"(Deleuze&Guattari) Instead of an ecology of fear, an ecology of thought. Panic Room or Leap into Thinking The concept of the exhibition Panic Room, is to offer certain courses of redesigning or even resetting of our attitude towards natural and social surrounding. At the same time, the exhibition is also a critique of the neoliberal financial, technological, biopolitical, or necropolitical strategy of manipulating and colonizing all spheres of spatial, biological, and symbolic existence. This day has been marked for already half of century, aiming to emphasize the peoples awareness of the importance for preservation for healthy living environment.

For formal Letter of Invitation for the ITU CoE elearning course all interested parties should contact Prof. Dr. Toni Janevski (tonij@feit.ukim.edu.mk), latest by 21 November 2011. Cyril and Methodius University in Skopje, will conduct eLearning course on "Next Generation Mobile and Wireless Networks" from 22 November to 19 December 2011, within the framework of ITU Centre of Excellence Network for Europe, and it will be delivered through the ITU Academy: http://academy.itu.int. Hence, this course will cover LTE mobile networks, including spectrum management, System Architecture Evolution (SAE), Common IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem), services over LTE networks, LTE network deployment as well as regulation and business aspects for LTE. Furthermore, the course will include LTE-Advanced (4G) as an extension of the LTE, including the advanced features (carrier aggregation, relay nodes), system architecture, services support (VoIP, multicast and broadcast services, location-based services), and its business potential. Also, the course will cover Mobile WiMAX 2.0 (4G), including technologies in the access and core networks, spectrum management, QoS support, femtocells and self-organizing networks, VoIP and IPTV over mobile WiMAX 2.0, as well as regulation and business aspects. Head/Coordinator of ITU Centre of Excellence at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Information Technologies in Skopje is Prof. Dr. Toni Janevski (tonij@feit.ukim.edu.mk). Other institutions and individuals that are dedicated in building their capacity related to Next Generation Mobile and Wireless Networks are also welcome to participate. International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Centre of Excellence (CoE) node at the Faculty of Electrical Engineering and Information Technologies, Ss.

At its session, on the basis of the evidence that was submitted with the application for the protection of rights and freedoms and the response received from the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia, the Court established the following facts: On 24 December 2012 a session was scheduled in the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia in which the Law on Adopting the Budget of the Republic of Macedonia for 2013 should have been enacted. For the session there was great interest by the public and media, given the importance of the Budget and the fact that in the days prior to the holding of the session, specifically during November and December, there were multiday, intensive, and at times tense discussions between the Representatives from the Assembly majority and the opposition ones on the proposed Budget within the local committee on finance and Budget in the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia. Pursuant to Article 110 line 3 of the Constitution of the Republic of Macedonia, the Constitutional Court of the Republic of Macedonia protects the freedoms and rights of the individual and citizen relating to the freedom of communication, conscience, thought and activity as well as to the prohibition of discrimination among citizens on grounds of sex, race, religion or national, social or political affiliation. Article 10 of the Council of Europe European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms envisages that everyone has the right to freedom of expression. From the above, it may be inferred that the very presence of reporters in the hall and direct reporting does not make a session public, since there are more ways that allow publicity of the work of the Assembly which were applied in this case. Freedom of the media as an integral part of freedom of expression, which inter alia includes the freedom of public information and the freedom to receive and impart information, also are foundations of a democratic society because free communication of information and ideas on political and other social issues of public concern is essential for any society. Their questions as to who ordered their forcible ejection and what was the ground and the need for that were not responded. For the session there was great interest by the public and media, given the importance of the Budget and the fact that in the days prior to the holding of the session, specifically during November and December, there were multiday, intensive, and at times tense discussions between the Representatives from the Assembly majority and the opposition ones on the proposed Budget within the local committee on finance and Budget in the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia. Consequently, the Court found that the violent removal of journalists – applicants from the gallery hall of the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia on 24 December 2012 had not violated their freedom of expression.

Fortnite is an online video game first released in 2017 and developed by Epic Games. The game modes include Fortnite: Save the World, a cooperative shooter-survival game for up to four players to fight off zombie-like creatures and defend objects with fortifications they can build, Fortnite Battle Royale, a free-to-play battle royale game where up to 100 players fight to be the last person standing, and Fortnite: Creative, where players are given complete freedom to create worlds and battle arenas. According to the Law on Occupational Helath and Safety at Work, the employer is obliged to provide appropriate working conditions that will not endanger the life and health of the workers. It is of particular importance to establish appropriate measures to protect the health and lives of workers, especially the chronically ill, the elderly and pregnant workers. The global health crisis and pandemic strongly emphasizes the importance of life and health, therefore even in these conditions of extremely high temperatures we need to preserve the health of workers and citizens, they are the drivers of society. Violation of workers' rights and rules for safety and health at work can be reported to the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia at: prijavi@ssm.org.mk or phone number: 070 818 878. The Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia calls on all employers, to comply with the measures provided by the Action Plan for Prevention of Heat waves when announced that in the coming days the whole territory of the country will be affected by extreme temperatures. All workers working in high temperature conditions are exposed to heat stress. Heat stress is defined as a physical and physiological response of the worker to the temperature at which he or she is exposed to his or her workplace. Violation of workers' rights and rules for safety and health at work can be reported to the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia at: prijavi@ssm.org.mk or phone number: 070 818 878. The Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia calls on all employers, to comply with the measures provided by the Action Plan for Prevention of Heat waves when announced that in the coming days the whole territory of the country will be affected by extreme temperatures. Workers, respect yourself, implement the measures for safety and health at work, and if that right has been violated feel free to report it to your union representative, the workers' representative for OSH and the State Labor Inspectorate! Employers, save the health of workers, they are your partners! The global health crisis and pandemic strongly emphasizes the importance of life and health, therefore even in these conditions of extremely high temperatures we need to preserve the health of workers and citizens, they are the drivers of society. It is of particular importance to establish appropriate measures to protect the health and lives of workers, especially the chronically ill, the elderly and pregnant workers.

From the analysis of the said legal regulation it arises that the Law on Health Insurance sets up a Health Insurance Fund of Macedonia, which is competent to implement the compulsory health insurance of citizens. The Fund performs an activity of public interest and carries out public mandates defined by this Law. The Fund is mostly financed from the funds of the citizens collected on ground of contributions or from the Budget of the Republic, as a result of which it is subject to public liability for the management with these funds. Compulsory health insurance is established for all citizens of the Republic of Macedonia with a view to providing health services and pecuniary compensations on the basis of the principles of comprehensiveness, solidarity, equality, and effective use of the funds under conditions defined by this Law and the regulations adopted on the basis of the present Law. Under Article 51 of the Constitution, in the Republic of Macedonia laws shall be in accordance with the Constitution and all other regulations in accordance with the Constitution and law. Article 57 of the Law defines the managing body of the Fund. On the basis of the principles of efficient, effective and economical use of the funds, pursuant to Article 63 of the same Law, the Fund covers the costs for: health services included in the basic package of health services that are offered by health institutions to the insurees; medicine, aiding medical materials that serve for the application of the medicine and medical material necessary for treatment, defined by a general act; braces, orthopaedic and other appliances, aiding and medical devices and materials, and dental technical means, defined by a general act; pecuniary remunerations; investment for the creation and improvement of the conditions for rendering health services to insurees; performance of the function of the Fund; part of the measures and activities for the implementation of preventive and other programmes for the treatment of certain illnesses, as well as for the handicapped persons, pursuant to the Law on Health Care and other needs for the implementation of the compulsory health insurance. Pursuant to Article 2 of this Law, health insurance is established as compulsory and voluntary. Pursuant to Article 2 of this Law, health insurance is established as compulsory and voluntary. This decision shall generate legal effects from the date of its publication in the "Official Gazette of the Republic of Macedonia". After the conducted announcement, the Director of the Fund, upon a proposal of the Minister of Health, is appointed by the Government of the Republic of Macedonia, which concludes a management contract with the persons appointed as Directors.

Fact-checking Alternative medicine magazines continue to promote Putin's cult in North Macedonia and... These magazines continue to commercially exploit the positive perceptions of Russia and its culture that were already present in some of the Balkan populations, further contributing to reinforcing the propaganda positions of Putin's regime. The network of magazines promoting the 'brand Russia' and Putin's image in the form of alternative medicine advice continues to operate in most states following the breakup of Yugoslavia. According to World Bank data on average life expectancy by country, Russia, with 71.6 years, is at the bottom of Europe's level, which is an indicator of insufficient access to health services for the entire population. In April 2019, Meta.mk released an analysis indicating the impact of two magazine networks coming from Serbia, that are also distributed through direct exports to Bosnia and Montenegro and/or through local publications in North Macedonia, Croatia, and Slovenia in local languages. Commercial promotion of pseudoscience and false hopes forlifesaving cures Even the Russian Orthodox Church, whose views against compulsory vaccination represent a reference to Balkan anti-vaxxers, has dissociated from situations where the state would declare an epidemic. The most prominent are "Russian Doctor" of the media conglomerate "Color Media Plus" and "Russian Herbalist" of the publishing house "Novosti", which are accompanied by a number of other similar publications. Thus, among other data about Putin's health, "Russian Doctor", according to Putin's press secretary,informs that he got the flu vaccine. Presenting the 67-year-old Russian autocrat as a young, masculine and healthy athlete is one of the basic postulates of a propaganda narrative that presents him as a ruler with "extraordinary work ability and excellent performance", according to Mironov. However, the penetration of some of the content intended for Russian audience points to a contrast. Thus, the content promoting various "traditional remedies" distracts, at least part of the audience,from the quality or (un)availability of public health services, or offers some comfort or "alternative". Unlike the activities of the Russian troll armies spreading anti-vaxxer propaganda in EU and NATO countries, their allies and candidate countries, internally, in Russia, the state promotes vaccination. Contrast between propaganda for internal and external use Also, the editorial board and the company are not obliged to give any explanations in written or electronic form or by telephone." The magazine ads contain many similar terms that sound scientific but have nothing to do with medicine,such as "medicinal herbal candies – a new kind of cell cosmic food", "informotherapy", "quantum medicine" by people photographed in white coats or with titles from "academies" – firms that are neither scientific nor medical institutions. Given the fact that most of the contents of such magazines are taken from Russian originals, most probably through licensing, their contents give insight into what is being served to Russian readers. In this sense, "Russian Doctor", in extremely small print, is trying to legally dissociate itself from lawsuits, stressing that "for the truthfulness of the ads are responsible only those who advertise it, and that for the quality of the products for a particular disease are responsible only those who recommend it as a remedy. This propaganda tendency is useful not only for the Russian oligarchy regime, but also for the regimes of the Balkan states that have similarly degraded the quality of the health system in their countries. Judging by the graphic design and the low price, their main target group is the older population, especially the retirees, who are at the same time important as a sound part of the electorate. Alternative medicine magazines continue to promote Putin's cult in North Macedonia and the region The London Times recently suggested that one eighth of Russians survive with less than 175 euros a month and that "there is no sign that the gap between the rich and the poor will decrease any time soon." The dubious credibility of the ads is also confirmed by the fact that the newspaper, on the third page, has repeated twice the following "information plus" which states that the publisher "Color Media Plus" and the editorial board "are not responsible for the content and the truthfulness" of the commercials, advertisements and promotions. He claims to be diagnosing diseases via Viber or WhatsApp" in collaboration with a Russian colleague". Financially unavailable to most readers are Putin's favorite "potions" such as Spanish red wine and "special cocktails with a large amount of ice – 50ml champagne, lemon juice, mint, syrup". Thus, for example, in the latest, January issue of the Macedonian edition of "Russian Doctor", the front page content is the "exclusive" article about "Putin's 10 secrets to health". Proper nutrition and morning gymnastics are presented as "secrets" in this article, but sports such as skiing, hockey, horse riding and fishing are mentioned, which are largely beyond the financial reach of the target (retired) audience. In addition to the propaganda function, the commercial pages of this magazine are filled with advertisements from various local and regional fortune tellers and healers who offer horoscope consultations or promise miraculous remedies and cures, including "cure for any cancer, with or without metastasis" by a certain "Doctor Cvetin", who runs "the first online neuropathic clinic for cosmic medicine in the Balkans".

The Maserati Levante, Quattroporte, and Ghibli Royale feature comprehensive Advanced Driving Assistance Systems to actively respond to the road’s greatest potential hazards and enhance comfort and safety for driver and passengers. Whether driving down city streets or taking part in an exclusive grand tour, high-powered luxury will be met with greater-than-ever safety on the road. Only 100 units of this series will be manufactured, available across the full V6 range for Quattroporte, Levante and Ghibli. Available in two unique colours, Blu Royale and Verde Royale, with exclusive interior features. The MTC+ controls all the key vehicle functions, including the front seat heating, as well as the ventilation, steering wheel heating and the operation of the rear sunblind, where fitted. Amongst them, the 1986 Royale version of the 3rd generation Quattroporte stands out, a restyling featuring exclusive blue and green colours, improved interiors, with soft leather seats and extensive use of wood in the dashboard and door panels. Maserati Royale special series: a contemporary homage to the heritage of the Trident Marque The Quattroporte Royale was equipped with a powerful 4.9l V8 engine delivering 300 HP and only 51 units were produced. Today Maserati pays tribute to its heritage with the launch of a special series bearing the same name, available across all models with V6 engines featured in the current Maserati range: just 100 Maserati Quattroporte, Levante and Ghibli Royale will be produced with engines ranging from the 275HP 3.0l V6 Diesel, to the 350HP and 430 HP 3.0l V6 petrol. The new Royale special series is available in two unique blue and green colours: Blu Royale and Verde Royale.

They will help in the process of identifying children who are out of the educational system, enrolling them in schools, regular attendance and successful transition to the next grades. Planned activities include the implementation of small projects in the identified schools that, through play and joint participation in school activities, will foster interaction and knowledge sharing among students, as well as education and social justice training for teachers. The project will provide scholarships for Roma children enrolled in first grade, which will enable the inclusion of as many Roma children as possible in elementary education, while reducing the financial cost of Roma families associated with their children's education. Support for schools as one of the components of the project will provide for the transformation of classrooms into a more inclusive learning environment that will respect diversity and stimulate the development of all children equally. In parallel with this activity, the project will also provide support for the Roma community by providing instructors in municipalities with the largest Roma community, who will work closely with Roma families and the schools. REGULARLY ATTENDING CLASSES: ACTION FOR INCLUSION OF ROMA IN ELEMENTARY EDUCATION Support for schools as one of the components of the project will provide for the transformation of classrooms into a more inclusive learning environment that will respect diversity and stimulate the development of all children equally. The new project "Regularly attending classes: Action for Inclusion of Roma in Elementary Education" was launched by the Foundation Open Society – Macedonia in partnership with the Foundation for Educational and Cultural Initiatives Step by Step and the Association Center for Educational Support of children "Dendo Vas", funded by the European Union through the Delegation of the European Union to the Republic of North Macedonia. At the same time, the project aims to provide an inclusive learning environment where diversity is respected and where all children feel welcome and equally stimulated to succeed. In parallel with this activity, the project will also provide support for the Roma community by providing instructors in municipalities with the largest Roma community, who will work closely with Roma families and the schools. As part of the project, several educational events and distribution of materials are planned, as well as an educational media campaign aimed at informing and encouraging Roma families to enroll their children in a school they will regularly attend and to promote the general benefits of education on the quality of life. Support for schools as one of the components of the project will provide for the transformation of classrooms into a more inclusive learning environment that will respect diversity and stimulate the development of all children equally. Planned activities include the implementation of small projects in the identified schools that, through play and joint participation in school activities, will foster interaction and knowledge sharing among students, as well as education and social justice training for teachers. Misajlovski in Berlin: public bid opened for stage two of the Pletvar - Gradsko express way Speaking at the Berlin Innotrans international fair for transportation technology, Macedonian Minister Vlado Misajlovski said that the international bid to build the second stage of the Prilep - Gradsko express way has been made public, in cooperation with the European Union. Another major project whose second stage of construction is now opened to potential bidders, Misajlovski said, is the railway link to Bulgaria. The project is divided in three sections, one is under construction, the second is now upcoming and the third will be completed in the coming years. Prilep, and by extension Bitola and the wider Pelagonija region, are linked to the main Corridor 10 highway through a narrow mountainous road going through the Pletvar pass. By the end of this year, we expect to select the construction company and we can have work started in the first half of 2017", Misajlovski said, adding that the second stage of the road should be completed by 2019. Work is underway on the line between Kumanovo and Beljakovce, and the second stage would extend this line to Kriva Palanka, in a project worth 147 million EUR. Misajlovski said that another part of the Corridor 8, the railway line between Kicevo and the border with Albania near Struga is also in the planning stage.

Since the publication of the original landmark trial detailing the mortality benefits of low tidal volume ventilation among patients with the acute respiratory distress syndrome (non-cardiogenic pulmonary edema) (Amato et al. in The New England Journal of Medicine 342(18):1301–1308), epidemiological studies have demonstrated that tidal volumes used for mechanically ventilated patients in medical intensive care units have become lower over time (Esteban et al. in American Journal of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine 177(2):170–177; Esteban et al. in American Journal of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine 188(2):220). Because patients with heart failure (cardiogenic pulmonary edema) have been systematically excluded from studies investigating low tidal volume mechanical ventilation, the benefit of a low tidal volume strategy among cardiac patients is unclear. We sought to determine whether evidence supporting use of low tidal volumes in patients with non-cardiogenic edema has been generalized into the care of patients with cardiogenic pulmonary edema.

Faculty of Mechanical Engineering - Skopje for performing its laboratory activity accredits the Laboratory for testing of mechanical properties, machines and vehicles according to ISO17025 General Requirements for the competence in its activity. Software for testing and data processing is used. The testing of machines is consisted of a broad specter of experimental and virtual tests in the area of performance, reliability, strength, expertise, expert witnessing, development testing and special testing that are conducted by customer demand. The tests are carried out in accordance with the current achievements in the methods and equipment for testing the standard ISO 17025 and the principles of good laboratory practice, by validated methods, domestic and international standards and applicable legal regulation. The goal of these tests is to determine the performances, the strength and safety characteristics, the reliability characteristics, the workloads, forensic tests, etc. In certain cases, by the customers demand, the tests are according to certain methods and test programs. For calculations, analysis and preparation of reports is used proprietary verified software. The evaluation and presentation of the measure inconclusiveness is in accordance to valid methods and work instructions. Machine testing Special position in these methodologies has the regulation for machines 2006/42/EC, which actually is the Regulation for machine safety. Most commonly regulations are the technical specifications of the Republic of Macedonia, respectively to the regulatives from the EU, the regulations of the Economic commission for Europe in the UN in Geneva, as well as the harmonized (EU) and other (ISO) standards. In certain cases, by the customers demand, the tests are according to certain methods and test programs. The software is proprietary and is verified by the manufacturer. The data and calculations that are made during the testing are recorded and checked. Individual measuring instruments are operated by microprocessors with software for processing of measurement results and preparation of reports. The evaluation and presentation of the measure inconclusiveness is in accordance to valid methods and work instructions. Machine testing DATA MANAGEMENT The data and calculations that are made during the testing are recorded and checked. The testing may be conducted by separate standards and regulations (testing of performances), as well as by the methodology which is determined to give an answer to certain questions (expert witnessing tests and giving expertise). Vehicle testing The testing of vehicles is a broad range of experimental and virtual tests that are conducted in the development phases, certification, exploitation, expertise, expert witnessing and special purpose tests.
