The role of the Congress The role of the Congress The Committee on the Honouring of Obligations and Commitments by member states of the European Charter of Local Self-Government (Monitoring Committee) is responsible for assessing the application of the Charter. A Charter for local democracy The European Charter of Local Self-Government (ECLSG) lays down standards for protecting the rights of local authorities and requires states which have ratified it to comply with a number of conditions, principles and practices. Through its core principles to which no reservation is possible, the European Charter of Local Self-Government (ECLSG) seeks to ensure the compatibility of the diverse structures of local communities in the Council of Europe member states. Its purpose is to bring within the scope of the Charter the right of any person to participate in the affairs of a local authority, a principle enshrined in the Preamble to the Charter. A post-monitoring or a post-observation procedure can be implemented at the joint request of the Congress and the authorities of a member State. Reference Framework for Regional Democracy Reference Framework for Regional Democracy The Council of Europe Reference Framework for Regional Democracy – acknowledged by the Council of Europe Conference of Ministers for local and regional authorities at its session in Utrecht on 16 November 2009 - is a veritable code of rights and duties of regional entities, aimed at intermediate authorities between central government and the basic (local authority) tier. Opened for signature on 15 October 1985 and entered into force on 1 September 1988, the Charter is ratified by all 47 Council of Europe member states. It is complemented for the regions by the Council of Europe Reference Framework for Regional Democracy. A Charter for local democracy The Committee on the Honouring of Obligations and Commitments by member states of the European Charter of Local Self-Government (Monitoring Committee) is responsible for assessing the application of the Charter. The Charter was opened for signature on 15 October 1985 and came into force on 1 September 1988; it is ratified by 47 Council of Europe member states. It is complemented for the regions by the Council of Europe Reference Framework for Regional Democracy. The Charter in brief The Charter in brief States undertake to respect a core of basic principles to which no reservation is possible – such as the right of citizens to participate in managing public affairs, the key rights of communities to enjoy autonomy and self-government, elect their local bodies and to have their own structures and financial resources.

The aim of this initiative is to increase access to printed reading materials for the youngest students and to nurture the love of reading books in traditional printed form. It is more than clear that in this era of technology, digital and social media play an important role in students' everyday life. Thus, we will employ digital resources and technology in teaching our students, by using the language that is so familiar to them – the language of technology. Under this Component, we created the following digital learning resources that are available online in our Digital Library: Therefore, this project component will create and adjust materials for reading and math, like audio-books, picture books, games and will encourage using ICT in reading and math. In addition to the digital resources, USAID Readers are Leaders Project printed a collection of 20 titles of picture books "Our First Library" and distributed them to all Grade 1-3 classrooms in all primary schools in the country, as well as all school and public libraries. We also support and encourage teachers to become authors of digital learning resources, via the use of numerous open source tools that are available online, so that we may collect and share their lesson plans that integrate the digital picture books published by our project. audio-digital books in Macedonian and Albanian language e-books in PDF form for children in Macedonian, Albanian and Turkish language

Dynamic operation is more efficient, safer and cheaper This is a brand new concept in the field of biomass fueled heating. Dynamic Combustion System automatically varies combustion parameters to maintain optimum combustion and ensure maximum efficiency and low consumption of pellet.. In same time with comparing of temperature of flue, including the level of air intake in system Dynamic combustion system also make change of quantity of pellet needed to be burned inside of burning pot with maximum keeping of burning power (low or high quality of pellets). Normal variations in pellet quality, flue draft, altitude above sea level and operating temperature make it impossible for conventional stoves to achieve optimal efficiency. The system is the expression of an intelligent and environmentally compatible new technology developed thanks to major investments and close cooperation with the producer of electronic device. With impletation of this system our stove never stop, never have loading of extra pellet, never have problem with burning and work independed beetwen 5 till 10 days without any customer intervention, All this advantage make this stoves simple one of the best in hand of our customers. Measuring under pressure inside of burning chamber, measuring of air flow intake inside of burning pot on every 5 secounds and comparing of data of the system against the laboratory data, give opportunity to Dynamic combustion system to change combustion parametars data to adjust air flow exactly quantity needed for perfect burning.

This year Jerry is retiring, and the mobile teams unit of the Customs Administration will be joined by 4 new dogs, donation from Germany. These 9-month-old dogs are specially trained to detect specific substances. The Director General of the Customs Administration and representatives of the Control and Investigation Sector expressed their support for the customs officers from the mobile team responsible for the drug sniffing dogs. SNIFFER DOGS PART OF THE CUSTOMS MOBILE TEAM UNIT OF THE CONTROL AND INVESTIGATION SECTOR They have participated in several actions, 90% of which have been successful. This unit in the Customs Administration is of particular importance in the fight against crimes and misdemeanors. The 5 dogs Jerry, Baron, Pimbo, Aron and Ruff have been part of the Customs Administration since 2000 and are of particular importance because they are used to protect borders and prevent illicit transport of narcotics.

The Government and the Agency for Audio and Audiovisual Media Services(AAVMU) yesterday and today exchanged sharp objections to the problems in media sphere in the past period, following the accusation from the Minister Robert Popovski on Friday that the Agency has not functioned and did not perform its competences for years, in the context retransmission of foreign programming services without copyright. Given the fact that the scope and the number of surveillance carried out are on the same level in the years indicated, a significant reduction in violations shows only one thing- that the Agency ensures consistent implementation of the law, says the reaction. At the same time, the Agency inform the right-holders, in order to initiate appropriate procedure against the operator, keeping in mind that the Agency has no opportunity to initiate court procedure on their behalf," says the reaction from AAVMU. The Government of the Republic of Macedonia reacted again today to AVMU saying that the Agency can not avoid responsibility for the media chaos in the past years. Last year, only six measures were imposed, again, without a single infringement procedure. The Agency Is vainly trying to hide behind overturned numbers and statistics that has not given any effect on preventing such disorder in the media sphere in the country. The media disorder was constantly silenced by the competent institutions, among which the initial call to put the AVMU in order. AVMU can not avoid responsibility for media chaos, says the Government AAVMU reacted yesterday that it was a "non-argued, lump-sum statements whose intention is to discredit the work of the Agency, and it is especially surprising that they are given by a minister whose primary task should be accurate and well-informed information to the public". This has resulted in the need for amendments to the Law of Audio and Audiovisual Media Services," stands in the Government's reaction. The media disorder was constantly silenced by the competent institutions, among which the initial call to put the AVMU in order. In 2015, the Agency stated 62 measures and instigated 23 infringement proceedings, and in 2016 stated 13 measures without one infringement procedure. The Agency Is vainly trying to hide behind overturned numbers and statistics that has not given any effect on preventing such disorder in the media sphere in the country. The Government of the Republic of Macedonia reacted again today to AVMU saying that the Agency can not avoid responsibility for the media chaos in the past years. This has resulted in the need for amendments to the Law of Audio and Audiovisual Media Services," stands in the Government's reaction. The text is made within the framework of the project "Media Reform Observatory", implemented by the Foundation for Internet and Society Metamorphosis, "Agora" Center for Promoting Civil Values and the Platform for Investigative Journalism and Analyzes – PINA, with the financial support of the "Foundation Open" Society – Macedonia ". Around 250 faithful from Skopje, from Bitola, Gevgelija, Ohrid, Struga, Resen, Tetovo, Gostivar and other towns in the Republic gathered to celebrate the memory of the mystical appearance of the Holy Archangel Gabriel to the Most Holy Virgin in Nazareth during Her prayerful stillness, which had been Her incessant practice for many years throughout Her so godly life. The great duke of immaterial angels, in the city of Nazareth did descend, to proclaim the King of the ages and the Lord to You, Most Pure, crying out 'Rejoice, blessed Mary, - unreachable and ineffable miracle: renewal of people!' The devout God-seekers who arrived to venerate the Most Holy Virgin with the monastic brotherhood in Bigorski began Vigil with the Small Compline, and finished the course of the festive worship at 5.30 am., in order to have some rest before the Divine Liturgy in honour of the great feast, which started after some two hours of rest. This custom together with the historical findings which reveal that in Bigorski at one time there was a chapel the altar of which was dedicated to Holy Annunciation, inspired the building in of a new such chapel in the recently reconstructed quarters. For the life of the Most Pure Virgin this event meant an ineffable change, and for the history of mankind – a sovereign revolution in the spiritual and eschatological dimensions of existence, restoration of the broken union with God with a new and inalienable opportunity for perfection. Today Gabriel proclaims to the graceful One: 'Rejoice unwedded Mother Who knows not of a man, do not admire my heavenly splendour, do not be afraid, I am an archangel; once the serpent deceived Eve, now I am proclaiming to You the joy that You will remain a virgin and will give birth to the Lord, Most Pure.' And, also entry into the heavenly Kingdom already here on earth, having the Most Pure Sovereign Lady the Theotokos and Evervirgin Mary as a permanent Intercessor, to Whom joyously in awe we cry out: This time, at the Vigil, the magnificence of the choir was enriched with the voice of the protopsaltist Georgiy Sekuloski. Our brave victorious Commander, we, Your servants delivered from evil, are singing hymns of praise to You, Theotokos, and You Who has invincible strength, free us from every affliction, so we can cry out to You 'Rejoice Bride Unwedded!' Last night in the Bigorski monastery an all-night Vigil was performed in honour of the Holy Annunciation. Annunciation (07.04.2005) In the spirit of the Hagiorite tradition on such feasts, the guests and monastics in the end gathered at the common table, to return afterwards in the cathedral for a thanksgiving prayer. Onwards, according to the good tidings, the power of the Holy Spirit overshadowed the womb of the God-seeker Mary, who had known not of a man, previously devoted to virgin life with a husband chosen to protect Her perfect spiritual struggle under the guise of a marriage. By this the womb of the God-chosen received within it the incarnation of the Only-begotten Son of God, so that He becomes the Son of Man, and in a body like ours, with the properties of His Divine nature, in our human nature to do away with the consequences of the fall into sin of our first-created Forefathers, in order to bring it to deification. The established tradition of the Annunciation Vigil in the Bigorski monastery follows the piety of the Miyak women from these parts, especially from Galičnik, who come to the monastery every year on the eve of the feast. The archangel proclaimed to the Virgin the first Divine intervention in the line of penetrating events of condescension that would comprise what we call today Divine Dispensation and Plan for man's salvation. The All-Pure Virgin lived completely different from Her ideas of fervent devoutness: instead of living in solitude and undisturbed exile, She lived as a mother and wife, still with the quality of an incomparable bearer of God's word for the road full of sufferings in this earthly life that finally brought Her to the perfect grace of a Heavenly Queen. Mankind by this got the chance to give 'gods by grace'. After the accomplishment of Christ's Dispensation of salvation, the people who desire fervently to follow the teaching of the Son of Mary and in accordance with this unshameful doctrine with God's grace to transform themselves purifying their hearts from passions, will experience deification of their person, to the extent of Christ's gift.

Schools of Thought in Modern Macroeconomics. Perfect Competition. What are the dominant schools of thought within the contemporary macroeconomics. What is the basic macroeconomic model: aggregate demand, aggregate supply and equilibrium real gross domestic product. Principles of Economics Why economics is a science of how people and societies choose to allocate scarce resources and how market economies are solving the central economic problem; What is business cycle and how macroeconomic aggregates move during the cycle. Money and Banking. What are the policy goals and instruments used by the monetary policy, particularly as a macrostabilization policy. Monetary Policy. What is long term economic growth, how it is measured and what are the determinants/factors for economic growth. Imperfect Competition: Monopoly; Oligopoly. How markets for production factors work, and what are the specific features of supply of and demand for the different factors of production: labor, capital, land and entrepreneurship; What is the role of government regulation of business in correcting the failures of the market. Consumption, Saving and Investment. Economic Growth. Markets for Production Factors. Labor Market. International Economics – Basic Aspects: Competitive Advantages, Free Trade vs Protectionism, Balance of Payments, Foreign Exchange Rate. Fiscal Policy. Government and Business: Market Failures and Government Regulation. After completion of the course, students should be able to explain: Why economics is a science of how people and societies choose to allocate scarce resources and how market economies are solving the central economic problem; How in an environment of market economy, the consumer maximizes its utility, and how the firm makes decisions on its production and prices in order to maximize the profit while operating within different market structures; How markets for production factors work, and what are the specific features of supply of and demand for the different factors of production: labor, capital, land and entrepreneurship; Principles of Macroeconomics: Economics as a Science: Definition, Methodology, Basic Principles of Economic Thinking What is the role of government regulation of business in correcting the failures of the market. What is the role of government regulation of business in correcting the failures of the market. How are the key macroeconomic aggregates defined and measured, including: gross domestic product, inflation, unemployment, saving, investment, exchange rates and etc, Theory of Production. What are the policy goals and instruments used by the fiscal policy, particularly as a macrostabilization policy. Demand, Supply and Market Equilibrium.

The Assembly considers that much greater efforts should be made to examine the extent to which member states take due account of gender-based violence and gender-related persecution in their asylum systems, beginning with the collection, analysis and publication of statistics and information on the issue. The Assembly therefore invites the Committee of Ministers to: the legal and procedural approach of member states to gender-based violence and gender-related persecution in the asylum process; the way in which member states cater for the particular needs of victims of gender-based violence and gender-related persecution in the asylum process, for example by providing same-sex interviewers and interpreters who are trained to be gender sensitive; 12359, opinion of the Committee on Equal Opportunities for Women and Men, rapporteur: Mrs Hägg). instruct the appropriate intergovernmental body in the Council of Europe to carry out a study on: the legal and procedural approach of member states to gender-based violence and gender-related persecution in the asylum process; the way in which member states cater for the particular needs of victims of gender-based violence and gender-related persecution in the asylum process, for example by providing same-sex interviewers and interpreters who are trained to be gender sensitive; instruct the Ad hoc Committee on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence (CAHVIO) to ensure that gender-based violence (including domestic violence) and gender-related persecution are adequately taken into account in the future Council of Europe convention on preventing and combating violence against women and domestic violence; Origin - Assembly debate on 8 October 2010 (36th Sitting) (see Doc. 12359, opinion of the Committee on Equal Opportunities for Women and Men, rapporteur: Mrs Hägg). develop gender-sensitive training programmes and tools for those involved in asylum procedures, notably in the areas of interview techniques, finding and using country of origin information, developments in international human rights and refugee law, and drafting of decisions. the way in which member states cater for the particular needs of victims of gender-based violence and gender-related persecution in the asylum process, for example by providing same-sex interviewers and interpreters who are trained to be gender sensitive; the social situation and legal status of asylum seekers who claim to be victims of gender-based violence and gender-related persecution before, during and after the asylum procedure; initiate a set of guidelines, based on the above-mentioned study, to ensure that gender-based violence and gender-related persecution are adequately taken into account in national asylum processes and in the asylum programmes of member states; In this way, Krka has been pursuing the vertically integrated business model, which allows for complete control over the manufacturing process, from development of a raw material to a finished product. The synthesis plant designs include the latest technological solutions, and are in line with GMP and European standards for occupational and environmental safety. In the past decade, we have allocated €1.3 billion to investments. In the Russian Federation, when the Krka-Rus plant marked its 10th anniversary in 2013, we completed one of the most important investment projects in the Krka Group, the construction of the Krka-Rus 2 plant. The Notol 2 plant, a new cutting-edge plant for manufacturing solid dosage forms, is the result of increased investments. This is the largest investment in the history of Krka. All this guarantees the highest level of product and occupational safety. We at Krka pursue the strategic objective of developing our generic pharmaceuticals by investing in research and development, and in our production and distribution centres around the world. The construction of the fourth development and control centre, with its completion due in 2019, is currently Krka's most substantial investment. Krka has been constantly upgrading its infrastructure so as to provide quality support to business functions of the complete Krka Group. Its distinctive features include closed production systems, the vertical flow of raw materials, and a high degree of automation and computer control.

With the marking of one year of the full membership of Republic of North Macedonia in NATO, the liaison office ceased functioning given our direct participation in all NATO activities, both politically and militarily. With the marking of one year of the full membership of Republic of North Macedonia in NATO, the liaison office ceased functioning given our direct participation in all NATO activities, both politically and militarily. At the meeting, the interlocutors discussed the future activities which are in front of the Army of Republic of North Macedonia in the NATO Alliance, the current transformation and the modernization in order to achieve full integration in all segments of NATO. The mission of the office was advisory regarding the military aspect of the reforms which are undertaken in the Ministry of Defense and the Army of Republic of North Macedonia, and also support of the NATO joint operations on the Balkans. The Chief of General Staff of the Army, Lieutenant General Vasko Gjurchinovski today had a farewell meeting with Colonel Zoran Jankovic, Chief of the NATO liaison office which a year after the full membership of Republic of North Macedonia in the Alliance successfully completes its counseling mission in the country. The mission of the office was advisory regarding the military aspect of the reforms which are undertaken in the Ministry of Defense and the Army of Republic of North Macedonia, and also support of the NATO joint operations on the Balkans. At the meeting, the interlocutors discussed the future activities which are in front of the Army of Republic of North Macedonia in the NATO Alliance, the current transformation and the modernization in order to achieve full integration in all segments of NATO. The NATO liaison office in Republic of North Macedonia exists from Aprill 2002, while in the current form functions from April 2012. The homeowner associations of 32 apartment buildings responded to the ongoing call for financial support by the local government, agreeing to the criteria at least 70% of the apartments to replace the energy inefficient external doors and windows. New memorandum for continuation of the cooperation with the municipality of Centar Eleven facades of apartment buildings were already renovated in cooperation with Habitat Macedonia during the past year. Partnerships for energy efficiency Andrej Zernovski, the Mayor of the Municipality Centar and Zoran Kostov, the Executive Director of Habitat Macedonia Habitat Macedonia and the municipality of Centar in Skopje will continue the successful cooperation after the new Mayor Andrej Zernovski confirmed that the municipality will maintain its financial support for new thermal insulation façade installment to the existing collective apartment buildings, for the purpose of reducing the consumption of heating energy. There are 15 apartment buildings planned for renovation during the next phase, for which the municipality allocated 11 million MKD. According to the already established model, the homeowners of the selected buildings will be offered non-profit loan by Habitat Macedonia aimed at replacement of external doors and windows, along with legal and logistical support necessary for reaching the agreement which is set e precondition for any intervention on the façade, by the Housing Law considered common space of the apartment building. For the purpose of verification of the cooperation Zoran Kostov, the Executive Director of Habitat Macedonia and Andrej Zernovski, the Mayor of the Municipality Centar signed new MoU.

Ccm submitted to the parliament its proposals for the law on insurance in case of unemployment In this regard it is proposed a retention period of five years of compensation. At the 10th session of the Economic and Social Council, held on November 21, 2011, CCM and KSS said that unions support measures against abuses of the law, but it should not be allowed workers to be damaged that lost the job and truly redundant. There are 4 proposed substantive changes in the existing Draft Law. CCM requires more liberal and less restrictive approach to the right to compensation and considers that, according to European standards, older workers should be entitled to special protection. Angelko Angelkovski, Zivko Mitrevski and Pavel Trendafilov before the Parliament The law regulating redundancy will be voted in the Parliament on January 16th. CCM believes that the Government needs to find mechanisms to prevent abuses, but also to protect persons who are not guilty for remaining jobless. This applies particularly to older workers, who for 5 years will exercise the right to pension. A key change that the Government and the Ministry of Labour and Social Policy made to the Law is to reduce the period of benefit use from 5 years to 18 months. Today the President of the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia Zivko Mitrevski, the General Secretary of the Council of CCM Andjelko Angjelkovski, as well as the President of SGIP Pavel Trendafilov officially submitted to the Parliament proposals and positions of CCM Presidency on the Draft Law Amending the Law on Employment and Insurance in Case of unemployment.

They know how to give you the space you need in order to park and let you pass them should you be in a hurry. Nonetheless, if they make up their minds to it, they can be excellent drivers. Your neighbor is nuts about antique cars. It is said that the contemporary world is full of conflict because people do not want, do not know how, or are unable to communicate with one another. If you blow your horn to try to get them to clear your way or to go faster, thickheaded from birth as they are, they will not move an inch or will drive even more slowly. Everything is quite clear, we are facing His Majesty the Lion. As every orderly person does, he will strictly stick to highway regulations and will scrupulously respect each sign. Your neighbor doesn’t stop washing and getting his little economy car to shine, disinfecting the interior and exterior and never allowing his passengers to smoke inside the passenger cell. Over 30 pages long, your Astroscopia Natal Chart reveals everything you need to know about yourself and your destiny. Nonetheless, Scorpios are considered among the most lucid, cold-blooded drivers around who know how to find a way out of every situation. And if, on top of it all, they happen to be hungry, they could hardly care less about the traffic jam they are creating as they sit behind the wheel devouring a huge sandwich. Lost in the details, he more often than not messes up in regular situations, especially when driving at night and while moving on a major highway. Sagittarians will not take their foot off the accelerator and speed into their garage at 200 an hour. He will simply love the trip, will always be available and will amuse you to no end throughout the journey. Do not worry about it, since even though they love to win at the driving game and get themselves into danger without thinking twice about it, Geminians are among the best drivers in the entire traffic. This is the reason why Aquarians just love to be accompanied and are the first ones to stop and offer their help to other drivers, even when no one asks them. With them, you never know how they are going to behave in any given situation but you can bet that they prize beautiful cars. Hence, they loose contact with reality, react automatically and can create traffic problems. When he purchases a new automobile, in spite of all the alarm systems installed in it, he will not leave its side from fear of someone stealing it. What is more, he could not care less about the number of violations he incurs in the process. This is how come they immediately repair their vehicle’s “flaws”. And when the red light prevents him from doing what he wants, he will swear at it endlessly. Then, his mistakes will pile on high along with his feelings of helplessness and depression. Lively and versatile, Geminians feel like they are crippled whenever they are without a car. Scorpio As you are strolling through the urban sprawl, you notice that one of the drivers whistles at every skirt passing by. Besides, he expects other drivers to always give him priority and to clear the way so he can pass to the front of the lane. Individualistic and original, Aquarians either love or hate to drive. And if they have the means, they change them often. Cancer You can be sure that you are dealing with an impulsive Arian, aggressive and intrepid. If you ever have the good luck to find yourself in the copilot’s seat next to him, you will understand what Monza circuit participants feel, provided that you do not annoy the Arian by telling him how he should drive. As drivers, Capricorns are impatient and thrust themselves brashly into the traffic. This is the reason why, not wanting to quarrel with others, they hardly ever cut-in on others and always allow other vehicles to pass them instead. If you embark on a long trip, pick a Sagittarian to drive next to you. Many conflicts could certainly be avoided if, from our way of driving and our behavior at the wheel, we could decipher the impulses and reactions we and others have. In other words, Pisceans give in to others and often drive all wrapped-up in their inner world. If ever fate should have it that you find yourself occupying the passenger’s seat next to a Leo and you are not in the mood to compliment him on either his car or his driving expertise, the best thing for you to do is to keep your lips sealed. However, if you are not traveling on a low traffic road, then get ready to see how this Cancerian panics and begins to behave uncontrollably from the moment of the first traffic jam. Among Librans you will find the most daring and the most courteous drivers. They keep steady nerves in the midst of dangerous situations but one must not forget that they are the ones who provoke them. They manage to emerge untouched from the biggest jam situations. Aries The most striking thing about them is that they need company while driving, and this is the reason why they often pick up hitchhikers. Do not open your eyes any wider, it is not a dream but only a sociable and talkative Geminian having fun with his friends. Otherwise, before you have had a chance of counting to five, it is quite possible you will find yourself hitting the pavement again. While driving in town, you notice that the driver of the red sports coupe next to you is on edge as he waits for the traffic light to change, that he suddenly speeds away before the light has turned to green, that he keeps his hand constantly on the horn and that he tries to pass everyone ahead of him. This is the reason why, if you are in love with a Cancerian, let him drive in the copilot’s place. Always to be found in a comfy vehicle, Pisceans come to the verge of tears whenever being in a hurry they find themselves stalled at the red light. She will not fail to give you a passing hand. This is the reason why, once he has bought it, he will drive his vehicle for the rest of his days before willing it to children and grand-children. There is hence nothing surprising about him repairing his car himself as well as washing it, since a mechanic’s services are too big an expense for the thrifty Capricorn. Nonetheless, if you wish for your Capricorn to preserve his cold blood, above all don’t tell him what he has to do. Exaggeratedly vain and easy to vex, the Arian will not tolerate the defeat and you could wind up with a squashed nose. Slow and thickheaded in everyday life, Taureans are slow and thickheaded when it comes to driving style. And no doubt freedom for them is a must but to be in someone’s company is synonymous with happiness. This is the reason why you can try following them: they will get you out any traffic jam you run into. Aquarians are visionaries ready to spend their life in the garage, trying to create a vehicle worthy of Back to the future. Pisces When you take a second look and see that the car in no way matches the driver, neither in style nor age, then the conclusion can only be the following: you are dealing with a Scorpio, secretive and sex-crazy. It resembles a living-room on four wheels, with handmade cushions on the back seats. Leo In the luxury car ahead of you, the driver is constantly admiring his own appearance on the rearview mirror. Waiting for the light to turn green, an old but well-kept automobile is right next to you. Who are you, after all, to criticize the King? Fortunately, whenever they are not happy with their automobile but have no money to change it, all they have to do is turn their imagination on in order to transform it into their dream car. Besides, the most audacious and spiritual among them will find a way of attracting the highway patrol only for the heck of making jokes at them. Behavior at the wheel, seen as a way of communicating, is truly a magnifying glass that enlarges our faults and virtues. Yes, no doubt, it is a representative of the Virgo sign.

People drove at a speed of 30 or 40 kilometers per hour on the old road, there were many car accidents and the drivers were struggling to avoid the holes and bumps so as not to damage their vehicles, Gruevski stressed. Vice Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Zoran Stravreski pointed out that the promise made to the citizens that the paving, i.e. the old road will be replaced with new and modern one, has been fulfilled. Home Surdulica – Radicevo section on the national road Stip-Strumica put in use Two intersections at Kalugerica and Radicevo, one underpass, one overpass and five bridges and 13 passages were built. – This year, construction of the already commenced regional roads will be completed, those being Radovis-Konce-Lubnica, afterwards Angelci- Veljusa – Vodoca – Banica, Struga- Debar and Kavadarci Ljusev Grob, being 73.4 km long in total, an investment, which is worth EUR 10.2 million, Gruevski said. He stressed that there is ongoing design process of Veles-Kadrifakovo section, being 23 km long. Construction of this road, as Minister Janakieski said, being significant for all citizens of southeastern Macedonia means commitment, and it is this commitment that makes us different from the other political parties. This year, he added, improvement of the local road network of 108 local roads with total length of around 160 kilometers, will continue, for which EUR 14 million will be allocated. – Delay in the construction was a result of the problems with the previous contractor and the European economic crisis, however, the promise made to the citizens and the responsibility we feel towards them, were stronger than anything, they were our guide to overcome these problems, and we did overcome all difficulties and problems, Stavreski said. He pointed out that the Government will continue to continue and asphalt the roads so as for the inhabited areas to be better connected and developed, for farmers and traders to be able to more easily and more quickly transport their products in the country and abroad and for citizens to be able to communicate among each other as quick and safe as possible. Before us, there is the new road across which the citizens will move much faster and safer. Project is worth around Denar 455 million. Regional road Radovis- Strumica, according to Prime Minister Gruevski, today presents one of the most beautiful sections in this region of the country. – By the middle of the year, the design process should be completed, and afterwards tender for contractor should be announced, and in the second half of this year, construction should be commenced of the section that will have four lanes with total width of 11.2 meters, almost twice the width compared to the existing section, at which there are 11 black spots, Georgievski said. Radovis, 26th January 2013 (MIA) – On Saturday, Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski, Vice Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Zoran Stavreski, Minister of Transport and Communications Mile Janakieski and the Director of Public Enterprise for State Roads Ljupco Georgevski, put Surdulci -Radicevo section on the national road Stip-Strumica, in use. – We strive to realize each project that will become part of our Programme, since we offer specific projects and make precise promises to the citizens, and we do everything we can to realize them, Janakieski said. In early 2019, Vasil Hadžimanov Band released their seventh album "Lines in Sand", again in collaboration with the American music label "MoonJune Records". For the past 20 years, Vasil and his band have performed their music at concerts and music festivals around the world. He graduated from the University of Berkeley in the United States and today is one of the most famous jazz pianists in Europe. In 2001, Vasil Hadžimanov Band released their first album "11 reasons for..." under the Serbian label PGP-RTS, and in 2016 took a big step forward, releasing their sixth album "Alive" for the prestigious American record label "MoonJune Records ” in New York. The musicians in the band have a completely authentic musical sounding and a unique approach to jazz music: Vasil Hadžimanov - keyboards, piano, Branko Trijić - guitar, Miroslav Tovirats - bass, Bojan Ivković - percussion, skate vocals, Viktor Filipovski - drums. Vasil Hadžimanov Band embodyies its creatorч idea to combine Balkan traditional folk rhythms and Western modern musical styles (jazz, funk, rock, progressive).

US is trying to block the Russian S-300 and S-400 missile defense systems WASHINGTON, (BM) – The US Department of Defense plans to deploy Patriot air defense / missile defense systems in Iraq, the appearance of which in this Middle Eastern state will automatically block the Russian S-300 and S-400 for official Baghdad, learned BulgarianMilitary.com. According to the channel, the US military did not try to intercept Iranian missiles due to the lack of missile defense systems. Baghdad is currently trying to discourage Washington’s attempts to send its air defense and missile defense assets to Iraq, as this will make this country dependent on the work of American defense systems, which Baghdad is not at all happy with. This cookies is set by Youtube and is used to track the views of embedded videos. Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc. “To protect these American soldiers (in Iraq – ed.), Patriot air defense systems are likely to be installed,” the Fox News commentator reports with reference to senior US officials. Senior Pentagon officials explained to the channel that rocket fire from Iran was considered “unlikely,” so the Patriot air defense systems were not deployed at an Iraqi base, RIA Novosti reported, citing American sources.

Code of Conduct The demands we place on ourselves, our employees and our partners. This sets in stone binding moral standards for our daily business and provides the basis for our collaboration with colleagues, suppliers, partners and customers. In order to achieve this, we focus on the ability, the strength and the commitment of all people in the orange world of GW – “Do what is right and others will follow your example.” GW is committed to fair competition and social responsibility towards both the population and the environment: the company denounces discrimination and child labour, advocates human rights and takes measures for employment, occupational and environmental protection. We have understood our responsibilities for generations.

Volunteering programme “Make a change, be a volunteer vol.5” (January – April 2018); Open opportunities for including young people and mentors in projects run by Youth Can More information about the open call for participants “Make a change – Be a volunteer” is available here: http://youthcan.org.mk/пoBиk-зa-yчecHици-make-a-change-be-a-volunteer-vol-5/ In addition, there is an open call for engaging mentors in the following programmes of the project: Youth ideas competition „Unleash your idea” (May – July 2018). Within the project “Academy for Youth Activism”, as part of the volunteering programme “Make a change, be a volunteer vol.5”, Youth Can opens a call for 25 young people age 17 to 22 years old, who would like to participate in order to improve their local community and make a change in the society, while taking on new experiences, knowledge and developing various skills. The objective of the project is to motivate young people to create positive changes in society, as well as to promote youth activism and volunteering as the main tools for personal and professional development. The selected mentors will go through a training on mentoring, during December 2017. Afterwards they will be appointed by random choice to the various teams of young people, that will be formed. More information about the open call for mentors at the “Academy for Youth Activism” is available here: http://youthcan.org.mk/пoBиk-зa-MeHTopи-akaдeMиja-зa-MлaдиHc/ The role of the mentors will be to follow the team and its development, during the realisation of a particular initiative.

Alkaloid marked 25% growth in consolidated export, investments of MKD 275.5 million and 56 new employments in the period January - March 2020 Sales The business plan for 2020 adopted by the Managing Board of Alkaloid AD Skopje at its session held on December 27th 2019, anticipates investment of around 14% of the consolidated sales in tangible and intangible assets from own sources, a growth in consolidated sales of at least 7% compared to 2019, as well as a growth in pre-tax consolidated profit of at least 7% in comparison with 2019. The higher sales growth in the first quarter of 2020 is partly due to the increase in the security level of stocks of medicinal products among large number of our customers, especially in the export markets, which was particularly important for them in the difficult conditions for transport of goods. The breakdown of total consolidated sales by group of products shows that the best sellers are the products from the segment Pharmaceuticals – 88%, with OTC products accounting for 22%, antibiotics - 21%, cardiovascular products - 13%, neurological products – 12%, etc. According to the unaudited standalone Income Statement, in the period January- March 2020, the sales reached the amount of MKD 2,509,772,821 - 19% up compared to the same period last year. The total investments in non-current assets for the period January – March 2020 amounted to MKD 275,561,903, an increase of 42% compared to the first quarter in 2019. In March 2020 the management board of Alkaloid AD Skopje reached a decision on approval and payment of holiday allowances for its employees. The amount paid was MKD 29,687 gross or MKD 26,718 net. Shares According to the unaudited standalone Income Statement, in the period January- March 2020, the sales reached the amount of MKD 2,509,772,821 - 19% up compared to the same period last year. The breakdown by region shows that the countries of South-East Europe account for 36% of the sales, 23% of the sales were realized in the countries from Western Europe (EU and EFTA), Russia and CIS – 11%, while the other markets account for 2% of the total consolidated sales. At the end of March 2020 there were 1,684 employees in Alkaloid AD Skopje and 574 employees in its subsidiaries and representative offices in the country and abroad, totaling 2,258 employees. The Chemistry Cosmetics Botanicals segment accounts for 12% of the total consolidated sales, or more precisely Chemistry – 2%, Cosmetics – 7% and Botanicals – 3%. Operating results The share price of Alkaloid AD Skopje in January-March 2020 ranged from MKD 8,354.00 to MKD 13,400.00, with an average of MKD 12,114.03 per share which is 45% up compared to the average price in the same period in 2019. Globally, the gradual easing of restrictions, the restart of production facilities in various industries, the establishment of new rules and procedures for functioning in these complex conditions, give hope that, although in much more difficult circumstances, working conditions will slowly improve. Based on the results thus far, taking into consideration the expectations for the upcoming period, the Management of the company estimates that the planned sales and profit for 2020 are going to move within the already set planning goals. Russia and CIS region increased by 23%, sales in the USA increased by 39%, and sales in Western Europe (EU and EFTA) increased 12%. Consolidated earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA), which reached MKD 541,246,199 saw an increase of 10%, whereas the net consolidated profit amounting to MKD 314,485,791 went up by 7%. Alkaloid marked 25% growth in consolidated export, investments of MKD 275.5 million and 56 new employments in the period January - March 2020 In the coming period, it is expected that during the second and third quarters there will be a certain balance in the level of supplies among customers and a decrease in the growth of sales revenues compared to the initial quarter. For example, if the primary cancer is localized in the breast and gave metastases in the liver, it is again called metastatic breast cancer (not liver cancer) and is treated according to the manner in which it is necessary to treat breast cancer. Treatment of cancer depends on the origin of the primary cancer. It occurs when cancer cells infiltrate the blood and lymphatic system and thus reach other tissues in which the metastases appear. Depending on the situation, the treatment may include biological therapy, radiation therapy, surgery or their combination. Where do primary carcinomas metastasize most often? Some of the metastatic tumors don't have symptoms. In order to form the metastases,the cancer cells need to undergo several stages: to get out of the primary cancer, to enter the blood / lymphatic system whereby they could reach a new organ, to be able to "survive" at the new localization and to be able to defend themselves from the organism's immune system. The goal of treatment is to reduce the spreading of cancer. Most of these cells die, but some may invade new tissues, which again begin to grow and form new tumors. Symptoms of metastatic tumors depend on the size and location of the metastases. Metastatic cancer occurs as a result of having a primary cancer in a certain part of the body that has spread to other tissues and organs. The treatment is systemically performed with chemotherapy and hormone therapy. Generally, cancer cells that spread beyond the primary tumor cross into the bloodstream. Thus, they can reach every part of the body. In some cases the primary cancer is revealed through symptoms whichthe metastatic cancer caused. Treatment

Pitropova, Biljana and Temjanovski, Riste (2018) Analysis and implementation of "green marketing" in the Republic of Macedonia, with special focus on promoting healthy nutrition. Keywords: Sustainable marketing, green marketing, green consumers, green products, sustainability, Republic of Macedonia A special focus is on the so-called new consumer group called "green consumers". Abstract The terms "sustainable marketing" and "green marketing" are becoming more popular in theory, as well as through their increased implementation in the business world. Social networks are rated as the most suitable channel the promotion of green products and sustainable marketing. An overview of the strengths and weaknesses of green marketing and its implementation is made, as well as the main barriers it faces. Analysis and implementation of "green marketing" in the Republic of Macedonia, with special focus on promoting healthy nutrition Primary research explores the hypothesis that green marketing could be effectively implemented in a specific economy such as the Republic of Macedonia. Through a number of different quantitative and qualitative methods, the research confirmed the general hypothesis, with Macedonian consumers having developed awareness that is favorable for the promotion of green products, where the main barrier to implementation is the price.

Signed new Collective Agreement of the Ministry of Interior Dear employees of the Ministry of Interior of the Republic of North Macedonia, we would like to inform you that today, 24.06.2021 in Skopje, the President of the MPS, Dr. Marjan Kicev and the Minister of Interior, Oliver Spasovski signed the new Collective Agreement of the Ministry of Interior. I have been personally participating in the working group and would like to inform you that during the period of several months hard work we have had both good and bad moments, under the coordination of the State Secretary Nestorovska, to whom I would like to express my special gratitude, and we have managed to make a new CA of the Ministry of Interior. We have confirmed a number of new labour rights with which we can freely say that we have written a history of trade unionism in the Republic of North Macedonia. Today we do not stop here, but on the contrary, we will continue together in the institutional struggle for better labor rights for the employees in the Ministry of Interior" said the President of the MPS, Dr. Marjan Kicev at the signing the CA. The new Collective Agreement is a product of several months of hard work of the working group in which the representatives of the MPS have presented the proposals of the membership, in order to improve all social and professional, normative and other standards necessary to improve the working conditions of all employees in the Ministry of Interior in the new Collective Agreement. Our employees in this modern time exercise their rights only through cooperation and dialogue between the employer and the representatives of the workers, in this case of the Ministry of Interior and MPS. As President of the Macedonian Police Union, the only representative union within the Ministry of Interior, I am proud that we have participated in the preparation of the new collective agreement of the Ministry of Interior. This year, 139 students in three categories from private and state schools in Macedonia wrote essays on the topic: "What is the influence and importance of social media on our lives today?" The award ceremony of Macedonia's National Essay Contest that is organized third year in a row in partnership among SEEU Language Center, the National Association of English Teachers (ELTAM) and Peace Corps Macedonia was held on Friday, April 3, 2015 at the US Embassy in Skopje. Besa Bytyqi, the SEEU Language Center representative, presented the gifts to the winners. The US Ambassador, his Excellency, Mr. Jess Baily, who was hosting this ceremony, expressed his satisfaction with the contest and his gratitude to South East European University for their support and work in promoting the English language teaching in the country and supporting events of this kind.

Results: The advantages of flexible partial dentures primarily arise from their flexibility and elasticity, which enable unrivaled growth and development of orofacial structures. They cannot be broken easily. Totally aesthetically, the clasps are made from the same material, the children do not have metal in the mouth and do not complain about pain when wearing them. The purpose of the study was to show flexible partial prostheses as a method for prosthetic treatment in children. Conclusion: Partial dentures in childhood should only be temporary solutions until the development and development of children is completed. Materials and Methods: The materials for this study were obtained with extensive searches from the relevant literature. They have very low weight. Denture base is reduced, thus avoiding the feeling of nausea in children. Background: Prosthetic treatment in children aims to restore aesthetics, to preserve the space for the future permanent tooth, to enable proper development of orofacial structures in all three planes, as well as to enable prevention of temporomandibular diseases. Dentures are biocompatible and not allergic.

The Network plan is to publish one (1) policy paper on the Berlin process and the Credible European Perspective until the London Summit. The paper will be promoted at Chatham House, the Royal Institute of International Affairs during the Western Balkan London Summit on the 9/10 July. The conference participants are high representatives of the European Union and the United States, the countries of the region, including Macedonian Prime Minister Zoran Zaev and Bulgaria's Minister of Foreign Affairs Ekaterina Zaharieva, international, regional and civic organizations organizations and representatives of the international donor community. The Network encompasses think tanks, civil society organisations and individuals from the 6 Western Balkan countries plus Croatia and Slovenia. Besides the Institute for Democracy "Societas Civilis" (IDSCS) which will coordinate the Network,the SEE Think Net Network includes the Network of the European Movement in Serbia (NEMinS), Open Society Foundation for Albania and its affiliate, the EU Policy Hub, Adnan Ćerimagić, Politikon Network from Montenegro, Kosovo Centre for Security Studies, the Institute for Development and International Relations (IRMO) from Croatia and the Centre for European Perspective (CEP) from Slovenia. As such, its activities are devised in order to closely monitor the Berlin process and the policy areas the process encompasses. Zoran Necev from the Institute for Democracy as a representative of the Network, will explain her role at the international conference "Democracy That Delivers: Unlocking the Western Balkans Potential" which will take place in Sofia (Bulgaria) on May 16th. The goal of the SEE Think Net Network is to produce significant policy inputs and provide policy recommendations on topics that derive from the Berlin Process. In addition, the SEE Think Net Network will produce five (5) policy briefs on migration, security and rule of law which will be promoted in Skopje, Belgrade and Tirana during the week before the London Summit. The SEE Think Net Network was established in mid-march 2018 with the generous support of the European Fund for the Balkans as the first regional network composed of civil society organisations that aim to monitor the topics related to the Berlin Process.

Skopje, 10th January 2013 (MIA) – Ranking Macedonia as the best in SEE region in the latest Economic Freedom Report of "Heritage" Foundation and "Wall Street" Journal affirms government policies on business climate improvement, Vice Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Zoran Stavreski, stated. Stavreski: "Heritage" ranking – confirmation of government policies on business climate improvement As for the possibility to reduce the price of the green card for cars, as well as to introduce a possibility for the green card to cover a shorter period of time, rather then being linked with the car registration, he pointed out that such analyses were continuously made. Home Stavreski: "Heritage" ranking – confirmation of government policies on business climate improvement – We have continuously made analyses as regards possibilities, trends and needs of the drivers, as well as the developments in the insurance companies and depending on such analyses, should there be a possibility in any stage, we will certainly adopt additional measures thereto, Vice Prime Minister Stavreski added. – Macedonia is once again the best in the region, and this is just a confirmation that what we do is a systemic improvement as regards the environment for businesses' operations, entrepreneurial freedom and possibilities for a level-playing field for the companies. It is an incentive for us to see if there is additional room for improvements and, from year to year, we will analyse the room for additional measures, Stavreski said, following the meeting with the representatives of the Motorcycle Federation of Macedonia.

Laminated glass can be broken, but the fragments tend to adhere to the plastic layer and remain largely intact, reducing the risk of injury. In the event of breaking, it is held in place by an interlayer, typically of polyvinyl butyral (PVB) or ethylene-vinyl acetate (EVA), between its two or more layers of glass. It can be broken, but the fragments tend to adhere to the plastic layer and remain largely intact, reducing the risk of injury. Laminated Glass in color Laminated glass is a type of safety glass that holds together when shattered. The glass and interlayers can be of a variety of colors and thicknesses as requested by the client.

Donor: European Union The long term goal of the project is to achieve more coordinated action of women CSO's on the issue of gender based violence and domestic violence towards encouraging effective policy framework, improved services and institutional and public awareness. Duration: November 2016 – January 2017 Duration: January 2017 – December 2018 This means establishing support systems and mechanisms for protection for domestic violence victims with tendency to apply to all forms of gender based violence in future. Project title: "Violence against women and media: Improvement of media reporting techniques and media coverage of violence against women cases" Duration: April 2014 – December 2014 Implemented projects: Project title: "Violence against Women as Part of the Agenda of Political Parties" Objective: Making violence against women a priority issue in the political parties programs in the pre-election period Duration: March 2015 –November 2015 The aim of this project is improving national legislation and mechanism for protection concerning domestic violence victims and advocating for ratification of the Council of Europe Convention for prevention and combating violence against women and domestic violence. Main objective of the project is improvement of cooperation between civil society organizations and media in order to increase the awareness among general population about existence of different forms of violence against women, so as joint approach in the process of advocating for ratification of the Council of Europe Convention for preventing and combating violence against women and domestic violence. Project title: "Advocating for adoption of social package for support of women victims of domestic and intimate partner violence" Overall goal of the project is improving national legislation concerning domestic violence victims and presenting the need and developing concrete action plan that will include needed changes in order to have applicable CoE Convention for prevention and combating violence against women and domestic violence. Duration: November 2016 –March 2018 Project title: "Violence against Women as Part of the Agenda of Political Parties" Donor: CIVICA Mobilitas, Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation project, implemented by NIRAS from Denmark, the Macedonian Center for International Cooperation (MCIC) from Macedonia and the Swedish Institute for Public Administration (SIPU) from Sweden Project title: "Strengthening the capacities of the National network to end violence against women and domestic violence" Project title: Designing and piloting a survivors' oriented and integrated approach to immediate protection to survivors of domestic violence offered by Civil society organizations (partner organization of H.E.R. Goal of the project is coordinated action of women CSO's on issues related to gender based violence and domestic violence towards development of effective policies, improved services and increased awareness of general public and institutions. This means establishing support systems and mechanisms for protection for domestic violence victims with tendency to apply to all forms of gender based violence in future. Donor: Open Gate Association for action against violence and trafficking in human beings Project title: "Establishment of national helpline for positive parenting counselling" The goal is to contribute to the establishment of comprehensive legal and political solutions for protection from gender-based violence in the Western Balkans, so as conditions for achievement of democracy, human rights, social inclusion and harmonization with EU values. Objective: Establishment of effective framework for support of women victims of domestic violence that will contribute towards ending the violence and prevention from happening in the future, through improved access to relevant data and analysis for the challenges that women victims are facing, and towards development of models for protection and support; improved dialog with decision makers for enhancing the existing support system for women victims of violence; and increased public awareness for the challenges that women victims of domestic and intimate partner violence are facing. In this paper, we show one of the first research conducted in the framework of the European Observatory of Violence, which shares the same methodology and tools in order to compare the climate and school violence in secondary schools in two different countries Europe such as Spain and France. REVIEWER’S COMMENTS ON THE DOCUMENT: This article highlights by exposing the lack of effective cooperation that has not had utililzado the same tools and procedures validated by a comparative study between European countries. It was necessary to make real comparative studies used the same methodology, and the same tools and procedures for collecting and analyzing data. And is precisely what has been done in the study presented, made under the European Observatory of School Violence., in which data contrast between Spain and France. This article aims to make clear that there is international concern by phenomenon of school violence.

Remote controlled motorisation is provided by utilising European technology (SOMFY) through a custom built direct drive motor system to ensure smooth and quick operation at 34RPM. General Features The system is manufactured to size using high grade 6063 extruded aluminium profiles finished with thermosetting powder coating which provides superior overall performance for exterior product applications. The EVA system offers up to 65sqm of protection at the touch of a button but when required linking multiple systems is also possible and made easy by our patented Storm Channel joining system that ensures 100% waterproof join every time. The heart of the system is driven by multiple Suntech F3 eight wheel slider carriages (Each F3 slider carriage has a load limit of 600kgs) that incorporates a triple layer barrier system and works in conjunction with a timing belt that has been reinforced with multiple internal stainless steel cables to provide a pulling strength of over 966kg. To ensure the highest level of protection Suntech systems focus on all the details, this is why all Suntech systems come standard finished with Stormguard Soft Touch edge seal on all parameters. The German manufactured, fire rated and 100% waterproof architectural membrane fabric is available in a range of colours in both opaque and transparent that provides maximum stability and resistance to temperature, moisture and dirt. The Eva rafter profiles (54 x 135 mm) have been designed with unique Water Guard side channels and allow for projections up to 5m per system. Stormguard provides the ultimate protection against rain and draught intrusion around the outside of the system and is only available on our systems. When not in use the fabric is neatly retracted under the systems hood to provide protection from the elements when not required. All bolts, screws and pins are high grade stainless steel to ensure extended system life. The EVA retractable pergola system provides an elegant outdoor covering to allow outdoor areas to be used in even the worst of weather conditions. It does not shrink or bag, and the acrylic top coating makes it very easy to clean for years to come. This extra attention to detail is what sets us apart from our competitors and is why we are at the forefront of our market worldwide.

Women - members of the NCGE prepared tasty food for this celebration, and everyone present enjoyed in the children's performance. At the end, certificates of appreciation were awarded to the supporters of this event. On 12.05.2013 National Council for Gender Equality, in collaboration with "SOS Children's Village" and Komercijalna banka AD Skopje, celebrated the international Mother's Day. 2013, on the occasion of the Easter celebrations, traditionally as every year, National Council for Gender Equality has organized a humanitarian event in front of the main church in Skopje St. Kliment Ohridski. On 20.05.2013, in the NCGE premises, in collaboration with the pharmaceutical company "Alvogen", a discussion forum on the subject of "Osteoporosis - causes and consequences of this disease" was held. NCGE has been working on support of women in the rural areas, and the opening of a new kindergarten in a rural area is very significant for the economic strengthening of those women. The greeting cards were being sold for a small donation, and the funds gathered at the event were donated to the "SOS Children's Village". The event took place in Ramstore Mall, in the center of Skopje, and the program included performances by: the children from the "SOS Children's Village" with ballet, the pupils Larisa Veleva and Ana Krckoska with songs and KUD "Jeni Jol" with folklore dance. The participants had the opportunity to get informed and pose questions regarding this disease, and at the end they received a small present from the company. Municipalities On 21.05.2013, traditionally as every year, the National Council for Gender Equality took part in the high school graduation celebration of the young people in the Children's home "11 Oktomvri" in Skopje. More photos from this lovely sunny day can be found here. National Council for Gender Equality, together with its volunteers - the students at the department of Gender Studies at the Faculty of Philosophy in Skopje, donated toys for the new kindergarten in the village Trcino in the municipality Vinica, through the organization "Zlatno Doba" from Vinica, member of the National Council for Gender Equality. The women - members of NCGE have prepared many delicious products that could be bought, and the collected funds from the total 53 sold products will be donated to the new mobile gynecological clinics in the rural areas, for PAP tests.

31.12.2019: Press Release: Country Progress Regarding the Issue of Violence against Women and Domestic Violence Insufficient number of specialized serviced for assisting women and girls victims of gender-based violence "To meet the standards of the Istanbul Convention, there will be a need for additional shelters for victims of sexual and gender-based violence and human trafficking. The Department for Gender Equality within the Ministry of Labor and Social Policy shall play a key coordinative role and must have the appropriate resources in order to ensure efficient implementation of the legal and political tools" – European Commission. As already mentioned, the process of drafting the text of the new Law on Prevention and Protection from Violence against Women and Domestic Violence was transparent and included all relevant stakeholders. Besides by the Working Group of the Human Rights Council, this recommendation was also issued by the Committee on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW). One of the biggest concerns is that no change in the legislation so far has changed the status of women victims of violence and domestic violence, despite the international recommendations Consequently, revision of the national legislation in order to harmonize it with the Istanbul Convention is recommended. Amendments to the Criminal Code are also recommended regarding marital rape and changes in the definition of rape, i.e. deleting the condition for penetration. Besides by the Working Group of the Human Rights Council, this recommendation was also issued by the Committee on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW). In terms of improving the legal framework, the main remark refers to the unrecognized forms of violence against women and girls, and the obstacles women are faced with in getting solutions for temporary protection. Additionally, the new law does not stipulate solutions for the most burning issues – the right to housing (permanent and/or temporary) for women-victims. Furthermore, since 2017, the Ministry has increased the budget for supporting the organizations that offer specialized services for women victims of domestic violence. The process of freezing embryos is carried out by means of a vitrification process that is rapidly absorbed. Freezing the embryos can be recommended for patients with hyperstimulation, inadequate thickness of the endometrium or inadequate hormonal status, reasons that may contribute to reduced implantation of embryos. Frozen eggs are stored in special containers with liquid nitrogen at a temperature of -196 degrees. Cryopreservation of egg cells The egg-freezing procedure begins with the in vitro procedure where the patient receives specific hormone therapy so as to obtain more eggs in the same cycle. The success rate is the same for the fresh transfer and transfer of frozen / dehydrated embryos. The embryo defrosting method is also fast and easy and allows 90% survival of the embryo. This procedure is present in 50-60% of couples who do in vitro fertilization. Once the eggs are punctured they are removed and collected. Frozen eggs are stored in special containers with liquid nitrogen at a temperature of -196 degrees. Under proper laboratory conditions, a proper treatment is carried out and later the eggs are frozen. This process allows quick and safe embryo digestion at -196 ° C in liquid nitrogen. The main purpose of this procedure is patient not exhibiting again on hormone therapy and anesthesia but to accept a therapy that will allow endometrium with appropriate thickness suitable for embryo transfer. The process of freezing eggs is carried out only for those egg cells mature and of good quality. In practice, the only frozen embryos are the ones with good development and good quality in order to reduce the chances of damage or complete extinction of the embryos in the process of freeze / thaw. The frozen embryos are kept in special liquid nitrogen tanks which allow maintenance at a temperature of -196 °. Once the embryos are frozen they can be stored for an indefinite period under the same conditions, but according to the latest standards it is not recommended to keep the embryos longer than five years. Cryopreservation of eggs is recommended for patients planning delayed parenting without a partner, patients with certain types of cancer or other diseases. Embryos may be cryopreserved at all stages of their development, but are usually frozen on the third or fifth day of development. This process allows quick and safe embryo digestion at -196 ° C in liquid nitrogen.

On 12/10/2016, on the Tabanovce border crossing, on a regular border radiation control were detected wagons with metal raw materials (imported from Serbia), with the presence of radioactive source. The Laboratory of ionizing radiation at the Institute of Public Health, has detected the source. The values of the measured dose of ionizing radiation on the outer parts of the wagon, although are two times higher than the values of the surrounding background radiation, do not pose a health risk to employees and other officials of the station Trubarevo. Detected train wagon do not pose a health risk The event, recommending a ban on entry in the country, was immediately reported to the Macedonian Railways – Trubarevo station and to the Direction for Radiation Safety, for further administrative proceedings to return the wagon in the country of origin.
