In the hands of the labourer, it is transformed into revenue which he draws out of the sale of his labour-power, is converted as revenue into means of subsistence and consumed. Or, on the other hand, that what is revenue for the one is capital for another, and that therefore these are but subjective relations. But how, then, the old capital can be replaced when the value of the entire product is consumable in the form of revenue; and how the value of the product of each individual capital can be equal to the value sum of the three revenues plus C, constant capital, whereas the sum of the values of the products of all capitals is equal to the value sum of the three revenues plus 0 — this appears, of course, as an insoluble riddle and must be solved by declaring that the analysis is completely incapable of unravelling the simple elements of price, and must be content to go around in a vicious circle making a spurious advance ad infinitum. Accordingly, a portion of the profit, therefore of surplus-value and thereby also surplus-product, in which (as concerns value) only newly added labour is represented, serves as an insurance fund. 1) The fundamental relationship of constant and variable capital, hence also the nature of surplus-value, and thereby the entire basis of the capitalist mode of production, are not understood. Evidently, therefore, the value of the constant portion of capital is not reproduced in the annually created value of product, for the wages are only equal to the value of the variable portion of capital advanced in production, and rent and profit are only equal to the surplus-value, the excess of value produced above the total value of advanced capital, which equals the value of the constant capital plus the value of the variable capital. It is completely irrelevant to the problem to be solved here that a portion of the surplus-value converted into the form of profit and rent is not consumed as revenue, but is accumulated. — By the way we shall see later that Ricardo now refuted Smith’s false analysis of commodity-price, its reduction to the sum of the values of the revenues. The value of each partial product of capital, each individual commodity, contains a portion of value = constant capital, a portion of value = variable capital (transformed into wages for labourers), and a portion of value = surplus-value (later split into profit and rent). In fact, there is always something more than the wages of the labourer contained in the cost-price, and always more than the profits of enterprise in the selling price, for instance, the price of raw materials, often paid to foreign countries. 998.) It is the materialisation of that portion of the total working-day of the labourer in which the value of variable capital and thus the price of labour is reproduced; that portion of commodity-value in which the labourer reproduces the value of his own labour-power, or the price of his labour. A difference between the product of the individual capitalist and that of society exists only in so far as: from the standpoint of the individual capitalist the net income differs from the gross income, for the latter includes the wages, whereas the former excludes them. Back of this still lurks the idea that the profit, or surplus-value in general, is an excess above the value of the commodity, which can only be made by an extra charge, mutual cheating, or gain through selling. This entire portion of constant capital consumed in production must be replaced in kind. In one stage they form a portion of constant capital, in the other they are consumed individually, and thus pass wholly into the revenue. It is therefore immaterial for our discussion whether the entire surplus-value of the commodities, i.e., all the surplus-labour contained in the commodities, is realised in their price or not. Its normal form presupposes wages corresponding to the value of labour-power. Even monopoly rent, in so far as it is not a deduction from wages, i.e., does not constitute a special category, must always indirectly be a part of the surplus-value. If it is not part of the price excess above the price of production of the commodity itself, of which it is a constituent part (as in differential rent), or an excess portion of the surplus-value of the commodity itself, of which it is a constituent part, above that portion of its own surplus-value measured by the average profit (as in absolute rent), it is at least part of the surplus-value of other commodities, i.e., of commodities which are exchanged for this commodity having a monopoly price. (Revue des deux Mondes, 1848, Tome 24, p. This value thus exists in the form of available additional wealth, in short, from the viewpoint of the individual capitalist, in the form of his revenue. That portion of the value of the product, then, which is destined in the course of reproduction to be converted into wages, into revenue for the labourers, first flows back into the hands of the capitalist in the form of capital, or more accurately variable capital. The portion of the product of Class II which must replace its constant capital is consumed in its natural form by the labourers, capitalists and landlords of Class I. They spend their revenue for this product of II. Furthermore, we saw that the same is true of the value of the annual total product of a society. This double process is revealed through the mediation of money circulation. With the exception of the employed but not consumed portion of fixed capital, the value of the gross output, or gross product, equals the value of capital advanced and consumed in production, that is, constant and variable capital plus surplus-value, which resolves itself into profit and rent. On the other hand, wages, which form the third specific form of revenue, are always equal to the variable component part of capital, i.e., the component part which is laid out in purchasing living labour-power, paying labourers rather than in means of labour. (The labour which is paid in the expenditure of revenue is itself paid in wages, profit, or rent, and therefore does not form any value portion of commodities by which it is paid. The consumed product of II is consumed as revenue by I, and the portion of the revenue of I representing an unconsumable product is consumed as constant capital by II. The latter component part of value, B, is counterposed to the former A, in so far as A, under otherwise equal circumstances: 1) never assumes the form of revenue and 2) always flows back in the form of capital, and indeed constant capital. There can, then, be no net produce, because the cost of production, according to M. Say, consists of rent, wages and profits. On page 508 he says: ‘The value of a product, the value of a productive service, the value of the cost of production, are all, then, similar values, whenever things are left to their natural course.’ For this total labour is divided into necessary labour, by which the labourer creates that value portion of the product with which he is himself paid, that is, his wages, and into unpaid surplus-labour, by which he creates that value portion of the product which represents surplus-value and which is later divided into profit and rent. Here we have the optimism of bourgeois thoughtlessness in the form of sagacity that most corresponds to it. But it is not this change of form which turns it into capital. It is the commodity and its value which now function as capital. However, that the value of the commodity is not paid for — and only by this means does it become surplus-value — is quite irrelevant for the materialisation of labour, the value itself. Thus the yarn of the spinner contains a portion of value representing profit for him, Should the weaver buy the yarn, he realises the profit of the spinner, but for himself this yarn is merely a part of his constant capital. Transformation of profit into capital is no more than employing a portion of excess labour to form new, additional means of production. When this is overlooked the impression is created that the revenue of consumers replaces the entire product, i.e., including the constant portion of value. Just as little is the law of value changed by the circumstance that the equalisation of profit, i.e., the distribution of the total surplus-value among the various capitals, and the obstacles which landed property partially (in absolute rent) puts in the way of this equalisation, bring about a divergence between the regulating average prices and the individual values of commodities. Thus, the value of the annual commodity-product, just like the value of the commodity-product produced by some particular investment of capital, and like the value of any individual commodity, resolves itself into two component parts: A, which replaces the value of the advanced constant capital, and B, which is represented in the form of revenue — wages, profit and rent. Aside from this labour, the labourer performs no labour, and aside from the total value of the product, which assumes the forms of wages, profit and rent, he creates no value. On the other hand, if we leave aside that portion of constant capital which did not pass over into the product, and which therefore continues to exist, although with reduced value, as before the annual production of commodities; in other words, temporarily leaving out of consideration the employed, but not consumed, fixed capital, then the constant portion of advanced capital is seen to have been wholly transferred to the new product in the form of raw and auxiliary materials, whereas a part of the means of labour has been wholly consumed and another part only partially, and thus only a part of its value has been consumed in production. The entire value portion of the annual product, then, which the labourer creates in the course of the year, is expressed in the annual value sum of the three revenues, the value of wages, profit, and rent. Secondly, this is eliminated in the average movement. The price of commodities contains not only an excess over wages, but also over profit, namely, the constant portion of value. For instance, the revenue of the labourers and capitalists of Class I, which produces constant capital, replaces in value and substance the constant capital of the capitalists of Class II, which produces articles of consumption. But even this is an abstraction to the extent that the entire society, on the basis of capitalist production, bases itself on the capitalist standpoint and thereby considers only the income resolved into profit and rent as net income.

Valuable music materials The collection gathers, processes, keeps and lends materials in the area of music and ballet. The holdings also includes audio-visual materials (video tapes and DVD-s), as well as concert posters and programmes. Materials can be used exclusively in the rooms of the Collection. Within the Smokvarski's legate it is unavoidable to mention the piece that has a great importance for the Macedonian music culture, and that is the composition "Scherzzo" for symphonic orchestra, the first Macedonian piece performed by the Macedonian Philharmonic. Catalogues The publications and scores cover all music genres. The Collection participates in the realisation of the activity for protection of the phonogram archives. Integral part of the holdings are also the audio materials: vinyl records, audio tapes, magnetic tracks, CD-s (over 26 000 units). Special place in the Collection take the legate of the composer, conductor and music pedagogue Stefan Gajdov and the legate of the composer Gligor P. Smokvarski. The rare materials include the complete holdings of the ensemble of contemporary music "St. Sofia", as well as the music manuscripts of the Macedonian composers Todor Skalovski, Vladimir Nikolovski, Blagoja Ivanovski, Stojan Stojkov, Jane Kodjabashija and others. Collection of Music Art Activity The Collection of musical art owns printed scores and parts, musical manuscripts, monographic publications for music and ballet (over 25 000 units).

Article 27 (1) No Contracting State shall give diplomatic protection, or bring an international claim, in respect of a dispute which one of its nationals and another Contracting State shall have consented to submit or shall have submitted to arbitration under this Convention, unless such other Contracting State shall have failed to abide by and comply with the award rendered in such dispute. The Secretary-General shall forthwith transmit such notification to all Contracting States. (b) any juridical person which had the nationality of a Contracting State other than the State party to the dispute on the date on which the parties consented to submit such dispute to conciliation or arbitration and any juridical person which had the nationality of the Contracting State party to the dispute on that date and which, because of foreign control, the parties have agreed should be treated as a national of another Contracting State for the purposes of this Convention. (a) any natural person who had the nationality of a Contracting State other than the State party to the dispute on the date on which the parties consented to submit such dispute to conciliation or arbitration as well as on the date on which the request was registered pursuant to paragraph (3) of Article 28 or paragraph (3) of Article 36, but does not include any person who on either date also had the nationality of the Contracting State party to the dispute; and (1) The jurisdiction of the Centre shall extend to any legal dispute arising directly out of an investment, between a Contracting State (or any constituent subdivision or agency of a Contracting State designated to the Centre by that State) and a national of another Contracting State, which the parties to the dispute consent in writing to submit to the Centre. When the parties have given their consent, no party may withdraw its consent unilaterally. (2) "National of another Contracting State" means: A Contracting State may require the exhaustion of local administrative or judicial remedies as a condition of its consent to arbitration under this Convention. Article 26 Consent of the parties to arbitration under this Convention shall, unless otherwise stated, be deemed consent to such arbitration to the exclusion of any other remedy.

Home Stavreski: Affirmation of Fitch good signal to foreign investors Fitch credit rating agency yesterday confirmed the fiscal stability of Macedonia and retained the credit rating of the country to stable "BB+". Skopje, 17th October 2013 (MIA) – The Government is satisfied with the affirmation of the credit rating of the Republic of Macedonia by Fitch credit rating agency. – Very few countries in this economic climate have obtained affirmation of the credit rating, which is important since it sends strong signal to foreign investors about the fact that the Republic of Macedonia is a country, which according to the rating of the international rating agencies, has macroeconomic fiscal stability and appropriate conditions for investing. According to Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Zoran Stavreski, this speaks in favour of the economic policies of the country, being a good signal to foreign investors. In addition, the rating also sends signal to the banking institutions, investment funds and all those that, should participate, in future in purchasing government bonds if issued, that the Republic of Macedonia is a country with sound macroeconomic indicators, being different than the regional countries, which have much higher indebtedness level and much lower growth rates, Stavreski said at today's press conference. Prehistoric Predators: Megalodon The biggest predator ever to swim in the oceans and ruler of the seas for 20 million years, Megalodon weighed 50 tonnes, had a seven foot-wide jaw, and boasted a mouthful of seven inch, razor-sharp teeth. Terrorising waters from Australia to the Americas until it became extinct two million years ago, Megalodon made the great white shark look like small fry. Step back in time to one of the most amazing eras in the history of planet earth and meet terrifying ancient predators.

Martin Brandlmayr (drums, electronics) works in the field between improvised music and composition. Their music is said to create a field of tension between extreme dynamics, freely improvised pieces and precise constructions, as an inherent contrast between soft and sharp notes. John Norman (bass) was born and raised in Gothenburg, Sweden, and has lived in Northern Italy, Glasgow (Scotland) and Innsbruck (Austria) before moving to Vienna in the mid-90s. Martin Siewert, who joined Radian in 2011, is a guitarist with range of interests. The compositional frameworks of Novkovski / Omeragic / Spirovski serve as a fertile ground for a successful music interaction of the ensemble members, where the boundaries of the formal and the free are blurred. They have been influenced by and shaped the city's vivid scene of electronica in the early 2000s. In September last year they released their debut LP Odron Ritual Orchestra, which was selected in several relevant end-of-year lists for best jazz albums in 2019, including that of the independent music platform Bandcamp, as well as in the wider selection of the US public radio network – National Public Radio. He has recently kept busy with playing a lot in New Music contexts, performing with the likes of Uli Fussenegger (Klangforum Wien), Ernesto Molinari, and pianist Katharina Klement, amongst others. Svetlost + Odron Ritual Orchestra is a large ensemble established as a continuation of the successful previous collaboration of Kristijan Novkovski, Deni Omeragic and Ninoslav Spirovski in their own trio called Svetlost. SVETLOST + ODRON RITUAL ORCHESTRA (N. Vienna is currently a wide open creative home to many new music composers and innovators. Today, the members of Radian are pillars of that community. RADIAN (Austria) Envisioned as an open platform for collaboration with musicians of different profiles, the music of this Macedonian lineup changes and depends of the participants involved in the specific project; mostly informed by stylistic directions such as free jazz, post-rock, electro-acoustic music, minimalism and ambient. RADIAN + SVETLOST + ODRON RITUAL ORCHESTRA He works in bands like Trapist, the trio Fake the Facts (with Mats Gustafsson, and dieb13), and with the quartet The Peeled Eye. He has performed and recorded with Otomo Yoshihide, John Tilbury, Christian Fennesz, David Sylvian and many more. He played bass in metal, punk and indie rock bands before joining Radian.

(Bloomberg) – Republic of Macedonia's economy may expand more than 3 percent next year after Prime Minister Zoran Zaev's arrival four months ago ended a two-year political crisis that had stalled investment. In addition, there is a significant improvement in social cohesion and inter-ethnic relations. The yield on the country's euro-denominated bonds maturing in July 2023 fell 2 basis points to an all-time low of 3.2 percent at 5:22 p.m. in Skopje, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Tevdovski for Bloomberg: Rep. of Macedonia Sees Economy Expanding on Restored Confidence The government plans to change its policy "toward greater social justice" and will replace the current 10 percent flat personal tax with a progressive one, Tevdovski said, without giving a time frame for the tax change. We have made considerable progress in terms of political stability, said Tevdovski, a former university professor. Zaev's coalition – with two parties representing ethnic Albanians – consolidated its power after local elections on Sunday. With the end of the political crisis, we are already seeing some pickup in economic activity, which will intensify next year, Tevdovski said. We are determined to keep next year's deficit slightly below this year's, in line with our intention for gradual fiscal consolidation.	Одлучни сме дефицитот следната година да биде незначително помал од оваа година, во согласност со нашата намера за постепена фискална консолидација. As for 2018, an international bond is certainly also an option, given the favorable circumstances on international markets." Growth in gross domestic product will quicken from an estimated 2.2 percent this year, the lowest in five years, driven by increased private consumption and exports, Finance Minister Dragan Tevdovski, 38, said in an emailed answer to Bloomberg questions. The government plans to cut the 2018 budget deficit below this year's 2.9 percent of GDP and may sell debt on global markets, he said. He sees next year's inflation at 1.7 percent, accelerating from 1 percent in 2017. Home Tevdovski for Bloomberg: Rep. of Macedonia Sees Economy Expanding on Restored Confidence Zaev formed a coalition government in June, ushering in the first leadership change in more than a decade and promising to revive the former Yugoslav state's efforts to join the European Union and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, after a wiretap scandal in 2015 ousted the previous administration. His Social Democrats lead in 54 of the country's 81 municipalities, including the capital, Skopje, before a runoff in two weeks. The economy shrank 1.8 percent in the second quarter from a year earlier, after stagnating in the previous three months, according to the statistics office. Considerable Progress The biggest challenge for the Balkan nation of 2 million people "is the successful implementation of comprehensive reforms," including fighting graft and improving rule of law by EU standards, Tevdovski said.

We are convinced that the invitation for NATO membership and the beginning of the accession negotiations with the European Union will be strong encouragement to both sides for finding a solution for the differences regarding the constitutional name of the country; Pointing out that NATO membership is of crucial importance for improvement of the security and stability of the Republic of Macedonia; and aware that the membership in NATO will have a positive effect on the business climate and economic growth and development, which will result in better standard of living for the citizens of the Republic of Macedonia; Principal strategic interest of the Republic of Macedonia is membership in the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), for which there is wide social consensus and support from the citizens; In view of that, we reiterate our commitment and utmost interest in finding a solution for the name dispute under the auspices of the United Nations, a solution that will not bring harm to anyone. We point out the importance that the region remain in the focus of the NATO enlargement process, and we seek support from the member countries for sending an invitation to the Republic of Macedonia for NATO membership at the forthcoming Summit in Chicago, as well as for start of the accession negotiations with the European Union; Having regard to the importance of the tradition and history of the Republic of Macedonia, the country of the Macedonian nation, as well as of the Albanians, Turks, Roma, Serbs, Vlachs, Bosniaks and the other nationalities living in the Republic of Macedonia; We appeal for respect of the legitimacy and legality of the United Nations and the bodies established by the world organization, respect of the international law and its principles, and we refer to the ruling of the International Court of Justice in The Hague and the recommendations from this ruling, with the aim of reflecting objectively the circumstances that affect the Euro-Atlantic integration of the Republic of Macedonia, as well of achieving progress on our path and cooperation with the neighbours; Pursuant to the Decision of the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia from 23 December 1993 on accession of the Republic of Macedonia to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization - NATO; Calling for respect of the international law and the universal values of justice and freedom, as well as for promotion of peace and democracy in the world wherever there is need for that; The integration of the Republic of Macedonia in NATO is the key political commitment, intention and goal shared by all the political parties, social factors and citizens that with their activities bear the responsibility and contribute to the dynamics and quality of the realization of this process; United in our fundamental commitment for further development of the Euro-Atlantic integration processes; Recalling the role of the Republic of Macedonia in the coalition against Fascism, guided by the principles of the Atlantic Charter for self-determination, recognizing the struggle of generations of citizens for organization of the Republic of Macedonia as a Euro-Atlantic, modern state; emphasizing the progress that the country has achieved, and fully aware of the civilizational values of the process of unification of the Euro-Atlantic area, we are committed to further strengthening of the values of the integration of the Republic of Macedonia in NATO; Based on Article 4, paragraph 2 of the Constitution of the Republic of Macedonia, at its session held on 25 April 2012 the Assembly of the Republic of Macedonia adopted the: We call on respect of the NATO open door policy that is the basis of the Alliance, reiterating that the country has fulfilled all the criteria and conditions for membership; we remain committed to the continuation of the reforms and support of the NATO led peacekeeping operations for securing world peace and democracy wherever there is need for that. United in the commitment for further development of the principle of cooperation, as the fundamental value of the Euro-Atlantic integration; DECLARATION REAFFIRMING THE COMMITMENT FOR REALIZATION OF THE STRATEGIC GOAL OF THE REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA FOR NATO MEMBERSHIP We call on respect of the NATO open door policy that is the basis of the Alliance, reiterating that the country has fulfilled all the criteria and conditions for membership; we remain committed to the continuation of the reforms and support of the NATO led peacekeeping operations for securing world peace and democracy wherever there is need for that. This declaration shall be published in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Macedonia. DECLARATION REAFFIRMING THE COMMITMENT FOR REALIZATION OF THE STRATEGIC GOAL OF THE REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA FOR NATO MEMBERSHIP We appeal for respect of the legitimacy and legality of the United Nations and the bodies established by the world organization, respect of the international law and its principles, and we refer to the ruling of the International Court of Justice in The Hague and the recommendations from this ruling, with the aim of reflecting objectively the circumstances that affect the Euro-Atlantic integration of the Republic of Macedonia, as well of achieving progress on our path and cooperation with the neighbours; We believe that the maintenance of good-neighbourly relations is of vital importance for securing the development of the region and we are fully committed to this strategic priority; we are also dedicated to the continuous development of the mutual cooperation with the neighbours in the interest of the citizens. The integration of the Republic of Macedonia in NATO is the key political commitment, intention and goal shared by all the political parties, social factors and citizens that with their activities bear the responsibility and contribute to the dynamics and quality of the realization of this process; This declaration shall be forwarded to all the relevant international organizations and institutions; Having regard to the crucial importance of the process of Euro-Atlantic integration, we emphasize that it is especially significant that all the political parties should act responsibly and not use this strategic goal for daily political purposes, that they reaffirm the spirit of unity and constructiveness with the aim of achieving the goal of full membership of the Republic of Macedonia in NATO as soon as possible; We point out the importance that the region remain in the focus of the NATO enlargement process, and we seek support from the member countries for sending an invitation to the Republic of Macedonia for NATO membership at the forthcoming Summit in Chicago, as well as for start of the accession negotiations with the European Union; In our research, we are guided by basic research hypothesis that the Macedonian print media do not pay enough attention to the issue of workers' rights and concerns. What print media write for workers rights and problems in Republic of Macedonia in the period 1.03.2014 - 31.08.2014 What print media write for workers rights and problems in Republic of Macedonia in the period 1.03.2014 - 31.08.2014 Abstract In our research we will focus on the iss ue of workers' rights and concerns as a very importrant aspects of the concerns as a very important aspect of the exercise of democracy in the country. The issue of workers' rights in Macedonia was treated continuously in print media, but the problem is particularly evident in the period of transition. Primary research question in this paper will be whether, or how, and how print media in Macedonia devote attention to the issue of workers' rights and concerns. The research will apply the method of content analysis of texts in print media for a period of six months (1.03.2014 to 31.08.2014. We will analyze the number of texts, the size of text, place (box) of publication, title size, value orientation of text (article), a journalistic genre unions and others. The analysis of the print media covers six daily newspapers Vecer, Vest, Dnevnik, Nova Makedonija, Free print and Utrinski Vesnik. The structure was made – like many of Kuma's buildings – for more or less humble purposes, in this case a museum dedicated to the history of dentistry. Kuma's buildings are often deceptively simple and make use of ancient materials, especially wood. Kuma is tall, informal – he was wearing stonewashed jeans, and a striped T-shirt under a nylon jacket with frayed and shredded shoulders – and he greeted me with a quick handshake, as if I were another employee. Kuma's design for the Fujiya ryokan – his take on the traditional Japanese inn – at Ginzan Onsen, a secluded hot spring town in Yamagata Prefecture, north of Tokyo. The interior of Fujiya ryokan. Kuma's Asakusa Culture Tourist Information Center in Tokyo, which is 128 feet tall and was built in 2012. Rejecting flashy forms in favor of buildings in harmony with their environment, the architect – poised to become world famous for his stadium for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo – is trying to reinvent his entire trade. Speaking to me about the building in October, in the glassed-in penthouse library above his firm's Tokyo offices, Kuma became animated. KENGO KUMA'S FASCINATION with architecture began when he was 10 years old and his father took him to visit Kenzo Tange's famous Yoyogi National Gymnasium, constructed for the 1964 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Many of his notable works are in rural areas and serve an ostensibly minor purpose – say, to exhibit a collection of Hiroshige woodblock prints, or to sell Taiwanese pineapple cakes, or to house a Starbucks in the city of Fukuoka, known equally for its ancient temples and shopping malls. Tange treated natural light like a magician, he said, discussing the way the panels on the ceiling reflected light bouncing off the swimming pool. He is the most famous Japanese architect Americans have never heard of, mostly due to his sparse record of building outside of East Asia; he has only one public commission in the United States, a "cultural village" for the Japanese Garden, Ore., whose most notable structure is a small glass box of a teahouse cantilevered past a single post, making it appear to float above a ravine. And yet Tange's work – aggressively modern, wresting enormous form out of space, deploying the latest synthetic materials, an imposition on the landscape and an attention-grabbing demonstration of what architecture could do in a city that only 20 years earlier had been comprehensively destroyed by American bombs – could not be further from Kuma's own aesthetic. But he grew noticeably excited speaking about Tange's gymnasium. Tange's arena – with its high mast and violently sloping roof, its form like a discus emerging obliquely from the earth – was a masterpiece of engineering, and remains the most breathtaking example of Japanese Modernism. I had only met him a few minutes earlier, in the cramped main quarters, when he swiftly emerged from his tiny, cubicle-like space in the far corner. The exterior of the GC Prostho Museum and Research Center.

Six years on from his baptism of fire, Kane and Chiellini, now captains of their respective countries, will lock horns again in the final of the European Championship. A key battle of the Euro 2020 final will be between the captains, England's Harry Kane and Italy's Giorgio Chiellini. Kane is a player I have always liked a great deal, Chiellini said this week after England's semifinal victory over Denmark. Stavreski has inspected the rehabilitation of the landslide over Kratovo We keep in touch on constant basis and as a Government, we are making efforts that lead to faster realization of the projects. This was stressed by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Zoran Stavreski today following the inspection over the activities for rehabilitating the landslide, being long-standing problem for the citizens of Kratovo, and due to the recent bad weather conditions, the situation got even worse due to which, the Agency for State Roads started its rehabilitation. They are realized with budget funds and the credits the Republic of Macedonia is extended from the World Bank and EBRD, Georgievski said. Mayor of Kratovo Mite Andonovski stressed that intensive activities are being undertaken for several infrastructure facilities at both local and regional level. The Director of the Agency and all those engaged assured me that the dynamics will be observed and that the rehabilitation will be completed by 20th September this year. Today, we will discuss about the phase of the existing projects, being already commenced and about the type of the dynamics of future projects, Stavreski said. Kratovo 26th July 2014 (MIA) – Activities for rehabilitating the landslide over Kratovo go well and according to the dynamics envisaged under the Project. It will provide not only for the stability of the road, but also for its expansion with third land and pavement, Stavreski said. -We are working on several such projects across the country, such as the three landslides on the road Radovis – Konce, the landslides at Botun and Tasina Cesma on the road Ohrid-Kicevo, the child holiday resort of Pelister and in Mavrovo, on the road from the Dam to Mavrovi Anovi. Director of the Agency for State Roads Ljupco Georgievski stressed that the landslide will be rehabilitated with budget funds, adding that it will amount to around Denar 57 million. The state has not managed to establish such a system of institutions and mechanisms that would provide for the human rights and freedom protection and promotion and the state is even greatest violator of these rights. The year 2003 is featured by the completion of the total partization of the state structure, development of ethno-democracy at the expense of civil democracy and further erosion of the law as the basic guarantor of the protection of a person. Last year none of the declared commitments of the newly elected structure of power was fulfilled (improvement of the security situation in the country, improvement of the economic situation and standard of living of the population, global democratization, respect for the law and development of a state governed by the rule of law, development of integrative instead of disintegrative processes in the Republic of Macedonia and such level of human rights protection and respect for human rights and freedoms that would help the country come close to the European trends and enable its accelerated inclusion in the European structures. In some spheres (especially the social, health care and the labor relations rights sphere) there are evident retrograde trends. The analysis and assessments contained in this Report are based on the information available to the Committee, resulting from cases reported to the Committee i.e. registered by the Committee's monitoring network. The human rights and freedoms situation in the Republic of Macedonia in 2003 has not undergone significant changes as compared to the previous period.

In cooperation with the Department of Nuclear Medicine, the Department of Thoracic and Vascular Surgery treats all thyroid gland surgical diseases. The program for educating women in performing breast self-examination in order to prevent breast cancer is designed and developed by "Acibadem Sistina" Hospital, in collaboration with non-governmental organizations. Since this area of the human body is delicate and significant, the surgeons' experience, the collaborative team environment and the use of up-to-date medical equipment are all particularly important in minimizing risks as well as in increasing the overall success rate. Thoracic surgery is a medical field of surgical treatment of diseases affecting the thoracic (chest) organs such as: lungs, diaphragm, esophagus, tumor structures of the chest wall and the mediastinal tumors, as well as all congenital chest wall anomalies. Thoracic Surgery The Department performs over 1,000 surgical interventions annually, leading in the number of successfully performed breast interventions. In addition to surgeons, these consultations include specialists in the field of anesthesiology, pulmonology, radiology, pathology, oncology, radiotherapy and nuclear medicine. MULTIDISCIPLINARY ACCESS The experienced surgical team supported by specialists from the departments of X-ray diagnostics, pathohistology, nuclear medicine, and by colleagues from respected branches of the Internal Medicine Unit, enables all necessary diagnostic procedures. Thyroid Gland Surgery The department provides standardized high technology in the implementation of the diagnostic and therapeutic protocol in treating each patient individually. Considering the generalized nature of atherosclerosis, the treatment of these patients is carried out through a collaborative team approach of colleagues from the departments of cardiology, radiology, anesthesiology, blood transfusion etc. Besides the classical surgical approach these surgical interventions are performed in a minimally invasive video-assisted manner, which is particularly important since the period of rehabilitation is shortened, the post-operative pain is reduced and better aesthetic results are achieved. Vascular surgery is a specialization which treats diseases of the blood vessels i.e. arteries and veins. Today, lung carcinoma is one of the most common malignancies encountered in everyday practice. The department is therefore led by one of the most experienced surgeons in this area in our country. Breast Surgery Vascular interventions are performed free of charge for HIFM insurers. The Breasts Cancer Centre holds consultative meetings of leading experts in the field of X-ray diagnostics, tumor and reconstructive surgery, diagnostic histopathology and oncology, thus thoroughly covering the complete diagnostics, surgical reconstruction and oncological care of all types of breast cancer. The Thoracic and Vascular Surgery Department is headed by Dr. Mitko Karagjozov, the most experienced surgeon in this field in our region. Acibadem Sistina puts a special emphasis on the care and treatment of breast diseases.

Car-Free Day marked symbolically, the motorization rate is growing continuously in Macedonia (infographic) The number of vehicles per citizen has been growing constantly in the past several years. But also, the fact that should be mentioned is the share of passed kilometers with cars, which is constantly on the rise in Macedonia, while the number of passengers using public transportation is continuously dropping. According to data provided by the State Statistical Office, last year in Macedonia there were 205.2 passenger vehicles per 1.000 citizens. According to data provided by the State Statistical Office, last year in Macedonia there were 205.2 passenger vehicles per 1.000 citizens. Still, the official statistical data show that the population's motorization rate is growing exponentially every year, while the number of passengers that are using public transportation (inner-city, intercity bus and railway) is dropping, and the authorities do not make enough effort to convince the citizens to use less their cars. As a comparison, in 2012, there were 146.4 passenger vehicles per 1.000 citizens which is a sign that the number of citizens that own one or more vehicles is constantly rising. The number of vehicles per citizen has been growing constantly in the past several years. MKD Car-Free Day marked symbolically, the motorization rate is growing continuously in Macedonia... Covid-19 Passports Were not Planned 7 Months Before the Wuhan Pandemic Broke Out The fact that the EC planned to introduce such an integrated digital system at the European level does not mean that these vaccine passports were "Covid-19 passports". Simply put, if Covid-19 did not appear, then these vaccine passports would contain information about other vaccines of EU citizens in electronic form. The Recommendation also welcomes the Commission's intention to examine the feasibility of developing a common vaccination card/passport that would be compatible with electronic immunisation information systems and recognised for use across borders. Covid-19 passports that are served to us today, as the only way to open the borders, were actually planned in advance with aim to control the human population – A NECESSARY PANDEMIC! The document reads: The claim made in the post we are reviewing that the Covid-19 passports were planned in advance with the aim to control the human population and that a "necessary pandemic" was created is false and manipulative. Given all of the above, we evaluate the claim that the Covid-19 vaccine passports were planned 2 years before the pandemic and that the Covid-19 pandemic was "invented" as disinformation and manipulation. How could that be the case? Even if there were a European integrated vaccination passport system, it does not mean that it depopulates the Earth or that a pandemic is planned. A vaccine passport in 2018, in the context of documents published by the European Commission, is not the same as a Covid-19 passport in 2021. The vaccine passport planned in 2018 refers to different vaccination schedules of EU member states, i.e. vaccines that existed at that time. And this is the main problem. A Facebook post claims that Covid-19 passports were planned 7 months before the Wuhan pandemic broke out. It does not say that these are Covid-19 vaccines, but all vaccines in general. They did not even bother to remove the documents, because they know that the majority of people are in front of the TVs and few are investigating. There is no evidence that the development of a European Vaccine Information Sharing System at the EU level is a "pandemic plan or depopulation plan". Covid-19 is neither mentioned nor can be mentioned in this document, because the virus and the pandemic did not exist in 2018. However, the truth is quite different. This is summary information from a meeting of the eHealth Network, held on 13 November 2018. The document that is linked and quoted in the text does not mention vaccination with a passport, which is a Covid-19 passport. They know that there are idiots, who blindly believe them, and this text with documents and evidence will be declared FAKE NEWS and they will say: No, the EC DOCUMENT is not proof that the pandemic is planned, – reads the post and a link from an article published on a portal is provided. So, in the passport that was planned in 2018, a Covid-19 vaccine was not planned to be administered, because then there was no coronavirus and Covid-19 pandemic worldwide. (COVID-19 PASSPORTS PLANNED 7 MONTHS BEFORE THE WUHAN PANDEMIC BROKE OUT). Simply put, two years before the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic, the European Commission planned to integrate vaccination information for EU citizens into an electronic system that could be used for travelling. Given all of the above, we evaluate the claim that the Covid-19 vaccine passports were planned 2 years before the pandemic and that the Covid-19 pandemic was "invented" as disinformation and manipulation. The two things are separate and unrelated. What was planned in 2018 by the European Commission is, in fact, a vaccine passport that is not related to Covid-19 at all, but to any vaccine, in order to electronically connect the systems with health data for the citizens more easily, in order to integrate and facilitate the flow of passengers at EU level. The document is published on the website of the European Commission and it says that the recommendation envisages the development of a European Vaccine Information Sharing System (EVIS). Even if there were a European integrated vaccination passport system, it does not mean that it depopulates the Earth or that a pandemic is planned. Another disinformation is the fact that the vaccine passports that were the idea in 2018, mean that the pandemic is planned.

The session was attended by the mayors of the East Planning Region, the Minister of Local Self-Government Mr. Goran Milevski, the Director of the Bureau for Regional Development Mr. Ramiz Redzepi, the Deputy Minister of Local Self-Government Mr. Zoran Dimitrovski and the State Secretary at the Ministry of Local Self-Government Mr. Kiril Partalov. The new Law on Balanced Regional Development and the changes in relation to the old Law were discussed at the session, as well as the opportunities that the municipalities and the Centers for Development of the planning regions will have for realization of projects through different Programs provided by the new legislation. On March 31, 2021, the twenty-first session of the Council for Development of the East Planning Region was held on the virtual platform ZOOM. The session was attended by the mayors of the East Planning Region, the Minister of Local Self-Government Mr. Goran Milevski, the Director of the Bureau for Regional Development Mr. Ramiz Redzepi, the Deputy Minister of Local Self-Government Mr. Zoran Dimitrovski and the State Secretary at the Ministry of Local Self-Government Mr. Kiril Partalov. The new Law on Balanced Regional Development and the changes in relation to the old Law were discussed at the session, as well as the opportunities that the municipalities and the Centers for Development of the planning regions will have for realization of projects through different Programs provided by the new legislation. The session was attended by the mayors of the East Planning Region, the Minister of Local Self-Government Mr. Goran Milevski, the Director of the Bureau for Regional Development Mr. Ramiz Redzepi, the Deputy Minister of Local Self-Government Mr. Zoran Dimitrovski and the State Secretary at the Ministry of Local Self-Government Mr. Kiril Partalov. Professional football player, Aleksandar Pandovski passed away this morning after he succumbed to his injuries he suffered in a car crash several days earlier. Pandovski played for the Under 21s national squad and was a former footballer for Vardar FC, Rabotnicki FC and Turnovo FC. He last played for Euromilk FC. Professional football player, Aleksandar Pandovski passed away this morning after he succumbed to his injuries he suffered in a car crash several days earlier. Pandovski was involved in a terrible car accident when his car swerved from the road at the exit of Skopje and flew into the concrete columns at Makpetrol petrol station.

The final result of the vote will be announced later today but with 75% of the ballots counted, he is holding the lead with 51.6% over his opponent Evangelos Meimarakis who has 48.4%. Another factor that played a role in the choice of Mitsotakis was recent rumours that Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras was in contact with former Prime Minister and "blue" leader Costas Karamanlis, who supported Evangelos Meimarakis in the struggle for leadership. He is the son of former Prime Minister and New Democracy leader Konstantinos Mitsotakis, whom he visited immediately after his victory last night. Furthermore, his position that he could be a more effective opponent to Alexis Tsipras outweighed the opinion that Evangelos Meimarakis could be a better leader of New Democracy. In these extremely complex conditions for both workers and employers, the social dialogue should be the most important link in overcoming the crisis. Meeting between SSM and the Employers' Organization of Macedonia Today in the headquarters of SSM a meeting between the President of the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia, Darko Dimovski and the President of the Employers' Organization, Angel Dimitrov was held. The President of SSM, Dimovski and the President of EOM, Dimitrov agreed that the new Labor Law should be adopted as soon as possible since most of the proposals have already been harmonized.

We detail system performance over 80km and quantify tolerance to chromatic dispersion and nonlinearity over a wide range of fiber types. We demonstrate a 4-Tb/s metro-DCI system with commercial QSFP28 modules (40x100G dual-wavelength 56-Gb/s PAM4).

29 For Jesus had commanded the impure spirit to come out of the man. A Lamp on a Stand 16 “No one lights a lamp and hides it in a clay jar or puts it under a bed. Instead, they put it on a stand, so that those who come in can see the light.(K) 17 For there is nothing hidden that will not be disclosed, and nothing concealed that will not be known or brought out into the open.(L) 18 Therefore consider carefully how you listen. 52 Meanwhile, all the people were wailing and mourning(AP) for her. 44 She came up behind him and touched the edge of his cloak,(AH) and immediately her bleeding stopped. “She is not dead but asleep.”(AQ) 53 They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead. 54 But he took her by the hand and said, “My child, get up!”(AR) 55 Her spirit returned, and at once she stood up. 49 While Jesus was still speaking, someone came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader.(AN) “Your daughter is dead,” he said. 13 Those on the rocky ground are the ones who receive the word with joy when they hear it, but they have no root. When he said this, he called out, “Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.”(E) “‘though seeing, they may not see; though hearing, they may not understand.’[a](G) 11 “This is the meaning of the parable: The seed is the word of God.(H) 12 Those along the path are the ones who hear, and then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved. 45 “Who touched me?” Jesus asked. Jesus Raises a Dead Girl and Heals a Sick Woman(AE) 40 Now when Jesus returned, a crowd welcomed him, for they were all expecting him. 41 Then a man named Jairus, a synagogue leader,(AF) came and fell at Jesus’ feet, pleading with him to come to his house 42 because his only daughter, a girl of about twelve, was dying. The demons begged Jesus to let them go into the pigs, and he gave them permission. A squall came down on the lake, so that the boat was being swamped, and they were in great danger. 33 When the demons came out of the man, they went into the pigs, and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake(AA) and was drowned. 50 Hearing this, Jesus said to Jairus, “Don’t be afraid; just believe, and she will be healed.” 26 They sailed to the region of the Gerasenes,[b] which is across the lake from Galilee. As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path; it was trampled on, and the birds ate it up. 6 Some fell on rocky ground, and when it came up, the plants withered because they had no moisture. 7 Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up with it and choked the plants. 8 Still other seed fell on good soil. These women were helping to support them out of their own means. 4 While a large crowd was gathering and people were coming to Jesus from town after town, he told this parable: 5 “A farmer went out to sow his seed. 43 And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding(AG) for twelve years,[c] but no one could heal her. As Jesus was on his way, the crowds almost crushed him. When they came to Jesus, they found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet,(AB) dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid. 51 When he arrived at the house of Jairus, he did not let anyone go in with him except Peter, John and James,(AO) and the child’s father and mother. 8 After this, Jesus traveled about from one town and village to another, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom of God.(B) The Twelve were with him, 2 and also some women who had been cured of evil spirits and diseases: Mary (called Magdalene)(C) from whom seven demons had come out; 3 Joanna the wife of Chuza, the manager of Herod’s(D) household; Susanna; and many others. Many times it had seized him, and though he was chained hand and foot and kept under guard, he had broken his chains and had been driven by the demon into solitary places. 30 Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” “Legion,” he replied, because many demons had gone into him. So he got into the boat and left. 47 Then the woman, seeing that she could not go unnoticed, came trembling and fell at his feet. In the presence of all the people, she told why she had touched him and how she had been instantly healed. 48 Then he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you.(AL) Go in peace.”(AM) 27 When Jesus stepped ashore, he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town. For a long time this man had not worn clothes or lived in a house, but had lived in the tombs. 28 When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell at his feet, shouting at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me,(X) Jesus, Son of the Most High God?(Y) I beg you, don’t torture me!” 36 Those who had seen it told the people how the demon-possessed(AC) man had been cured. 37 Then all the people of the region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them,(AD) because they were overcome with fear. “Stop wailing,” Jesus said. 24 The disciples went and woke him, saying, “Master, Master,(S) we’re going to drown!” He got up and rebuked(T) the wind and the raging waters; the storm subsided, and all was calm.(U) 25 “Where is your faith?” he asked his disciples. Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they think they have will be taken from them.”(M) 34 When those tending the pigs saw what had happened, they ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, 35 and the people went out to see what had happened.

In 2011 the Millennium Cross ropeway was opened. The cross was built on the highest point of the Vodno mountain on a place known since the time of the Ottoman Empire as "Krstovar", meaning "Place of the cross", as there was a smaller cross situated there. The reconstruction and adaptation of the Multicultural Center in Kocani will be performed by the economic operator Anol Impex DOOEL Skopje, and the value of the construction works is 261.894.60 euros. Contractor Anol Impex DOOEL Skopje was introduced in the works on 13.11.2019, and the reconstruction and adaptation of the Multicultural Center is expected to be completed in 14 months. Construction activities envisage solving the problem of moisture in the building by installing waterproofing, installation of completely new plumbing and drainage installation, installation of fire fighting, lightning protection, internet and telephone installation, installation of new ventilation ducts, complete demolition and interior carpentry and installation of completely new PVC doors and windows, complete roof replacement, installation of thermal facade, paint-varnish skiing, training of the attic space for the Multicultural Center needs, installation of completely new floors, change of lighting of the facility and installation and purchase of new video and safety equipment. On 04.11.2019, a contract was signed to perform works for "Reconstruction with adaptation of Multicultural Center in Kocani". The reconstruction and adaptation of the Multicultural Center in Kocani will be performed by the economic operator Anol Impex DOOEL Skopje, and the value of the construction works is 261.894.60 euros. The project "Our Common Past - Path to a Common Future" has a total budget of 562,353.54 euros, provides for a number of activities and construction works and will be implemented in cooperation with the municipality of Goce Delchev from the Republic of Bulgaria in a period of 24 months. For many years, the Pelagonia region, including also the start of Meckin Kamen in Krusevo, is an exciting flight arena for those who dare to fly with the birds. It is the perfect destination to escape from civilization and merge with natural and spiritual. Such a combination offers an exciting Treskavec. Anchored between the stone confines of Zlatovrv, 1,280 meters above sea level, this place leaves no one indifferent, mostly because of unique natural beauty, but also because of the mystique ancient stories and the peace and tranquility of the namesake monastery complex. Free flight is an exciting experience itself, but when you combine the adrenaline with the beautiful place, which you fly over it, you get an unforgettable experience. From Treskavec you can see the Pelagonija valley, the mountains Babuna, Pelister, Kajmakcalan, and at night the lights of the cities Bitola, Prilep and Krusevo.

Inter-secretariat Task Force on Internet Governance and Information Society Council of Europe Strategy The overall aim of the Council of Europe's Internet Governance Strategy is to ensure that public policy for the internet is people-centred in order to build democracy online, to protect internet users, and to ensure respect and protection for human rights online.

Graduated at the Faculty of Law in Skopje in 1997. She delivers training seminars on advocacy and lobbying, good governance in the civil society organizations, transparent processes in policy and law making. She is a author of numerous analyzes in the field of civil dialogue at national and local level, transparent processes in policy making, public funding of civil society organizations, etc. During the period of 2008 to 2011 she coordinated the activities in two programs: Macedonia without Discrimination, and Good governance in Macedonia. Presently, she is managing the USAID Anti-Corruption Program implemented by MCIC. Born on April 16, 1974 in Žirovnica village. Since September 2010 she is head of the Department for Civil Society and Democratization in MCIC. From 2010 she holds master's degree on International Law - topic "Freedom of Association as human rights in the democracy" from the Law Faculty "Justinian 1" in Skopje. One thing is clear: if you practice the cleanness rituals without a high degree of guilty conscience or if you practice them in order to overcome a guilty conscience, then you belong to the group of socialised people because the culture and its institutions act in a way that they impose a guilty conscience about uncleanness. There is another group of people who have a guilty conscience caused by cleanness. Miljenko Jergovic, the famous author of Sarajevo Marlboro - a portrait of the war in Bosnia (1992-1996), in the women’s magazine Cosmopolitan (May, 2003), in other words, a magazine intended for cultural inauguration of cleanness and tidiness, published an article in which he described order and cleanness as synonyms for stagnation and ethical hell. For the proto-subject, which is referred to as the libidinal child by Kristeva, the reality is the very principle of enjoyment - he will never be able to say the things that a child in a semiotic phase might say: that the only reality is my own enjoyment because there is neither a system of norms and values nor an order which is endangered by my enjoyment. I and I only exist and my enjoyment as part of me, and this will be the case as long as, through the speech and the choice of the desired object in the phase of the Oedipal triangle, I enter the world of language, which is paternal. This crazy proto-subject who enjoys the grand megalomania, to its own misfortune and (maybe) fortunately for the others, will have to replace this megalomania later in its life with a more modest position of a renegade from the Middle Ages, who will never smile again nor be able to say that he feels like God, except in the rare moments of infinite happiness (let us remind ourselves about the definition that life is fifteen minutes of infinite happiness). I, subjectified, as part of the order which marks, uses, gives and produces meaning, remember the illusion of uniqueness. Freud incidentally explains the need for beauty.

VERP-MMR is a module designed for commercial follow-up of the warehouses in terms of quality and quantity. VERP-MMR module is connected to the financial and production module and can be interrelated with the rest of the modules to enable Integrated Information system, obtained in a package with all the modules and user training. This means that with only one document entry, the warehouse is automatically booked in plus or minus and the same document is evidenced in the financial ledger on previously defined accounts. The module is accessible in three basic offerings: VERP-MMR, offers fast and easy diverse pricing options during the entries, their relation with the deposits entries and evidence of the buyer indeptedness during the generation of the documents. It can be used as standalone or networked application and appropriate user access policies. VERP-MMR module can be connected with VBS-MA – mobile app for commercial staff to make online purchase requests, that will be automatically generating documentation upon arrival. This document handling allows fast and accurate warehouse and purchase monitoring, warehouse pricing calculations, entry and exit monitoring, material account evidence, outstanding items report, as well as all other necessary reports. VERP-MMR allows defining numerations and key schemes, entry and selling the products according the schemes for products that need to be recorded by brend, type, size and series. According the document type, be it entry invoice, receipt, handover, exit invoice,... the adjustment for the document type for financial entry is made. VERP-MMR encapsulates evidence and monitoring several segments simultaneously, starting from purchase (domestic or import), warehousing, selling (domestic or export), delivery of the products and services to the end-customer and realisation and evidence of the value and surplus value generated through the trade, as well as the necessary booking entries, that synchronise the ledgers and accounting value with the actual material state.

Administrative Court in Skopje makes a decision in favor of the Euromax company regarding Ilovica mines The ecologists from Strumica that are fighting against the opening the copper and gold mine Ilovica in the Strumica area, yesterday accused the Administrative Court in Skopje that it hides its verdict in favor of the former mine concessioner, the Canadian company Euromax Resources and that this decision has a major corruption background. They call upon the State Committee for Prevention of Corruption to act and to investigate whether there is any corruption behind this scandalous verdict and who is involved in it. The Administrative Court has made this decision on the 31st of March 2020, but so far this decision wasn't published at the court's webpage nor any information was published in the media. With this decision, the Managing Court has annulled the decision of the Second degree government Committee that last October rejected the appeal by Euromax for the rejection of its request for exploitation. Its time for rebellion published on their Facebook page the activists of the Healthy Valley organization as a comment on the situation with the Administrative Court's verdict in the benefit of the concessioner against which the local population fought against with protests and blockades during last year. The ecologists from Strumica that are fighting against the opening the copper and gold mine Ilovica in the Strumica area, yesterday accused the Administrative Court in Skopje that it hides its verdict in favor of the former mine concessioner, the Canadian company Euromax Resources and that this decision has a major corruption background. According to Euromex, the building of the mines is a "win-win" project of a mutual interest and will bring benefit both for the investors and the national economy in North Macedonia". The DOM political party think that the Government's decision to annul the concession agreement for the Ilovica mine was legally clean decision and are openly expressing their suspicions that the reason for the hidden verdict in favor of the Canadian company is corruption. With this decision, the Managing Court has annulled the decision of the Second degree government Committee that last October rejected the appeal by Euromax for the rejection of its request for exploitation. They call upon the State Committee for Prevention of Corruption to act and to investigate whether there is any corruption behind this scandalous verdict and who is involved in it. The Administrative Court has made this decision on the 31st of March 2020, but so far this decision wasn't published at the court's webpage nor any information was published in the media. Meta.mk contacted the Ministry of Economy for a statement regarding this decision, but until the article was published, no reply was received from the ministry. The DOM political party think that the Government's decision to annul the concession agreement for the Ilovica mine was legally clean decision and are openly expressing their suspicions that the reason for the hidden verdict in favor of the Canadian company is corruption. When yesterday Euromax publicly revealed the court's decision on its webpage, the general public reacted and under pressure, the Court's President Burim Sejdini issued a press release today that stated that the court has adopted this decision and that it is publicly available. Due to suspicion that the products infringe intellectual property rights, they were seized and a procedure for determining their authenticity will be initiated in accordance to the regulations. Hunting ammunition - 475 pieces of hunting ammunition with 12/70 caliber, found during control of a Bulgarian registered car, driven by a Macedonian national, declared for entrance at the border crossing point Bogorodica. The undeclared ammunition, found in several bags, placed in front of and on the back seat of the vehicle, was seized, and an appropriate procedure will be initiated against the driver. Medical equipment and spare parts - 1 device for stopping bleeding and 15 parts for the same (pedal, electrode cable, electrodes, sterile earthing cord, medical bipolar cable and electric tweezers), detected during control of a Macedonian registered car, driven by a Macedonian national, declared for entrance in the country, at the border crossing point Jazince. Goods suspected of infringing intellectual property rights - 34 women's bags bearing logo of protected trademarks, found during inspection of a German truck transporting vehicles, driven by a Serbian national, declared for entrance in the country at the border crossing point Bogorodica. Food products - 42 kg of fresh meat and 42 kg of confectionery, found during inspection of a Macedonian registered car, driven by a Macedonian national, declared for entrance at the border crossing point Blace. The truck was loaded with broken vehicles, and the products in question were found in one of the vehicles loaded on the truck. Last week, the customs officers foiled several attempts for smuggling various goods, seizing foreign currencies, hunting ammunition, medical equipment, food products and counterfeits. Cash - 3,900 Euros, found during control of a Macedonian registered car and personal search of the driver, a Macedonian national and his co- driver - a citizen of Kosovo, who arrived for exit from the country at the border crossing point Tabanovce Motorway. 7,000 Euros for which he had a document of origin, were returned to the driver, while 3,900 Euros were impounded and a misdemeanor procedure was initiated for the committed foreign currency offense. SEIZED FOREIGN CURRENCIES, HUNTING AMMUNITION, MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, FOOD PRODUCTS AND COUNTERFEITS The undeclared goods, found in the boot and behind the front seats of the vehicle, were seized, and a misdemeanor procedure was initiated against the driver. During the inspection of the vehicle, the customs officers found 900 Euros under the driver's passport between the front seats. The market value of the products is estimated at around 400 thousand Denars, if sold as original ones. The co-driver reported to Customs that he was carrying 4,000 Euros, while the driver declared that he had 7,000 Euros on him, for which he submitted a document from authorized exchange office.

As at the date of loan application submission, the loan applicants and the guarantors should not have any outstanding liabilities under other loans approved by the Bank. At maturity of the last annuity the Borrower should not be older than 70 years, except for the loans that are fully covered by a deposit deposited in the Bank and for loans for pensioners. Loans are disbursed in denars. The Bank charges its clients for processing of the loan application, for approval and administration of the loan and for the grace period interest for the period from the date of disbursement to the date of commencement of repayment with the interest rate set for the approved loan. Komercijalna Banka AD Skopje approves loans with identified and non-identified purposes to citizens – residents of the Republic of Macedonia. Depending on the purpose of the loan, funds are paid on the transaction account of the applicant, or, on the transaction account of the seller. Loans are repaid in equal monthly installments becoming due each 16th day of the month. For the loans secured by mortgage on real estate and movables, an Insurance Policy for the property assigned in favor of the Bank has to be provided for the whole loan repayment period.

The Art of Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith Among the hundreds of pieces are images and anecdotes covering Darth Vader then and now—the new look of the ultimate Star Wars icon; conceptual looks at the climactic lightsaber duel between Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi; the evolution of General Grievous from initial sketches to ILM animation art; images of costumes, weapons, landscapes, and spacecraft; exclusive interviews with the artists; and excerpts from Episode III's Visual Script, created to help guide production through the film's digital creations. It unveils never-before-seen images—storyboards, models, production sketches, and ILM-generated art—that chronicle the journey from first draft to theater screen. The Art of Star Wars Episode III: Revenge of the Sith is a collection of various concept art and other works produced during the making of Revenge of the Sith.

The celebration of the 30th anniversary is a three-decade perspective (1991–2021) of the existence and work of the Open Society Foundations (FOS) in the Balkans. The event first screened the short documentary "30 YEARS DEDICATED" which referred to the past work of the Foundation Open Society – Macedonia. The stories took us on an emotional journey through all the challenges, crises, solutions and successes, but also personal destinies that formed the Foundation as a driver of change for the better. You can watch the short documentary here: After the documentary, we followed the debate "Post-COVID-19 reality: What is the path to a more just society?", which gave us a glimpse into the future. During the three decades of turmoil and crises that the country is going through, FOSM provides constant support for North Macedonia and its citizens and thus contributes to the development of the whole society. On 18 May 2021, an event was held to mark the 30th anniversary of the existence and work of the Open Society Foundations (FOS) in the Balkans, which specifically addressed the presence and activities of FOS in North Macedonia, and is part of the events within on the occasion of the 30th anniversary. The Foundation promotes the rule of law and good governance, the fight against corruption, the development of civil society, freedom of expression and the media, human rights, youth engagement, Roma integration, health rights and education of the marginalized, and thus contributes to creating a fairer society for all. The documentary contains many intertwined stories told by people who witnessed and participated in key events in the country since the founding of the Foundation Open Society – Macedonia, until today. 30 years dedication to the Open Society in North Macedonia From 22 April to 17 June 2021, the celebration of the 30th anniversary travels virtually through the Balkans – from one capital to another as part of this unique tour de table virtual momentum tour, and on 18 May it arrived in Skopje, North Macedonia and visited the Foundation Open Society Macedonia. The celebration of the 30th anniversary is a three-decade perspective (1991–2021) of the existence and work of the Open Society Foundations (FOS) in the Balkans. The Open Society Foundation – Macedonia (FOSM) was founded in 1992, one year after the declaration of independence of the country, and has since been committed to promoting the values of an open society. During the three decades of turmoil and crises that the country is going through, FOSM provides constant support for North Macedonia and its citizens and thus contributes to the development of the whole society. Proven young people shared their views on the future of North Macedonia and offered different perspectives on possible sustainable strategies for qualitative transformation towards a better and more just society. Zuma, who was in office from 2009-2018, has been accused of taking bribes from French defense company Thales in connection with a 1999 multi-billion dollar arms purchase, which he oversaw as vice president. The 77-year-old's trial is scheduled to begin on October 15. The former South African president has been denied a stay of prosecution to prevent him from being charged in a graft case. He faces 16 charges of fraud, racketeering and money laundering. Zuma, who slipped out of the court quietly after the decision, can appeal the ruling or ask for a postponement. Zuma was forced to resign in 2018 in connection with separate corruption accusations involving the influential and controversial Gupta family, who have also been subject to US sanctions. It has the most advanced equipment for reanimation and intensive treatment, providing treatment and care for all critically ill patients, in early postoperative period and for those with chronic diseases as well. The following interventions/procedures are performed at the Department: It starts by meeting with the patient, in order to decide the most appropriate surgical procedure; it continues with superior surgical care and is completed with planning and implementation of appropriate rehabilitation programme. Its success in the past is a result of continuous investment in education and improvement of the team. ABOUT US • Coronary bypass (CABG, MIDCAB, OPCAB) and thrombendarterectomy of the carotid arteries • Aortic valve reimplantation or remodeling (David I, II) • Mitral valve replacement or repair, with open heart operation or minimally invasive approach • Tricuspid valve repair or replacement • Treatment of aortic dissection and aneurysm The Department of Cardiac Surgery at "Acibadem Sistina" performs a full range of cardiac interventions, from routine operations to the most complex open heart procedures. Every patient is provided, at any time, with advice or an opinion on their condition or on a specific problem. The routine protocol system of work requires continuous information and upgrading of the staff through daily morning meetings, presentations and forums with doctors in other specialties at the clinic and special meetings with the cardiology team. Such consortiums of experts are open to external cardiologists and other specialists in order to promote the team approach to work. We believe the treatment outcome is better and the rehabilitation faster when patients understand their disease and treatment options. The Department consists of intensive care unit, a hospital ward and outpatient clinics. Our goal is to educate patients. Interventions/surgical procedures The Department employs a specially trained professional team of surgeons, anesthesiologists, cardiovascular perfusionists, nurses, physiotherapists and paramedics. Cardiosurgery The Department of Cardiac Surgery is built according to the latest world standards. It offers a professional approach in treating patients and supreme healtcare in order to meet the specific needs to all categories of patients. It is composed of leading international team of cardiac surgeons with extensive experience led by Prof. Dr. Aleksandar Nikolikj. Intensive care The team of leading experts in the field of intensive treatment provides healthcare according to world standards and protocols in order to improve the general condition, which results in a shorter hospital stay. Cardiac Surgery Intensive Care Unit, led by cardiac surgeons and anesthesiologists, has 14 beds available. The international team of cardiac surgeons includes Prof. Dr. Aleksandar Nikolikj, Dr. Vladimir Emanuilovikj Belostotski and Dr. Eljlvis Mustafa, leading professionals who have performed cardiosurgical interventions at world reference centers. The performance and statistics successes are a result of the unified approach, teamwork, dedication and most sophisticated equipment in the region.
