More than 150 doctors from Macedonia and other countries were present at the symposium and were actively involved asking questions, expressing their points of view and opinions. Special guest lecturer was Prof. Dr. Ahmet Alanaj, a specialist in orthopedics and traumatology from Acibadem Health Group, who presented the latest achievements in pediatric spinal surgery. The top specialists in the Spinal Center at Acibadem Sistina were lecturers at the symposium. Special emphasis was placed on the diagnosis, as well as on the different approaches in treatment of certain spine and spinal cord disorders. Acibadem Sistina Hospital held a symposium on "Advanced approach in the treatment of spinal pathology" The symposium is accredited by the Medical Chamber of the Republic of Macedonia. The multidisciplinary approach was presented by numerous presentations that covered the entire spinal pathology. Acibadem Sistina Hospital held a symposium on "Advanced approach in the treatment of spinal pathology".

Indeed, it is a lot easier for you to cheat when you know you can always return to the fold. Nonetheless, a problem arises when you do not feel sufficiently caressed and protected by the one to whom you have entrusted her heart. Capricorn If you are a woman, brimming with feelings that you are unable to express, you will not imagine, not even in dreams, of cheating on your partner even in spite of numerous opportunities. Even if marriage is an institution supposedly invented by a Libran, Librans are masters in the art of flirtation because of their desperate need for compliments. For this reason, no extramarital relationship can make you happy. In such cases, you don’t even realize you are leaving yourself open to infidelity. But when things do not happen that way, then you will seek confirmation elsewhere. If you are a woman, beautiful, sensuous, attached to house and family, ready to leave your ambitions behind in the name of the family’s happiness, you should be a model of fidelity. Gemini Many say that the word “Infidelity” with a capital “i” should hang close to the Gemini sign. Thus in your parallel liaisons there is more flirtatiousness and shuffling of forces than a true love flame. This is why it is dangerous for you husband to lose interest in you, to become the type who hits the armchair, newspaper in hand, not responding to your new hairdo or perfume. However, at the last minute, in order to avoid rocking the boat, you change tactics and make a fast retreat. But when you sink, you sink all the way to the bottom. But as you get older and accumulate riches and power, you turn into a real seducer proud of each and every one of your conquests. If you are a woman, when you marry you truly wish to be faithful. Only a real convergence of circumstances will allow this desire to translate itself into reality. If you are a man, you are seemingly cold and indifferent. However, if you have already gotten over your fear that your partner might curtail your freedom and if you are already married, then you will remain faithful until the end of your days. At such moments you will feel like allowing yourself to indulge in an affair with the man who promises you will take first place in his life. You consider secret love meetings that could complicate your life as something unworthy of you. If you are a man, you often imagine how things might be if you were to check things out someplace else, but you will never allow an adventure to disturb your life. If you are a man, you are unfaithful by definition. If you are a woman, compliments are your weakness. If you are a woman, you will certainly give the best of yourself in order to make your marriage a happy one. Indeed, you simply love to melt women’s hearts, imagining that in this way you prove your power over others. But from the moment when you feel that your husband does not treat you the way he should, you will seek praise elsewhere. But since you need to be caressed, pampered and often do not control yourself very well, you fail to resist temptation. If you are a man, you are undoubtedly proud when it is said of you that you that you are the biggest seducer in your midst. This is not to say that you will always go all the way. That helps you to recover your partner’s trust. Cancer On the other hand, the need to be unfaithful in order to prove your power to other women is a definitely infantile reason. You have the capacity of imagining such lies that you wind up believing them yourself after just a few phrases. And further: you attempt to keep under control even those partners with whom you no longer have anything in common. Pisces Fortunately, nature has given you a way with words. If you are included in the first one, you are certainly equipped with great self-control. The latter do not have to be either beautiful or sharp and whether they love you or not is of no importance since in any case you will move in to catch your prize. In reality, you only want to taste a bit of the forbidden fruit and, should it please you, then you will gnaw into it right down to the very end. How, when and with whom are irrelevant. You may cheat for the sake of revenge or remain faithful until the end of your days as long as you find an intelligent and secretive partner who will know how to keep you interested. If your partner does not grant you total freedom in your relationship, you will use the first opportunity to cheat that happens your way. If you are a woman, you surely know that you trigger the erotic imagination of persons of the opposite sex. But when you are being unfaithful, you go about it without any style, satisfied with consuming your latest love prize at one time. If you are a woman, your calm nature and friendly disposition ensure you a good number of admirers. Signs and Fidelity You are the happiest of men when you do not have to struggle too much and when the one you have set your eyes on comes to cuddle into your arms all by herself. If you are a woman, you certainly know already that you are valued by men for the tolerance you show and for your capacity to sacrifice yourself for your spouse and your relationship. However, should you plunge but once into the waves of infidelity, you soon become an expert in the art of justifying all sorts of dubious situations. If you are a man, you certainly take many liberties and have more chances for adventure. It is not surprising to find you with one woman in the morning, another one later on in the day and a third one in the evening. If you are a man, you behave like a collector, independently of what may be involved, whether houses, money, art objects, blonds or brunettes. This is why you may well join in marriage without love entering into the picture. Most likely, he will be a person able to improve your material situation or help you get ahead in your career. If you are a man, you do not choose your victims. And if things turn the wrong way, you will first leave he family nest and then go looking for another partner. However, if you are more courageous than the rest, you will decide to throw the dice and choose to go for either everything or nothing. And only fear of finding your comfort compromised and your fortune diminished will force you to remain faithful. You tend to cheat on your companion smoothly and without spending too many words. If you are a woman, endowed with a strong temperament and self-confidence, you will do your best to conquer the kind of guy that drives all the other women insane, only for the fun of it and to prove to yourself how irresistible you are, even if you are married. Nevertheless, if you are satisfied with your sex life, you are the incarnation of fidelity itself. Only quality liaisons interest you. And if you should happen to cheat, you then will remain faithful to your partner. Nonetheless, if you are a woman, you are not unfaithful from birth; instead, your active intelligence and wide knowledge prompt you to become so. If you are a man, you hardly ever allow yourself to cheat. Daughters to Venus and sons to Mars, women and men behave in different ways when it comes to fidelity. However, you always go for what is least risky, intent on keeping up the appearances of being a stable woman, a good wife, a good housekeeper, and a good mother. This is why, if you should make up your mind to be unfaithful, you will do so with the goal of punishing your partner for his deficiencies or, otherwise, for interests of a material nature. It is interesting to notice that you have the capacity to love several men simultaneously without your marriage thereby losing in weight or quality. Seemingly, everyone is fulfilled. You think for a long time before marrying, afraid of making a mistake. Nonetheless, only rarely will you go by unnoticed and in some cases the whole neighborhood will be aware of your infidelities.

For 12 years we also responded, but the authorities comfort us "Don't worry. Petition threats and verbal abuse were common, but we managed to pull through. I am not worried about my livelihood. With unrestrained enthusiasm, then as an outreach worker, armed with a backpack filled with "injection equipment" and educational booklets, I used to drop by and visit the "girls and guys" (I never liked calling them clients), from door to door, talking to them, explaining the program benefits and services. They welcomed us, understanding our inexperience. We were just beginning after all! Ten thousands of people are insignificant. I can earn the same salary in any of the textile companies or in construction, even receive social and health insurance as a bonus this time, something I sacrificed for the last 12 years, apart from my time of course. On the one hand, it was us, the "novices" fresh young activists with new vision about discrimination, stigma and injustice drug users suffered on a daily basis, and on the other, the already experienced colleagues from HOPS – Health Options Project Skopje. Twice a month, we would patrol around schools to collect needles and syringes left by users, a regular sight at the time but a rarity nowadays. We all learned from HOPS. The development of these programs would have been impossible without their unwavering support. The Program later developed into the civil society organization HOPS – Healthy Options Project Skopje, with its founding members later becoming our mentors. What can we say? In October, 2005, we started building the capacities of our organizations. From 2004 to 2007, with the Global Fund's support, five other new programs were opened within the organizations Pulse from Kumanovo, the Youth Club in Shtip, Zona in Kavadarci, Option in Ohrid and Help in Gostivar. Obviously, it made a difference. They welcomed the program as their own. We were deceived. The situation with Romania, Serbia and Bulgaria will reprise. There, after all harm reduction programs were closed, the rate of new HIV infections jumped to the ceiling. THAT is our job, to reduce the harm of every individual, save their health and that of the surrounding. Denis Ampev The author is the Harm Reduction Program Coordinator and human rights and workers' rights activist. Every day we meet new young people surprised to see that a person who has erred in this country can find understanding without being judged, or receive a medical service without having to repeat their medical history to every doctor they meet. How many lives have we saved? It's the same story everywhere, we have come to the same conclusion with the colleagues from other organizations, "We have the support, but not the finances." I was overjoyed with happiness! Let's tell politicians we are fed up! I remember well, we started from scratch. I am personally not worried about myself. The fact that the experience of 100 employees and even more volunteers will go to waste and they will be forced to start anew is also insignificant. How many people have we helped? However, when on July 1, 2017, thousands of users of harm reduction programs implemented by HELP from Gostivar, Pulse from Kumanovo, Via Vita from Bitola, Option from Ohrid, Zona from Kavadarci, Izbor from Strumica, the Red Cross from Veles, Prilep and Kicevo, HOPS from Skopje and the Centre for Development and Promotion of Public Life Tetovo will come to find closed doors, after a decade of working and changing views, awareness, and opinions, they will realize that we abandoned them, and no excuse will suffice. We distributed thousands syringes and twice that many needles, hundred thousand condoms and many more educational leaflets and brochures, constantly working with them, reassuring them of their right to a second chance. All the hard effort to get to the point we have reached today would go to waste. In Shtip, I personally brought in a desk, chairs, pencil cups, staplers and other office supplies from my home for the new Harm Reduction Program in Shtip. We did our best in Shtip. We have to protect Macedonia from a disease developed countries already responded to. We never boasted or advertised, we simply did what we thought was right. Only several months later, whenever I returned to the offices from the field, "the gang" would chill with a cup of coffee, discussing different topics in the common room. At the moment, they are anxious about the prospective closure more than us. In the distant 1996, a group of people opened the first Harm Reduction Program in Macedonia called M.A.S.K.A. At the time of writing this article, there were 15 harm reduction centres in 13 towns in Macedonia, with additional services provided in some. The sooner the authorities realize that, the greater the odds to save ourselves from a Titanesque tragedy. Let us not be the iceberg that sank the whole ship! Our struggle will not suffice, in this I am certain. We participated in different platforms, conferences and festivals throughout the country, I apologize if I forget to mention some. Many of those events no longer exist but they boosted cooperation among organizations, introduced the citizens with the programs, gave visibility and helped us create quality services for our "girls and guys". We kept in touch with other organizations dealing with the same process, exchanging experiences and ideas. I know that thousands of users will come knocking on the institutions' doors, asking for what they are entitled to! But it's more than the material aspect. We were approaching Macedonia Square with heavy hearts, silently wondering whether it was possible to fall down in obscurity and be forgotten after 12 years in the forefront of the epidemic struggle. Now that they are aware of their rights and health, they will seek not only services but rather look for the culprit. In fact, the march was the last commemoration of the World AIDS Day before the Global Fund ended the financial support of our organizations and thousands of users within the harm reduction programs lost access to the HIV prevention services. How many lives changed to the better? Until 2011, Izbor from Strumica opened similar programs in Gevgelija, and the Centre for Development and Promotion of Public Life Tetovo in Tetovo, also with the support of the Global Fund. We were never offered the opportunity Croatia had, where 90% of the services are financed by the state. We designed programs with several services under one roof, where people who use drugs can find support without being judged or moralized, in anonymity and confidentiality. The greatest recognition, however, arrived from the "girls and guys" who still frequent our offices and use the services we offer. We managed to leave a permanent mark by closing the door shut to discrimination and stigmatization against similar organizations. Around the same time, the Macedonian Red Cross opened harm reduction programs in Veles, Prilep and Kicevo. From 2000 to 2002, couple of other harm reduction programs were developed in Izbor in Strumica and Via Vita in Bitola. They know they can receive a service and advice from a social worker without feeling like being questioned by the Gestapo (I use the word Gestapo because institutions in Macedonia have become interrogation centres with inexperienced doctors and social workers seeking new employment every two weeks). Was it really possible that the country would simply dismiss its own citizens after 12 years? Organizations in other towns went through the same ordeal, which only encouraged us in convincing the population how pointless and misdirected the stigma and fear were. We worked so hard to build this and now it might disappear forever. Together we set up the harm reduction teams for drug use and HIV prevention. It has been several months since the last protest march held by the HIV Platform on December 1, 2016 in Skopje, the last call for action and leadership to stop the closure of all HIV prevention programs in the country, including organizations implementing harm reduction programs. It wasn't us? More than a decade ago we participated in the first harm reduction training in order to stand at the forefront of human rights activism for people who use drugs in Macedonia. We worked hard in order to succeed. The recognition from the donor motivated us to persevere. Wandering through the institutional labyrinths from door to door, marginalized and discriminated against, with no services available to them, their future is doomed. We truly did! For now, however, politicians decided that the 12 years of experience bear no significance. In Shtip, we initiated voluntary collection of discarded infectious waste that had accumulated for years around schools and nurseries. By ourselves, with our finances and the guys' dedication we collected hundreds of kilos of potential risk to the local community. Together with the "girls and guys" throughout Macedonia we passed that exam. They will, because the time when drug users were silent is long gone. There was fear on the concerned faces of colleagues from other towns that the HIV epidemic we have successfully fought for 12 years will finally arrive at our doorstep. We have to move forward! We must show what we have achieved so far. It's about the young lives, the young citizens who, having made the wrong decision, will one day return to society as re-socialized, re-integrated and healthy. They'll be back on the streets, I know, just like 12 years ago, with no one to appeal to. They adopted their own house rules and respected the joint space. At the time 12 years younger, my colleagues and I managed to create a unique program, never seen before in Shtip. You have our support.", now – the struggle for money continues. It wasn't easy for them (at the beginning, anyone seen in the vicinity of our organization was labelled a "junky" by the passersby), however, bashfully and with reluctance, the "girls and guys" flocked to our offices to seek the services we offered.

The Council of Media Ethics of Macedonia (CMEM), the Association of Journalists of Macedonia (AJM), the Independent Union of Journalists and Media Workers (SSNM) and the Macedonian Institute for Media (MIM), on the occasion of celebration of the World Press Freedom Day, May 3d, would like to recall to the need for serious engagement of all relevant actors in undertaking the major reform steps in the media sector in the country. World Press Freedom Day 2019- Statement by MIM, AJM, CMEM and SSNM We would like to remind to the need of taking urgent measures regarding labor rights of the journalists and media workers, taking into consideration that half of them are without employment contracts, especially in the online media sphere. We will continue the intensive cooperation with our respected international partners, European Federation of Journalists (EFJ) and International Federation of Journalists (IFJ). At the same time, we appeal to the Government and the institutions of the system, when bringing decisions considering improvement of the situation in journalism and media content to coordinate it with the professional media and journalistic community in the country. World Press Freedom Day 2019- Statement by MIM, AJM, CMEM and SSNM - respect and tolerance and We appeal to the Public Prosecution Office and the courts processes and finalize the cases in which the rights of journalists were violated, as well as the cases that include hate speech, in order to overcome the long time existing impunity practice and to prevent injustice towards media community. In the past period some efforts were made, resulting with improvement of the working environment for the journalists and media workers, which in turn, improved the country's image in the international media freedom reports. In addition, commercial media continue to face strong challenges due to the small and limited media and advertising market, which in turn affects the quality of the media content. We stand together in support of the campaign of the International Federation of Journalists (IFJ) - "The role of media in elections and democracy", whose purpose is to enable media access to free and diverse information, independent from the influence of the centers of political and economic power. The Council of Media Ethics of Macedonia (CMEM), the Association of Journalists of Macedonia (AJM), the Independent Union of Journalists and Media Workers (SSNM) and the Macedonian Institute for Media (MIM), on the occasion of celebration of the World Press Freedom Day, May 3d, would like to recall to the need for serious engagement of all relevant actors in undertaking the major reform steps in the media sector in the country. At the same time, we appeal to the Government and the institutions of the system, when bringing decisions considering improvement of the situation in journalism and media content to coordinate it with the professional media and journalistic community in the country. We would like to remind to the need of taking urgent measures regarding labor rights of the journalists and media workers, taking into consideration that half of them are without employment contracts, especially in the online media sphere. On the contrary, the lack of independence has made the media into collaborators in the creation of a divided and politicised society devoid of fair and balanced media reporting. The chief underlying reason is the appointment of editors, a process which is completely controlled by the ruling coalition. The full report, together with conclusions and recommendation, is attached below: The political and media crisis in the country deepened further in 2015 with the publication of intercepted conversations that showed senior government and ruling party officials suggesting breaches of fundamental rights, interference with judicial independence, media freedom and elections, and politicisation and corruption in various fields. The editors' role in media integrity protection in Macedonia The majority of the editors and the media in Macedonia operate in an environment influenced by the political centres of power and often even under threats. This is only part of the content of the research on state-media financial relations in Macedonia, conducted by the Macedonian institute for media, within the project "SEE Media Observatory". The selective reporting and the absence of editorial independence at the public service broadcaster Macedonian Radio and Television (MRT) are particularly worrisome. The political pressure backed by the media owners mainly results in a biased, partisan and non-comprehensive journalism. In the creation of this environment, the editors and the media owners have failed to distance themselves from party politics.

Today, 7 October 2015, in CHRDRI was launched a two-day international expert level preparatory meeting for the international conference on: “Facing the demographic challenges experienced by the SEECP participants, within the Programme of the Bulgarian Chairmanship-in-Office of the South-East European Cooperation Process July 2015 – June 2016 It was organized by MLSP in the program of the Bulgarian presidency of SEECP for the period 2015-2016. The software update and the upgrade of the website digital product were carried out with funding from the Operational Programme “Human Resources Development” under the project “Integrated trainings for the administration of the labour market and the administration in the social field“ In the work program of the Forum special attention is paid to international expertise in the management of demographic change in Southeastern Europe in the development of quality human capital as a key to sustainable economic growth. International Expert Meeting will Discuss Demographic Challenges in Southeastern Europe The forum was welcomed by the deputy Minister of Labour and Social Policy of the Republic of Bulgaria Mr. Gulab Donev and the director of CHRDRI Mr. Rosen Tumbev.

Annual Trial Monitoring Meeting is an event that is organized each year, and besides the participation of OSCE's missions from different countries, it is attended by international organizations and national organizations working in the field of monitoring of court cases and improving the level of court protection of human rights in their societies. Previously, in the course of December 2014 and January 2015 in total five working meetings were organized, which resulted in development of base-line questionnaires for collection of data from the courts and public prosecutor offices, as well as separate questionnaires for monitoring of court hearings. Based on the previous experience on the organization on this field, as well as the importance of USAID's Women's Legal Protection Project, representative of ESE moderated the thematic session for monitoring of court cases related to gender-based violence and discrimination. The court monitoring will be conducted by monitors from the Coalition All for Fair Trial. Millions of citizens around the world, particularly youth, are demanding more open and accountable governance. As part of the USAID Legal Protection Project, on 27th of January Association ESE is organizing the last sixth working meeting for development of questionnaires for collection of data from court cases related to violence and discrimination against women. The questionnaires for court monitoring will be used for monitoring on-going court cases related to violence and discrimination against women. We should promote open societies, a free media and freedom of expression, association and peaceful assembly, legal empowerment and the rule of law. Data collection regarding the work of judges in these cases shall be used for the preparation of an analysis with recommendations to improve the protection provided by the judiciary and other relevant institutions in this area. The main goal of the three-year project is to raise the level of legal protection of women who are victims of discrimination and violence in the country. The objective of the event is to promote the concept of judicial monitoring and exchange experiences between different missions and organizations that are applying this concept in their work. The reasons are overwhelming. We, the under-signed, believe transparent, accountable and inclusive institutions are vital if we are to end poverty and protect the planet. We are convinced that a specific goal addressing this urgent call is an essential component of the Post-2015 Development Framework. We should also join forces to implement anti-corruption measures that enable effective and inclusive economic, social and political institutions at all levels of society. The process of preparation of the respective questionnaires included representatives from vulnerable groups, civil, criminal and misdemeanour judges, prosecutors, defence lawyers, representatives of relevant international organizations, as well as representatives of partner organizations in the project, LA STRADA and Coalition of sexual and health rights of marginalized communities. In the period 26 - 28 November 2014 in Tbilisi, Georgia, the Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights (ODIHR) of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) has organized the Annual Trial Monitoring Meeting. Stojan Mishev, the assistant on USAID's Women's Legal Protection Project attended the event On behalf of ESE.

For participation in the training for personal assistants for disabled people, the candidates who have experience in working with people with disabilities and those who have completed education in the health, humanities and social science had priority in the selection. The training for personal assistants lasted for two months and was carried out by trainers from the Red Cross in 7 cities in Skopje, Kumanovo, Bitola, Gostivar, Struga, Strumica and Negotino. For participation in the training for personal assistants for disabled people, the candidates who have experience in working with people with disabilities and those who have completed education in the health, humanities and social science had priority in the selection. In the presence of the Director of the Employment Service Agency of RM Biljana Jovanovska, the Minister of Labor and Social Policy Mila Carovska and representatives of Red Cross, in the premises of the Government of the Republic of Macedonia, 92 certificates for personal assistants for disabled people were awarded today. We congratulate the people who have successfully completed the training for personal assistants for disabled people and we believe that with this training, besides increasing the integration of the unemployed people on the labor market, we will provide a much better quality of life for people with disabilities – said the director of ESARM, Biljana Jovanovska during the awarding of certificates for personal assistants for disabled people. We congratulate the people who have successfully completed the training for personal assistants for disabled people and we believe that with this training, besides increasing the integration of the unemployed people on the labor market, we will provide a much better quality of life for people with disabilities – said the director of ESARM, Biljana Jovanovska during the awarding of certificates for personal assistants for disabled people. The training for personal assistants for disabled people for the first time this year is conducted in the country and is part of the measure Training for demanded occupations and crafts within the Operational Plan for active programs and measures for employment and services on the labor market for 2018. The public call for expressing interest in participating in this training was announced in March, and the interest for participation of the unemployed was high and 254 unemployed people applied for the announced 100 places. Speaking at the State Department, Biden said: "American leadership must meet this new moment of advancing authoritarianism, including the growing ambitions of China to rival the United States and the determination of Russia to damage and disrupt our democracy." US: Biden outlines immediate foreign policy goals Investing in our diplomacy isn't something we do just because it's the right thing to do for the world, he continued. We do it in order to live in peace, security and prosperity. In his first diplomatic speech since becoming president, Biden signaled a no-nonsense approach to China and Russia, urged Myanmar's military leaders to bring their coup to an end, said the US would no longer support Saudi offensives in Yemen, and halted the withdrawal of US troops in Germany. US President Joe Biden on Thursday heralded a new era as he reassured the watching world that "America is back."

The director of the Public Revenue Office Ms. Anastasia Ilieska today (Tuesday) 01.11.2016, in the premises of PRO Headquarters Skopje, met with the delegation of the Tax Administration of the Republic of Montenegro, led by General Director Mr. Miomir Mugosa, accompanied by deputy directors Mr. Sreten Grebovikj and Mr. Dragan Jankovikj. Also, Ilieska emphasized that the PRO is fully oriented towards the fulfillment of the legal obligations, dedicated to increase the level of fair competition, to contribute for increase in the level of tax collection, to reduce the informal economy and allow normal functioning of the state budget functions and all that is in the interest of all citizens. The director of the Public Revenue Office Ms. Anastasia Ilieska today (Tuesday) 01.11.2016, in the premises of PRO Headquarters Skopje, met with the delegation of the Tax Administration of the Republic of Montenegro, led by General Director Mr. Miomir Mugosa, accompanied by deputy directors Mr. Sreten Grebovikj and Mr. Dragan Jankovikj. In the context of the led conversation, Ilieska emphasized that one of the key factors in achieving efficient work and successful results is the exchange of information and good practices, noting that the problems are our challenge in the work itself, the process of modernization and enabling simple and quick service to taxpayers is a top priority and strategic objective of the Macedonian tax administration. The Director of PRO, Mrs. Ilieska expressed her pleasure and emphasized "The visit of the delegation of the Tax Administration of Montenegro is an excellent opportunity to closely discuss about the attitude and approach to taxpayers, to recognize best practices in the operation and discuss key issues that concern authorities in their daily functioning". The message is clear, jointly, through mutual bilateral cooperation, harmonized with the EU regulations, to develop relationships, build a spirit of professionalism and in the best possible way, the administrations with its functioning to contribute to the economic development of their countries, said Ms. Anastasia Ilieska, Director of the Public Revenue Office. Moreover, Ilieska added, in the period ahead as PRO, we are fully focused to be closer to taxpayers, through educational programs and meetings, directly with the citizens to raise the awareness and mutual cooperation with an aim the tax policy in the country to be on higher level. Also, Ilieska emphasized that the PRO is fully oriented towards the fulfillment of the legal obligations, dedicated to increase the level of fair competition, to contribute for increase in the level of tax collection, to reduce the informal economy and allow normal functioning of the state budget functions and all that is in the interest of all citizens. In the context of the led conversation, Ilieska emphasized that one of the key factors in achieving efficient work and successful results is the exchange of information and good practices, noting that the problems are our challenge in the work itself, the process of modernization and enabling simple and quick service to taxpayers is a top priority and strategic objective of the Macedonian tax administration. Furthermore, it was discussed the possible, future joint projects that might be realized by the two administrations, with the emphasis to get as much closer the work and cooperation of tax officials from both countries and thus create a positive climate and sharing of experiences. The director of the Public Revenue Office Ms. Anastasia Ilieska today (Tuesday) 01.11.2016, in the premises of PRO Headquarters Skopje, met with the delegation of the Tax Administration of the Republic of Montenegro, led by General Director Mr. Miomir Mugosa, accompanied by deputy directors Mr. Sreten Grebovikj and Mr. Dragan Jankovikj. Furthermore, it was discussed the possible, future joint projects that might be realized by the two administrations, with the emphasis to get as much closer the work and cooperation of tax officials from both countries and thus create a positive climate and sharing of experiences. At the discussion, the interlocutors placed a key emphasis on legal frameworks at their disposal, as well as exchange of information on legislation, which includes tax policy, the process of taxation and modernization, i.e. the introduction and implementation of electronic services for taxpayers, with aim to increase the level of efficiency in the collection. Both sides, mutually shared the opinion that today's meeting is a good start and an example for further successful cooperation, primarily a good opportunity to discuss constructively directly for the everyday challenges faced by the administrations of the two countries, and particularly from both sides, was welcomed the principle of a helping hand, i.e. cooperation on bilateral level. The leadership of both administrations mutually expressed unequivocal mutual trust and a favorable climate for cooperation, as an example and encouragement for the other administrations of the countries of the region. The interlocutors exchanged experiences and views about debt management and strategies about access control and e- audit as key themes in the work of both governments. The interlocutors exchanged experiences and views about debt management and strategies about access control and e- audit as key themes in the work of both governments. The leadership of both administrations mutually expressed unequivocal mutual trust and a favorable climate for cooperation, as an example and encouragement for the other administrations of the countries of the region. Reduction ascending aortoplasty (RAA) is a technique for reduction of the aortic diameter, resulting in a reduced aortic wall stress and a diminished risk of rupture or dissection. Abstract Dilatation of the ascending aorta is often encountered during surgery for aortic valve disease. Mitrev, Zan and Mantov, Marko and Idoski, Enver and Dimitrovska, Maja and Hristov, Nikola and Ristov, Tome (2010) Midterm results following reduction ascending aortoplasty. Reduction ascending aortoplasty (RAA) is a technique for reduction of the aortic diameter, resulting in a reduced aortic wall stress and a diminished risk of rupture or dissection. Mitrev, Zan and Mantov, Marko and Idoski, Enver and Dimitrovska, Maja and Hristov, Nikola and Ristov, Tome (2010) Midterm results following reduction ascending aortoplasty. The aim of this study is to retrospectively analyze the preoperative results and follow up dimensions of the ascending aorta in 50 patients who underwent RAA along with other cardiac procedures in our institution.

This event is part of the project "Support to national Civil Society Platform/Forum", financed by the European Agency for Reconstruction, and coordinated by the Foundation Open Society Institute in Macedonia. At the same time throughout the meeting the Law of donations and sponsorships for public activities and its complete implementation were presented, and questions of common interest as well as the importance of developing philanthropy in Republic of Macedonia were discussed. The First Children Embassy in the world – Megjashi and the Centre for Institutional Development CIRa, implements it. CONSULTING MEETINGS ON THE LAW FOR DONATIONS AND SPONSORSHIPS OF PUBLIC ACTIVITIES With a purpose to achieve an effective usage of the Law of donations and sponsorships for public activities and as a possibility to support civil society activities of common interest, consultative meetings were held in Tetovo, Ohrid, Strumica, Debar, Struga and Gevgelija. The guidebook will also have a retrospective towards contract making for donations with business partners as well as suggestions about practical usage of it. CONSULTING MEETINGS ON THE LAW FOR DONATIONS AND SPONSORSHIPS OF PUBLIC ACTIVITIES With a purpose to achieve an effective usage of the Law of donations and sponsorships for public activities and as a possibility to support civil society activities of common interest, consultative meetings were held in Tetovo, Ohrid, Strumica, Debar, Struga and Gevgelija. Besides these consultative meetings, it is planned to organize other four consultative meetings, two tribunes and to publish a guidebook that will be useful for all civil society organizations enabling their activities that are in common interest, confirmed by the Ministry of Justice. The First Children Embassy in the world – Megjashi and the Centre for Institutional Development CIRa, implements it. At the meetings the Local Civil Society Organizations, the Local Self-government, the business sector and the local media were invited.

The Spirit, the one who impresses on us the will of God and the love for Christ. It’s not so much His prayer, but our prayer. You don’t have to see God through the broken glasses of your family experience. Christ reveals a connection between the vertical and the horizontal relationship—right in the middle of the Lord’s Prayer. What a beautiful truth! “Our Father” says we can share in the inheritance He gave through Christ—that we are a part of the heavenly family. The Bible says, “If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father … give good things to them that ask Him” (Matthew 7:11)? The phrase “the kingdom of God” is found 70 times in the New Testament. We need to say, “Lord, teach us to pray.” “Deliver us” takes us away from evil and separates us from it eternally. But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your trespasses” (Mark 11:25, 26 NKJV). It is the Spirit who gives the power to do the will of God. And so you have the Father, the Son, and the Spirit represented in the first three petitions of the Lord’s Prayer. ADDRESSING OUR GOD AS A FAMILY In the garden of Gethsemane, facing separation from the father, Christ petitioned God three times with, “Not My will, but yours, be done” (Luke 22:42 NKJV). God has convicted me that my prayers are too selfish, and I need to keep Him and others first in mind when I go to the Father in prayer. “FOR THINE IS THE KINGDOM, AND THE POWER, AND THE GLORY, FOR EVER” The central message in the book of Daniel is that the kingdoms and idols of the world, whether they are made of gold, silver, bronze, or clay will all disintegrate before the Rock of Ages—the kingdom of God. It is the Spirit who gives the power to do the will of God. In the Bible, the priority is reversed. Likewise, the first great commandment is to love the Lord, and the second great commandment is to love your neighbor. We need to be willing to forgive one another, and God points this out to us repeatedly in Scripture. The whole purpose of the plan of salvation is to defend the glory of God. Some people think they can pray the Lord’s Prayer and then sit back and do nothing, expecting Him to answer. Are you praying always? Recognize that it is essential to spend quality time with Christ in your personal and corporate prayers and devotions, so we can implement those changes in our lives that will glorify God. Take advantage of the “daily bread” of God’s Word, and communicate to God your desire to be transformed from selfish to selfless. You and I have no idea what’s going on behind the spiritual veil, which is why we have to pray, “Thy will be done in earth as it is in heaven.” You and I naturally have our wills twisted and confused by our carnal desires. The Christian’s motive is to bring honor to God, to give Him the glory. This is how the devil works with temptation—little compromises. In the Old Testament, His list of names includes: “Wonderful, Counselor, The mighty God, The everlasting Father” (Isaiah 9:6). He is powerful and omnipotent, yet He is also the all-sufficient provider. Taken together, He surely is the God of the universe ruling from heaven, but we can still approach Him personally as our Father. But when He made Adam, he took dust from the ground, formed it with His hands, and breathed life into it. He made humanity from the earth. Remember, though, that when we pray, “Give us … our daily bread,” it doesn’t mean that God expects us not to go out and earn it. Revisionists would have you believe that the signers of the Declaration of Independence were all pantheists, deists, or agnostics who didn’t have a lot of time for God. That’s why Satan hungers to be a god. When we pray the Lord’s Prayer, it must be in a spirit of complete surrender. Now the name of God is a central issue in the great controversy between good and evil. The essence of prayer is bound up in loving God with all our hearts, for we cannot really love Him if we aren’t getting to know Him. If we’re not communicating our sorrows and our joys, even our most intimate secrets, how can we love Him? Love the Lord, then your neighbor, and then you. (If you need an easy way to remember, just think of J-O-Y. Thus the purpose of the Christian, by God’s grace, is to defend the name of God as much as we can, to reveal who He really is. Bread represents many things in the Bible. But by the end of the prayer, the commander in charge said he was free to go. “I believe your story,” he said. Instead, the gospel says that we are to come just as we are to God, and He will forgive us. And our first petition to our God is “Hallowed be thy name.” We need to say, “Lord, teach us to pray.” “If you had not spent so much time at drill, you would not have performed so well during review.” He then added, “I can tell from the way you prayed that you are on regular speaking terms with God.” It’s not so much His prayer, but our prayer. When we pray for our daily bread, we’re really asking God to supply the basic necessities of our everyday lives. Of course, Jesus is the perfect example of doing God’s will here on the earth. Let’s stand together and lift our voices to heaven so that we are more united in the brotherhood and sisterhood of Jesus. I’m not sure how often that really means, but look at your own prayer life and see if it measures up. Daily bread, daily communion with the Lord, should be our top priority. Why do we not say, “Lord, give me a month’s supply”? Most of us don’t fret from day to day that the refrigerator is going to be empty, so we don’t often appreciate the implications of praying for daily bread. Without Him, we couldn’t even come to the Father. I am powerless on my own,” you are then giving Him the power to release His will in your life. The devil lives for pride, to bring glory to himself. How often do we need to be spiritually fed? I respectfully disagree with the notion that everything that happens is in accordance with the Creator’s will. “Please, Lord, we know you don’t want to tempt us. The times of our prayers should be frequent and regular, but even more important the content should be outward. Indeed, all the petitions in the Lord’s Prayer are only possible because Christ is the power. However, God says, “Now that you’re forgiven, I expect you to forgive each other.” I want you to take control. I surrender my will. We ought to be as concerned about the needs of others as much as, or more than, our own. I’m giving myself to you. Instead, the gospel says that we are to come just as we are to God, and He will forgive us.

On the back very often a metal attached elements resembling "ears" can be found, through which the belt was passed, and thus they were fastened to the belt. Due to their complexity, they can be treated as a document of their time, a style related to customs and military needs, which should be seen as a whole. For example, during the 18 century, the Italian influence was especially noticeable in this type of objects, due to the performed compositions with dominant vegetative motifs such as naturalistically processed flowers, then vases with fruits or flowers which are characteristic of the late Baroque, but also other similar motifs. In this type of objects, on the side parts, there are often two small handles through which a chain or a narrow leather cord was threaded with which they were hung around the neck. This type of palaski - fishekli is essentially considered the newest. The "palaski" were closed with a simple locker, on which, in some objects, a kind of handle can be seen, made in an embroidery technique with various decorative motifs such as birds, zoomorphic and vegetative displays. These items could also be worn around the neck, but for that purpose a leather or metal strap was placed on them. Due to this property, the term "pripojasnici" (belted cartridge box) has been preserved in the wider Balkan cultural area. In essence, this type of objects in our country is known most often as "palaski" or "fishekli", and less often as "enamluci". They also differed in part in their shape, usually rectangular with flat sides, but there are also examples of semi-rounded, arched sides. Their presence and representation of these works slowly began to fade during the period of the establishment of the regular army, and especially after the withdrawal of the Ottoman army. Brass boxes from the museum collections The motifs were made in the technique of embossing and they essentially follow the Islamic or Christian iconography, depending on the owner or the client of the particular object. These items, which were intended for military use or as an indicator of the military dignity of the individual, are true masterpieces of the masters of that time. They were mainly made by goldsmith masters, of which the Bitola masters stood out in our area. In the wider Balkan cultural area, these objects, according to their specifics, were found under different terms, such as: "palaski", "fisheklii", "enamluci", "pripojasnici" etc. The "palaski" were of different sizes. What is interesting about this type of objects is the fact that according to the present motives they were a kind of mixture of various cultural, artistic and religious influences, which were visible in this area not solely with the arrival of the Ottomans, but also as a result of trade relations and influences with other European centers, which is especially noticeable among the Bitola masters. The decorative motifs in this type of objects were mostly geometric, made in the technique of engraving and embossing. This is evidenced by the numerous preserved objects of this type throughout the Balkans. The objects made by the masters from Skopje, Tetovo, Bitola, Debar, were dominated by depictions of Christian saints, but complex Islamic motifs as well. In addition to carrying amulets, soldiers often used them to store firearm cartridges, which is why they are also referred to as "fiseklii" (ammunition cartridge box).

We believe that there are such and, in the foreseeable future, the Government will inform on the progress on finding alternatives, i.e. finding other sources and approaches to gas supply for Macedonia – said Stavreski. The current situation is not good for the entire Balkans, even for Southeast Europe. According to some, Macedonia has enough gas for the next five or six years, and there are alternatives, while, according to others, it is a problem which the Government should seriously consider. At the request of META for a comment regarding the situation with South Stream, representatives of the state owned joint-stock company Macedonian Energy Resources quoted the statement given yesterday by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Zoran Stavreski, in which he said that the future of the project South Stream is in the hands of Russia and the European Union and Macedonia cannot affect this issue. – It is a problem that is not solved and it is the job of the Government to solve it. This option is also possible with the pipeline which Gazprom will now build in Turkey to the border of Greece, where a liquefaction system would be installed, a possibility announced by the Russian President Vladimir Putin during his visit to Turkey a few days ago. There are alternatives for gas, but we should seriously work on them

Initially a stress factor or situation is mentioned. If left untreated, it can worsen in other situations, such as panic attacks, depressive syndrome, obsessive compulsive disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder, development of psychoactive substance dependence, social phobic disorder or other types of phobic disorder. 5 – All of these concerns are present daily and affect the functional ability of the individual and his or her ability to work. Patients are often overly concerned about their health, family or financial problems, death in the family or surroundings, problems with friends, problems with relationships with others, difficulties in the workplace, and so on. ANXIETY SHOULD BE TREATED ON TIME After prolonged use of sedatives there is an addiction and tolerance to them and often they become ineffective, warns d-r Chachev-Spanchevska. It often begins in childhood, and over time the disease progresses and manifests itself in middle age. Generalized anxiety disorder belongs to the group of anxiety disorders and is characterized by excessive, uncontrolled, often irrational care in daily functioning. In terms of therapy, the best results are achieved by the combined use of medications from the group of antidepressant cognitive behavioral psychotherapy, says d-r Chachev-Spanchevska. 3 – Physical symptoms require at least 3 of 6 – muscle cramping, cramps or cramping, tingling, headache, difficulty swallowing and breathing, fast heartbeat, sweating; They also often complain of a variety of physical difficulties – fatigue, headaches, nausea, vomiting, shaking hands and tensions, muscle strain, muscle aches, difficulty swallowing and breathing, decreased concentration, irritability, perspiration, restlessness, insomnia, heat waves, itching, difficulty controlling anxiety. With proper therapy, we manage to control the disease. Anxiety is a constant feeling of pressure, constriction, powerlessness to relax, lack of joy in life, says d-r Chachev-Spanchevska. She says excessive anxiety affects daily functioning, causing a feeling of near collapse. – The treatment should of course be carried out by a professional team of psychiatrists and psychologists. 4 – It is not about any other organic disease or comorbidity; Patients also often complain of a variety of physical difficulties – fatigue, headaches, nausea, vomiting, shaking hands and tensions, muscle tension and cramping, muscle aches, difficulty swallowing and breathing, decreased concentration, trembling, shaking, agitation, sweating, restlessness, insomnia, heat waves, itching, difficulty controlling anxiety. 1 – Excessive anxiety (constant worry over 6 months); When the disease develops, it can easily become chronic if left untreated and treated properly. If these symptoms persist for the last six months, then it is GAP. The condition occurs in all age groups, but is most common in middle-aged people. It is twice as common in the female population. Alcohol abuse is also common. Causes include genetic factors as a genetic predisposition that interact with environmental influences and psychological factors that can lead to disease. If these symptoms have been persistent for the last 6 months, then it is GAP- says the doctor. Scientists believe that there is a substantial impediment to the functioning of parts of the brain – the basal ganglia, which disrupt the concentration and exchange of protein molecules called neurotransmitters – she explains. It is advisable to learn some of the relaxation techniques, change of lifestyle and style, more physical activity, walks in nature. Because of the constant anxiety, patients often self-medicate for a longer period of time, which can further aggravate the condition – warns the doctor. SEDATIVES ADDICTION As d-r Bjanka Chachev-Spanchevska, a neuropsychiatrist at "Re-Medika" explains, symptoms last more than 6 months and are present daily.

Jason Adams (born 1975) is Senior Researcher/Full Professor at the Institute of Social Sciences and Humanities-Skopje and Co-Founder and Co-Director at the The New Centre for Research&Practice, as well as Editor-in-Chief of Conatus Publishing. Work Adams works in several fields including Political Theory, Political Economy, Cultural Studies and Media Studies. Jason Adams Jason Adams Jason Adams (born 1975) is Senior Researcher/Full Professor at the Institute of Social Sciences and Humanities-Skopje and Co-Founder and Co-Director at the The New Centre for Research&Practice, as well as Editor-in-Chief of Conatus Publishing. And in 2012, he completed his second Ph. D from the European Graduate School, where he focused on radical cultural and political thought with dissertation advisors Giorgio Agamben and Wolfgang Schirmacher. Jason Adams Education In 2002, Adams completed a BA in Political Economy & Social Change at The Evergreen State College, in Olympia, WA, USA. From 2004-2010, he was Managing Editor for the Johns Hopkins University Press journal Theory & Event, before founding Conatus Publishing. Following a Visiting Assistant Professorship at Williams College (2011-2012). In 2010, he completed his first Ph. He is author of Occupy Time: Technoculture, Immediacy and Resistance After Occupy Wall Street (Palgrave Macmillan), the co-editor of Deleuze and Race (Edinburgh University Press) and has written for such journals and periodicals as Radical Philosophy, boundary 2, Critical Inquiry, New Political Science, In These Times, TruthOut and Z Magazine.

The representatives of the IPA Project: Support to the fight against undeclared work, Mr. Geoffrey Fieldhouse, team leader, and Brian Kearney, an expert, had a presentation entitled: The role of social partners in the fight against undeclared work, in which they presented the survey on undeclared work conducted in country through 2019 successful interviews. In their presentations, the representatives of the CCM, Lile Petrova and Ljupco Vasilevski explained the meaning of the employment contract as a prerequisite for eradication of undeclared work and gave a comparative analysis of national legislation with EU legislation. The launch of the campaign, for which propaganda materials (posters and flyers) have been prepared, was followed by a press conference on which the President Mitrevski stressed that the campaign will include a series of measures referring to trainings for the unemployed. Low tax revenues owed to the lack of contributions from wages, limits the capacity of the Government to introduce effective policies for the labor market and social protection. The high incidence of informal employment has various negative consequences on the economy, working conditions in general and the process of policy-making. The Federation of Trade Unions and the Youth Section of the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia on 2.11.2015 started a campaign to combat gray economy, titled "Join in and say STOP to grey economy, say STOP to undeclared work" within the Project "Taxes, informal economy and corruption in the Western Balkan countries", implemented by the International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC), the Pan-European Regional Council (PERC) and the Norwegian Confederation of Trade Unions (LO). Additionally, the large segment of the informal economy and the widespread practice of reporting lower wages create serious problems for the scope and financing of social security systems, thus depriving these workers and their families from protection against the significant social risks. It is estimated that the informal employment accounts for more than 22.5% of total employment in the country (58 811 out of 271 307 employed women and 93 993 out of 407 531 employed men). On the panel debate his address had the President of CCM, PhD Zhivko Mitrevski, the President of the Youth Section, M. Lidija Naskovska, representatives of the IPA Project: Support to the fight against undeclared work, Mr. Geoffrey Fieldhouse, team leader, Brian Kearney, KE2 and representatives from the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia, Lile Petrova, CCM and Ljupco Vasilevski RTUO Bitola. Also they presented the current situation in Macedonia regarding the undeclared work, its size, scope and nature as well as presentation of various campaigns on informal economy in Europe and the world. This campaign will improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the fight against undeclared work in the country through a systematic and coordinated involvement of relevant institutional actors and social partners in the fight against undeclared work. - We start this campaign against this social evil, to combat illegal work. The analysis of previous studies has shown that approximately 22.5 percent of people are included in the informal economy in Macedonia, said, President Mitrevski. The President of CCM, PhD Zhivko Mitrevski noted that the formalization of the informal economy remains an area of high priority for the Federation of Trade Unions of Macedonia. The main objective of the panel debate is launching a campaign to combat grey economy and undeclared work, increasing the capacity and awareness among young people about this particular issue, learning ways of transition from informal to formal form of employment and strengthen the capacities of the various national actors involved in the fight against undeclared work. Participants on the panel debate

The purpose of this activity is through animation of the youngest, to raise awareness among the general population of healthy lifestyle through prevention of health and to convey the message that safe and healthy food has an important role. World Health Organization delivers the donation of freezers to the Ministry of Health/Institute of Public... The drawing with the most likes, is an illustration of the gratitude that received all pupils who drew a drawing, their teachers and the school. The initiative of the Institute of Public Health was welcomed by the schools and institutions whom donated paintings. The art works were published on the FB – profile of the Institute of Public Health. The message of World Food Day 2015 transferred through drawings Institute of Public Health of the Republic of Macedonia in cooperation with primary schools Johann Heinrich - Pestalozzi, Rajko Zinzifov, Peter Zdravkovski – Penko and Creative Center "Star" marked the World Food Day 2015 conveying the message: To turn the circle to the rural environment, in their drawings.

At the meeting in Tirana the WB leaders positively assessed the encouragement of the European Commission, the political and financial institutions of EU, the RCC, as well as the World Bank and other supporters of the European perspective in the region and extended the appreciation for implementation of initiatives arising from this process. The third meeting for enhancement of cooperation between the WB countries which takes place today in Tirana, started with the working part where President of the Government of the Republic of North Macedonia, Zoran Zaev, the Prime Minister of Albania Edi Rama and the presidents of Montenegro and Serbia, Milo Djukanovic and Aleksandar Vucic, discussed the progress of implementation of the four freedoms in the region, as assessed on the previous two meetings in Ohrid and Novi Sad. The spirit of inclusiveness and the good neighbourly relations that stimulated this process has brought several benefits for the citizens of the region. On such note, it is worth to underline the recent decisions adopted within CEFTA during the Albanian presidency, especially the decision for automatic recognition of the authorized economic operators, as well as the unification of the procedures for issuance of work permits for all citizens in all countries in the region. The tragedy caused by the earthquake in Durres stimulated the idea for the mutual support in natural disasters and emergencies to be included as another pillar in enhancement of the cooperation in the region and in that line, in February in Belgrade, the competent institutions of each of the WB countries will sign the Durres Protocol for cooperation of the Directorates for protection and rescue. The main objective of these One Stop Shops i.e. border controls with one stop is to soon become Non Stop Shop i.e. border crossings without stops. Another contribution to this procedure will be the implementation of the paperless system that is to simplify the customs procedures. Stimulated by the initiative for regional cooperation, the negotiations between Republic of Serbia and Republic of North Macedonia have been completed and very soon the construction of the new border crossing Lojane – Miratovac is expected to start until the next meeting of this initiative which will take place in Belgrade; the customs administrations of North Macedonia and Albania will sign the Agreement for One Stop Shop for the border crossing Kjafasan, as the one with Serbia on the border crossing Tabanovce. The leaders of the participating countries reaffirmed the view that this initiative is intended to reinforce the cooperation and to alleviate and accelerate the process of European integration for each of the WB countries and that it is open for all 6 countries in the region.

The Critical Thinking for Mediawise Citizens – Crithink project, implemented by Metamorphosis Foundation and Eurothink with the support from the European Union, as part of the Media Literacy Days in North Macedonia, yesterday held a public panel discussion on the results of research on media literacy and critical thinking conducted in the previous year. About 89% inform themselves from posts on Facebook, 59% from news aggregators, 49% are visiting the news portals directly," states part of the research presented by Mitrevski. Decline of critical thinking and rise of disinformation, propaganda, and hate speech The propaganda, disinformation, and the hatred present in the online media and the social networks are causing divisions among the citizens and that is manifesting through hate speech and threats.	Пропагандата, дезинформациите и омразата во онлајн медиумите и на социјалните мрежи предизвикува поделби меѓу граѓаните и тоа се манифестира преку говор на омраза и закани. The public is noticing constructed and false information. Petrit Sarachini's CIVIL – Center for Freedom organization which was observing the pre-election period, stressed that during the 21-day political campaign there were at least four efforts for organized action by orchestrated publishing of content with hate speech, disinformation, false news on online media and social networks with the goal to discredit, efforts for attacks on political opponents, and often attacks on persons who didn't participate in the election process. There are media that openly support political options, spread disinformation, and half-truths for the benefit of political centers of power.	Има медиуми што отворено фаворизираат политички опции, шират дезинформации и полувистини во корист на политичките центри на моќ. The TV is a dominant medium among the traditional ones and 83 % of the respondents inform themselves through TV.	Телевизијата е доминантен медиум од традиционалните и од неа се информираат 83 проценти од испитаниците. Most of the respondents think that the attractiveness of journalism as a profession is dropping constantly, the perception of low wages and bad working conditions is dominating, there is mistrust towards journalism as a profession including a drop in the journalistic standards and the freedom of expression. The findings have also shown that the citizens have an equal mistrust towards informing themselves both from the broadcasters and the portals. Internet media aren't subject to a media regulation and most of them which have no transparent ownership aren't part of the self-regulatory instruments. An interesting conclusion from this presentation is that 72% of the respondents receive the information through the Internet, but are checking these through the interactions with friends i.e. people from the closest surroundings, and not through their own authentic channels. Regarding the freedom of speech, Stefanovski also said that a huge step forward was made in the period from 2017 until today, but still, even according to the report from the European Commission, there is more that needs to be done. Half of the respondents consider that the political parties are the biggest source of pressure," concludes the research conducted by Metamorphosis and Eurothink, and was presented by Ivan Stefanovski. Regarding investigative journalism, it was determined that both financial capacities and the human resources are lacking, and almost all of the respondents have replied that additional skills, knowledge, and journalist training are necessary including greater media literacy for the citizens. The worsened financial situation of the media reflects with a low-quality journalism content, weak products, and accordingly low interest for employment.	Лошата економска состојба на медиумите се одразува со многу слаб квалитет на новинарски содржини, слаби продукти, а следствено на тоа и слаб интерес за вработување во оваа сфера. During the debate the importance of social responsibility on part of the big advertisers was stressed i.e. they should be aware of where they are advertising themselves and to support the true values of professional journalism. About 60% of the respondents have replied that the news from the portals is politically colored, consider the events as constructed, and untrue stories are presented. The hate speech also endures because of the impunity and the passiveness of the authorized institutions," said Nikodinoska. Gjorgji Mitrevski from the Research Institute on Social Development RESIS presented researches made by the Agency for Audio and Audio-Visual Services including OSCE where they presented the habits of the citizens in relation to traditional media and the Internet as sources of information, including the age group that is using the Internet as a source of information. Vesna Nikodinoska presented the research conducted by the Macedonian Institute for Media – MIM which states that hate speech, propaganda, and disinformation have marked a long and dark period in the political and media spheres during the period between 2008-2016, and these were again evident during this year as they are on the rise especially on the Internet. Very often, the hatred from the virtual world is spilling into reality resulting in incidents, threats with weapons, vandalism, attacks, violence. She even stressed the role of companies as advertisers at online media and noticed those that continuously violate professional and ethical standards have more adverts than the informative portals. During the discussion, prof. Žaneta Trpeska, PhD, from RESIS pointed out the importance of the integrity of research efforts, and informed the public that RESIS has started an initiative for adoption of code of ethics relevant to research activities within the Media Literacy Network, which would cover aspects of protection of human rights of people being surveyed, as well as aspects of transparency and accountability towards the audience. He also said that we have little but not enough successes for self-regulation among the media since those that are creating provocative content are not part of the self-regulatory mechanisms. Over 50% of the respondents are checking the truthfulness through conversations with close acquaintances and only a small percentage is checking them through research and comparison with relevant sources," said Mitrevski. The state hasn't neither enough mechanisms to deal with disinformation nor that mechanism that we have at our disposal are used accordingly to decrease the series of felonies," said Sarachini.

Vision: at least one Handicrafts4u product in every home Mission: sustainability of the Center for creative expression and relaxation for persons with disabilities, as a social enterprise (SOLEM), through craftsmanship and selling of handmade designers' products for socially responsible companies and organizations, through the handicrafts4u brand. Where to buy: Everyone interested in the handicrafts4u products can contact us by phone, our Facebook page or visit us in offices of Association SOLEM. Handicrafts4u has included the staff of SOLEM and its members in all the phases of the planning, designing, production, promotion and selling the products. MATA aims to foster the development of the design and craft sector in Macedonia and achieve tangible social changes and benefits for designers, artisans and craft micro enterprises, by providing assistance in product development, market access and capacity building. Few of the unique lines of products (home and personal accessories) are designed by the MATA team and are made by persons with intellectual disabilities that attend the Center for creative expression and relaxation in Association SOLEM. Association SOLEM supports the deinstitutionalization process for persons with disabilities in the Republic of Macedonia through their active involvement in SOLEM's programmes. Handicrafts4u practices the social enterprise concept. Few of the unique lines of products (home and personal accessories) are designed by the MATA team and are made by persons with intellectual disabilities that attend the Center for creative expression and relaxation in Association SOLEM. The realization of production was made with guidance by the assistants of the persons with intellectual disabilities. Within the Centre for creative expression and relaxation, adult persons with intellectual disabilities gain skills for modeling, tailoring, sewing, manual and unique printmaking using different kinds of monoprinting techniques, like stenciling, stamping etc. The final products are unique, with original designs, handmade of textile, felt and vinyl. Association SOLEM works on several programmes: Creative Centre for adults with intellectual disabilities, Computer Workshops, SelfAwareness and Self Advocacy Workshops and Workshops for Tailoring and Sewing. The goal is acquiring new skills and enhancing the selfconfidence of the persons with disabilities. This brand is an excellent example for successful cooperation between different creative profiles who are promoting the skills and work of persons with disabilities of different age and gender, different expertise and capabilities. SOLEM is a citizen association for supporting persons with disabilities founded in 2008.
